title: SECRETARY / EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT
company_info: Established in 1988, MTM Ship Management has emerged as a leading provider of ship management for over 65 vessels consisting of chemical tankers, product tankers, LPG vessels, Container vessels and Bulk Carriers. In our pursuit for excellence we are seeking a dynamic individual with a passion for people development who can bring about a change not only in the people working ashore but also on board the ships.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:

Ø Provide full secretarial and administrative support to the Managing Director
Ø Assist in the analysis of various processes and prepare agendas, presentation slides, reports as necessary
Ø Prepare reports, presentations, and correspondence accurately and swiftly.
Ø Perform accurate research and analysis on Maritime / Shipping industry if required.
Ø Coordinate arrangements, meetings and conferences as assigned.
Ø Take dictation and write correspondence.
Ø Daily record keeping and filing of documents
Ø Create and organize information and generate reference tools for easy use.
Ø Answer and screen telephone calls and respond to emails, messages, and other correspondence.
Ø Manage calendar, meeting coordination and travel arrangements.
Ø Ensure efficient and effective administrative information and assistance.

Requirements:

Ø Degree / Diploma in Business Administration or relevant field preferred.
Ø 2 years of experience in an executive support role in Shipping industry is an advantage.
Ø Methodical thinker with detailed research proficiencies
Ø Thorough understanding of clerical and secretarial principles.
Ø Strong knowledge of databases and tracking systems.
Ø Good organizational skills and detail oriented
Ø Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Ø Good written and verbal communication skills
Ø Proficient in Microsoft Office.

title: Personal Assistant
company_info: cAL — a space for modern self care that bridge the gap between medical-grade treatments and beauty. Our goal is to make these services more accessible and affordable for everyone — we believe that everyone deserves access to high quality, safe, reliable, and effective beauty options.
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Customer Service, General Management, Personal Care / Beauty, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a dedicated and organised Personal Assistant to support the CEO. You will play a crucial role in managing the CEO's schedule, handling administrative tasks, and facilitating smooth communication within the organisation. If you are a proactive and adaptable individual with excellent organisational and communication skills, we invite you to join our team.
Responsibilities:
Manage the CEO's calendar, schedule appointments, and coordinate meetings, ensuring efficient time management.
Prepare and organise documents, reports, presentations, and correspondence for internal and external communications.
Screen and manage incoming calls, emails, and inquiries, redirecting or responding as appropriate.
Assist in organising and coordinating events, meetings, and conferences, including logistics and travel arrangements.
Act as a liaison between the CEO and other team members, departments, clients, and vendors.
Conduct research and gather information to support the CEO's decision-making process.
Prioritise and manage tasks and projects to ensure deadlines are met and objectives are achieved.
Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and handle matters with discretion.
Assist in personal tasks and errands as required to support the CEO's professional and personal responsibilities.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Communication, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Proven experience as a Personal Assistant or Executive Assistant, preferably in a fast-paced business environment.
Exceptional organisational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to multitask effectively.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including proficiency in business correspondence.
Strong problem-solving abilities and the capacity to work independently with minimal supervision.
Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other relevant software.
Professional demeanour and the ability to interact confidently.
Discretion and the ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with integrity.
Flexibility and adaptability to accommodate changing priorities and tasks.
Interested candidate, please email resume to connect@cal.sg.

title: Executive Assistant (Admin) @Woodlands Nursing Home
company_info: Company Overview Ren Ci Hospital is an established Voluntary Welfare Organization (VWO) in rehabilitative and geriatric care, primarily serving the elderly community in Singapore. Ren Ci (??) means loving kindness and compassion which became the guiding principles in our delivery of affordable medical, nursing and rehabilitative care services, serving all regardless of background, race and religion. Our spectrum of care includes a community hospital, a chronic sick unit, two nursing homes and three day centres offering day rehab, day care and centre-based nursing services. Over the years, Ren Ci has evolved and expanded its services to meet the needs of a rapidly ageing population in Singapore, leverage on partnerships and engagement with the community to give dignity back to the elderly. As a dynamic healthcare organisation, we are looking for suitable professionals who have a passion for serving the elderly and who wish to build a career in the community care sector.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
BROAD FUNCTION
Provide front desk functions such as assisting clients, coordinating admissions, billing, and other administrative duties at the Business Office of Ren Ci @ Woodlands.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide front desk assistance to clients at the Business Office or via phone calls or emails.
Perform financial counselling for new admissions.
Coordinate admissions of residents / clients to Nursing Home (NH) / Senior Care Centre (SCC).
Provide administrative support such as accurate and timely billing to client, regular monitoring of payments & debts, and accurate and timely submission of data to relevant authorities.
Assist residents / clients with the application of government grants/subsidies (e.g., financial assistance grants).
Manage daily administrative functions of NH and SCC.
Arrange and coordinate for meetings, including preparing and distributing documents.
Support in the preparation of reports, dashboard, statistics, and presentation material for internal and external stakeholders.
Maintain the filing system / records to ensure timely retrieval of files and record when required.
Assist in the management of petty cash.
Support the Operations team when required.
Assist in welfare activities as and when necessary.
Perform other duties as and when assigned by Executive Director.

REQUIREMENTS
Minimum Diploma in any field.
Preferably 5 years of relevant working experience in healthcare industry or eldercare
Setting.
Strong proficiency in MS Office Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Able to adapt and use different software applications.
Good interpersonal, communication and organisational skills.
Good oral and written English.
Good team player.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate to add value to the life quality of the elderly and enthusiastic of client interaction.

title: Programme Assistant / Executive / Senior Programme Executive - CareLibrary
company_info: Care Community Services Society was founded in 1996 by Trinity Christian Centre. CCSS is a registered charity affiliated with the National Council of Social Service (NCSS). We are an Institution of Public Character (IPC). At CCSS, we are not content simply to see someone helped; we want to see individuals and families transformed and become empowered people who are then channels of blessing for others in the larger community. Care Community Services Society is called to serve the community and to influence and equip individuals and families for empowered living through all generations. Sounds ambitious? Perhaps. But it is possible, for we have seen it happen – right here at CCSS!
employment_type: Contract, Part Time, Freelance, Permanent, Flexi-work
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
CareLibrary provides person-centered care for senior adults with/is at risk of cognitive impairment through non-pharmacological methods. In a vibrant, safe and supportive environment, our trained dementia care staff strives to maintain cognitive wellness and slow down cognitive decline of our clients through multi- sensory stimulating activities, with the aim of retaining their functional abilities and social engagement within the community.

Job Description
Establish and maintain good interpersonal relationships with clients, caregivers, volunteers and the community
Facilitating cognitive activities for the dementia participants
Handling and managing the participants with the duty of care, exhibit the spirit of team player to ensure that cohesive work relationships for the best interest for our participants
Ensuring the safety and quality aspects of care delivery
Assisting in sourcing and creation of cognitive activities to improve and refresh resources/activities used
Performing general operations and administration necessary for the daily operation at the centre
Assisting in volunteer management and conduct orientation program
Performing any ad-hoc duties assigned by Supervisor

Requirements
Relevant experience in geriatric services and program execution for dementia clients
Relevant education in mental health, social work or related field study in gerontology
Basic knowledge of Microsoft Word and Microsoft Excel
Ability to communicate with clients who are English and Mandarin speaking
A team player who is able to work cohesively with the department and an individual who have a passion and desire to work with the dementia clients

title: Programme Assistant / Programme Executive - Active Aging Centre
company_info: Care Community Services Society was founded in 1996 by Trinity Christian Centre. CCSS is a registered charity affiliated with the National Council of Social Service (NCSS). We are an Institution of Public Character (IPC). At CCSS, we are not content simply to see someone helped; we want to see individuals and families transformed and become empowered people who are then channels of blessing for others in the larger community. Care Community Services Society is called to serve the community and to influence and equip individuals and families for empowered living through all generations. Sounds ambitious? Perhaps. But it is possible, for we have seen it happen – right here at CCSS!
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Join our CareElderly team at our Active Aging Centres to keep the seniors active and empower them with a renewed sense of purpose to become channels of support in the community! Currently positioned at 2 different locations at Circuit Road and Serangoon North, serving the seniors in the surrounding blocks, including rental blocks.

As a Programme Assistant/Programme Executive, you will be impacting seniors’ lives by promoting active ageing, preventing social isolation and rendering inter-generational activities through a holistic range of programmes, support in providing concierge services in an elderly-friendly and hygienic environment.

Job requirements
A passion and desire to work with the seniors
Ability to plan, develop and implement programmes to meet the needs of the seniors
Ability to engage, befriend and motivate the seniors through facilitating activities or programmes
A self-motivated team player and enjoy working with different profiles of elderly
Able to perform administration and the Microsoft office literacy
Good interpersonal skills and possess energetic enthusiasm to support in outreach activities, home visits and conducting assessments using Community Screening Tool
5-day work-week

title: Executive Assistant
company_info: The Singapore Manufacturing Federation (SMF), formerly known as the Singapore Manufacturers' Association, was first established in 1932. Its main aim is to champion the Singapore manufacturing sector. Our mission is to represent the interest of the Singapore manufacturing community and to drive its competitiveness and sustainable growth through serving industry-specific needs. SMF is supported by 10 industry groups to serve diverse industry-specific needs, as well as 6 Centres of Excellence to offer our members a holistic approach towards improving competitiveness, upgrading skills and capitalising on new technologies. With a membership of over 3,000 corporate members ranging from MNCs to SMEs, SMF carries out a myriad of activities to enhance the competitive edge of our members. Our Council As a not-for-profit organisation, SMF is governed by a Council whose members hail from some of Singapore's most established and progressive companies. Through our strong links with the government, we are suitably qualified to represent our members objectively and to facilitate communication between the government, foreign delegates and the manufacturing community. Our Offerings Business Matching Events Trade Missions Networking Sessions Forums, Conferences, Seminars and Workshops Dialogues with Government Agencies Standards development
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Executive Assistant
We are seeking a professional who provides secretariat support to the executive and management office. This role is crucial for maintaining the smooth operation of the executive's office and enabling the management team to focus on their core responsibilities.

Responsibilities
Manage calendar of appointments and schedule, prioritize tasks, and effectively help to manage the executives’ time.
Handling of correspondence including emails, phone calls, inquiries, etc.
Travel arrangement including planning and organizing travel itineraries, etc.
Preparation of letters, reports, presentations and other documents as required.
Management of meetings including set-up, facilitating, proposing agendas, minutes taking, following up on action items, etc.
Assisting with special projects or initiatives, executing project-related tasks, etc
Ability to handle confidential matters with discretion and maintain trust is crucial.
Maintaining and organizing records, files, and documents in a systematic manner.
Requirements
At least a Diploma in Business Administration or related discipline.
With minimum 2-3 years of working experience supporting a team or senior executive.
With strong organizational and excellent communication skills.
A proactive, resourceful and meticulous individual.
Ability to multi-task and execute tasks efficiently.
Preferably tech-savvy ie. proficient with various software tools, communication platforms, and office applications.

title: Executive Assistant (CEO's Office)
company_info: Lucence was founded by Dr. Min-Han Tan in 2016 to solve the most complex diagnostic problems in medicine through innovative technology. A world leader in medicine, Dr. Tan’s research has spanned diverse fields of clinical medicine, human genetics and medical data analytics to regularly rewrite orthodoxy. He is recognized internationally for his landmark discovery of the circulating tumor-endothelial cell clusters in the blood of cancer patients, which overturned a 50-year scientific dogma and led to a new way of looking at cancer. Infused with the same DNA of relentless innovation, Lucence is focused on delivering advanced cancer diagnostic tests to improve cancer care. Our team consists of physicians, scientists, technologists, geneticists, bioinformaticians and data analysts who are committed to fighting cancer.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Lucence is a precision oncology company with international operations. Join us in bringing better cancer care to the world as part of the Management team.

Key responsibilities for this role
Being part of a fast-growing company, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth functioning of the company by providing efficient administrative and secretarial support. Your ability to maintain confidentiality, manage complex schedules, and handle sensitive information with utmost discretion will be essential in this role. Some of the key areas you will be involved in include:

Calendar and Schedule Management: Coordinate and manage the schedules of senior executives, ensuring efficient time management and resolving scheduling conflicts.
Travel Arrangements: Organize travel itineraries, including flight bookings, accommodation, transportation, and visa processing, while considering time zone differences and optimizing travel expenses.
Meeting Coordination: Schedule and arrange internal and external meetings, video conferences, and conference calls, preparing relevant materials and ensuring all necessary participants are informed.
Correspondence and Communication: Handle incoming and outgoing communications, including email, phone calls, and written correspondence, while maintaining professionalism and confidentiality.
Document Preparation: Prepare, review, and format documents, presentations, reports, and other materials as requested by the CEO.
Data Management: Organize and maintain electronic files, databases, and records, ensuring data accuracy and easy retrieval.
Event Planning: Assist in organizing company events, conferences, and off-site meetings, coordinating logistics and managing guest arrangements.
Information Security: Handle sensitive and confidential information with the utmost discretion and maintain a high level of professionalism and integrity.
Liaison: Serve as a liaison between senior management and various departments, fostering effective communication and collaboration.
Communications: Execute seamless communication strategies and craft compelling written materials to support executive functions and enhance organizational effectiveness.
Miscellaneous Support: Provide ad-hoc support to executives as required, which may include personal errands or tasks.
To be a good fit for this role, you would have:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience is preferred.
At least 2 years of relevant working experience in the field as an Executive Assistant or in a similar administrative support role is preferred. Startup experience would be advantageous.
Flexibility in attending to international operations in a different time zone.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple deadlines, and adapt to changing priorities.
Demonstrated ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with the utmost discretion.
Proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other relevant software for document preparation and communication.
Capable of working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, and willingness to take on new challenges.
Meticulous attention to detail, ensuring accuracy in all tasks and deliverables.
Professionalism: Maintain a professional and polished demeanor at all times, both in appearance and communication.
Willingness to work outside regular business hours, if necessary.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The position of Executive Assistant reports to the Officers to provide full administrative and executive business support to the Officers in a responsive, timely, accurate and effective manner. Assignment involves work of a confidential nature, exposure to sensitive information and contacts requiring considerable discretion, judgment, tactful and diplomacy.
Salary up to $5500
Location: Kaki Bukit
ACCOUNTABILITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide full spectrum of logistical, administrative and personal support to the Officers.
Manage Officers’ calendars and schedules, ensuring accuracy and timely input. Provide agenda and meeting materials as needed.
Manage the travel and logistics arrangements, and process claims/expenses.
Interact professionally with all levels of management, staff and external parties across the region and internationally. Work with the Officers’ direct reports and stakeholders locally and regionally on day-to-day operational issues, meetings and other matters, maintaining a high level of communication and ensure timely and accurate sharing of information.
Schedule and setting up various local/regional meetings, arrange meeting venue and refreshment, and help facilitate at these meetings where necessary. Manage/assist in the logistic arrangements such as flights, hotel, transportation, visa application etc.
Coordinate government official’s visits by collaborating with respective departments for necessary preparations to ensure smooth proceedings. This includes but is not limited to arrangements for meeting venues, logistics, meals etc.
Support the Officer in following up on the status of projects / cross-functional tasks and assignments when required. Collaborate with other teams to ensure policies, procedures and timelines are met.
Assist in the preparation of business reports, presentations, materials, collating of data and consolidating of reports from the region.
Communicate on behalf of the Officers when delegated.
Support the Officers in the management of his/her IT equipment (e.g., laptop, printers and office phone), mobile devices as well as personal and corporate software applications.
Be responsive to emails/ text messages/ phone calls, with contact outside normal business hours where needed.
Manage proper archival and management of documents.
Any other job/task assigned by Officers.
Requirements
4 years working experience in corporate / executive office, preferably with administrative/executive experience in a fast-pace MNC setting.
Requires a high level of interpersonal, social and customer service skills for daily interactions, both in person and digitally and work cooperatively as a team member.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Fluency in English required, other language skills are a plus.
High proficiency in Microsoft Office 365, especially Excel and Power Point with the ability to produce graphs and charts.
Demonstrated strong planning, organisational and time management skills and ability to proactively determine priorities and appropriate sequencing to accomplish daily expectations and handle multiple demands
Interested candidates may apply through the application system. We regret to inform only Shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Roles & Responsibilities
You are invited to join Acclaim, one of the largest national risk advisory, insurance and reinsurance brokers in Singapore, in a key managerial position. Acclaim is the 1st Corporate Risk and Insurance Consulting Firm to be a winner since inauguration of Enterprise 50 (E50). Work under the supervision of Marine Broking Managers in providing marine insurance broking advice and insurance placement for clients including Hull and Machinery, Protection & Indemnity, Commodities and other marine classes:

Collate documents and information relating to claims as received from various parties.
Monitor clients’ statement of accounts and collection of premiums.
Undertake relevant training and examinations as necessary to carry out role and fulfil Continuing Professional Development (CPD) requirements.

Review list of renewal business on regular basis, timely renewal preparation and necessary action to ensure expiring policies are renewed.

Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma in Business Studies/Administration/Management or Certificate in General Insurance from the Singapore College of Insurance or equivalent.
Positive work attitude and good interpersonal skills
Good time management and adherence to timeline
Strong IT skills including excel and pivot table
Preference will be given to candidates with working experience in the related field.

title: Assistant Executive Housekeeper
company_info: Gazetted as Singapore’s 71st National Monument, The Fullerton Hotel Singapore was once home to the General Post Office, The Singapore Club and the Chamber of Commerce. The 400-room luxury hotel is dynamically located in the heart of the financial and arts districts, and carefully designed to provide both business and leisure travellers with a sanctuary of serenity and comfort in which to retreat and rejuvenate. https://www.fullertonhotels.com/careers.html
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
To plan, organize, recruit, execute and control the functions of the housekeeping department.
To be responsible for directing, supervising and co-coordinating the activities of housekeeping and ensuring the smooth operations which includes rooms, public areas, laundry, uniform/linen rooms and pool area.
To maintain the highest standard of cleanliness, presentation and efficiency while achieving guest satisfaction. To supervise and co-ordinate the works of housekeeping contractors

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
To co-ordinate with the Human Resources department in the selection of housekeeping staff.
To plan, recommend and develop on job training for housekeeping staff.
To ensure staff thoroughly understands the house and departmental rules and regulations.
To regularly evaluate staff performance and provide recommendations for transfers and promotions.
To co-ordinate and communicate effectively with other departments as well as within the department.
To keep all employees informed on significant aspects of the hotel, communicating with all levels of staff.
To carry out daily inspection of the hotel in all areas and to ensure the housekeeping standards are maintained to the highest level.
To develop standard procedures for routine tasks so as to enable employees to develop consistent work habits.
To establish inventory records and control of cleaning supplies, chemicals, and guest supplies, Rooms and F & B linens.
To conduct inventory of the Rooms and F&B linen together with the Finance department.
To ensure that staff receive training for any new products or equipment introduced to Housekeeping
To effectively schedule staff so as to maximize the manpower available.
To establish Lost & Found procedures and ensure proper recording and safe keeping of such items.
To establish and ensure a good system of administration and record keeping for housekeeping.
To co-ordinate closely with the Engineering Department for any maintenance works to be carried out.
To ensure that all equipment used by housekeeping is in good repair and is serviced regularly.
To oversee the smooth operations in the Linen/Uniform Room and Laundry.
To ensure that laundry services are of the highest quality for hotel guests, and staff uniforms.
To provide a warm and conducive environment for the housekeeping department, so that morale is kept at a high level.
To counsel, motivate and discipline staff as required.
To ensure employees and self adhere to hotel grooming standards.
To ensure that the floral arrangements are of good quality and aesthetically pleasing to the eyes, in all areas of the hotel.
To ensure tailoring of uniforms are of highest quality.
To comply with the hotel rules and regulations as well as the policies and procedures set by the hotel and management.
To identify opportunities in Housekeeping and to take the necessary corrective action(s).
To liaise with and co-ordinate the works of the housekeeping contractors.
To attend meetings as required.
To assist in the preparation of annual housekeeping budget.
To be fully familiar with hotel Fire Safety and Security Procedures and to comply with such and ensure housekeeping staff are properly guided.
To perform any other duties other than these above which are requested by the hotel management/direct supervisor.

title: Assistant Executive Housekeeper
company_info: Worldwide Hotels currently owns and manages six hotel brands in Singapore, namely Hotel Boss, V Hotel, Hotel Mi, Value Hotel, Venue Hotel and Hotel 81. With a current combined total of 38 hotels islandwide and over 6,500 rooms, Worldwide Hotels is Singapore’s leading tourist class hotel group, providing affordable accommodation with an undiscounted experience for travellers visiting Singapore. Worldwide Hotels’ vision is to be the world’s leading Singapore brand hotel group. Worldwide Hotels has acquired properties in Asia Pacific including Malaysia, Thailand and Australia; with more developments in the pipeline as the Group continues to grow its footprint in the Asia Pacific and beyond.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Follow the hotel's standard procedures for cleaning and maintaining public areas.
Collaborate with the Front Office, Engineering, and other departments to handle guests' requests, inquiries, and complaints about accommodation, service, and billing. Ensure that these interactions are carried out effectively to enhance guest satisfaction with their stay and services.
Work closely with the Engineering Department to address any issues or defects in the rooms and public areas promptly.
Supervise pest eradication activities with great attention to detail.
Conduct daily inspections of public areas and employee locker rooms.
Coordinate with the maintenance department to establish a preventive maintenance schedule for rooms and public areas.
Regularly spot check employees' performance, correcting any mistakes or deficiencies.
Conduct regular training sessions to ensure that personnel follow established procedures, address any issues, provide instructions, and assign duties.
Undertake any additional duties assigned by the GM or Executive Housekeeper (EHK) as needed.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Degree or Diploma in Hospitality Management or other relevant qualification is preferred.
Minimum 4 years’ related experience in a full-service hotel or mid-range hotel is preferred.
A team player and takes initiative to assist other team members when required
Commitment to work rotating shift and any day, including weekends and public holidays.
Meticulous with strong attention to details with good follow-up.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Highlights
Flexi Work Arrangement
Competitive Career Growth Package for Salary
Corporate Benefit (Corporate Discount, Insurance, Incentives)
Work Location: Queenstown
Job Description
We are looking for a dedicated Junior HR Business Partner to assist the HR Manager in HR operations, managing and administering payroll processes, and benefit management.
This position is responsible to conduct HR end-to-end employee life cycle ensuring accurate and timely payment of employee salaries, benefits, and deductions, while also maintaining compliance with relevant regulations and internal policies. The incumbent will require to collaborate with internal stakeholders, employees, and external vendors to deliver high-quality HR services and drive employee satisfaction. This also includes interacts with employees and external vendors to address HR-related inquiries and resolve issues effectively.

Job Description:
Recruitment: Manage the recruitment process, including job postings, sourcing, screening, and interviewing candidates. Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies. Conduct background checks and reference checks for potential candidates. Prepare and extend employment offers.
Payroll Administration: Serve as the primary point of contact for payroll administration, managing and executing end-to-end payroll processes. This includes collecting and reviewing time and attendance data, verifying salary information, calculating deductions and withholdings, processing payroll, and distributing paychecks or facilitating electronic transfers.
Payroll Compliance: Stay updated on relevant labor laws, tax regulations, and payroll compliance requirements. Ensure payroll practices align with legal requirements, including tax filings, deductions, and reporting. Maintain accurate payroll records and support internal and external audits.
HR Process Management: Assist the HR manager to execute various HR processes, including employee onboarding and offboarding, employee data management, performance management, leave management, and employee recordkeeping. Ensure compliance with policies, procedures, and legal requirements.
HR Systems Administration: Manage and maintain HR systems, such as HRIS (Human Resources Information System) under HR system. Ensure accurate data entry and update employee records, process payroll, and generate reports. Collaborate with IT or vendors to implement system enhancements.
Training Program: Assist HR manager for in-house and external training programmes registration for staff.
Employee Relations: Assist in handling employee inquiries related to payroll, recruitment, HR policies, procedures, and benefits. Provide guidance and support to employees on various HR-related matters, including performance management, disciplinary actions, and conflict resolution.
HR Reporting and Analytics: Prepare HR reports and metrics related to payroll, recruitment, employee data, headcount, turnover, and other relevant HR statistics. Conduct data analysis to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for process improvement.
HR Project: Work with HR manager on assigned HR Projects.
Vendor Management: Coordinate and collaborate with external vendors, such as payroll providers and recruitment agencies. Ensure timely and accurate delivery of services, resolve any vendor-related issues, and maintain strong vendor relationships.
Continuous Improvement: Work with HR manager, by providing feedback, identifying opportunities to streamline HR processes, enhance efficiency, and improve the employee experience. Propose and implement process improvements, automation initiatives, and best practices, specifically focusing on payroll administration and recruitment processes.
Requirement:
Diploma/Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Accounting, Business Management, Business Administration, or a related field (equivalent work experience may be considered)
Proven work experience in HR operations, including payroll administration and recruitment
Sound knowledge of HR processes, policies, and procedures
Experience working with HRIS, payroll software, and other HR systems, Infotech
Strong understanding of labor laws, tax regulations, and compliance requirements related to payroll and recruitment
Excellent data management and analytical skills, with proficiency in MS Excel or other data analysis tools
Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry, calculations, and reporting.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to resolve complex payroll issues
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with employees and external vendors
High level of integrity and ability to handle sensitive and confidential information appropriately
Continuous learning mindset to stay updated on industry trends and best practices in payroll administration.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels
Strong organizational and time management skills

title: Executive Assistant, Corporate & Investment Banking
company_info: About J.P. Morgan J.P. Morgan has been a leader in helping companies grow and markets develop throughout our history. We collaborate across the globe to deliver the solutions and advice to meet our clients’ needs, anywhere in the world. We operate in 100 countries and hold global leadership positions across our businesses. When you join J.P. Morgan you’ll be: working with a team committed to being the best; earning the trust of our clients; demanding excellence of yourself. What makes this the best place to build your career? Because we’ll make the most of all your talents, not just your technical skills. We’ll challenge you, but we’ll also make being here as stimulating and diverse as your life is. You’ll be given the tools, training and support needed to help us keep doing first-class business in a first-class way, as we have for over 200 years. Our global platform allows you to have more mobility, choices and opportunities to contribute than you ever imagined. It all adds up to the perfect opportunity to take your career further with us.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
DESCRIPTION/RESPONSIBILITIES:
J.P. Morgan's Corporate & Investment Bank is looking to hire a top performing executive assistant to support diverse teams. A successful Executive Assistant should have excellent interpersonal skills, attention to detail, quality focus, smart, possess a “can-do” attitude, high energy and flexibility to a high-paced deadline driven organization. In this role you will need to work well in a team environment, be able to represent the manager/group with professional courtesy and acumen and deliver flawless work output. Your daily routine also includes interaction with various executive level internal clients across the lines of businesses. You will need to adapt procedures, processes and techniques to complete assignments in line with the department's activities and goals.

As an Executive Assistant, you will be responsible for performing an array of administrative functions requiring confidentiality, initiative and sound decision making for the executive, their team of managers, and other stakeholders. You bring years of experience being an Executive Assistant while being very adaptable, and welcoming change.

You confidently make independent decisions when handling administrative tasks. You develop an understanding of what matters to the team you are supporting, and you actively apply that knowledge to your day-to-day activities. You act as an owner and a problem solver.

You possess superior communication skills, both written and oral. You are clear, concise and to the point. Your phone etiquette is excellent, and you have a sense of ownership to always follow-up when required. You know when to use tact and discretion when dealing with confidential matters.

Job responsibilities:
• Strong ability to manage and handle complex and detailed calendars, dealing with multiples and or urgent meeting conflicts, setting up of meetings and conference calls, internally and externally. Handle all associated logistical aspects
• Ability to work in a fast paced, ever changing environment and to effectively handle multiple priorities with a calm, professional and willing attitude
• Telephone Coverage and ability to answer phones professionally, address issues or redirect as appropriate, and distribute messages in a timely and appropriate manner
• Arrange and coordinate complicated domestic and international travel arrangements (air, hotel accommodations and ground transportation); prepare detailed itineraries, required travel visas/documents, and assure accuracy and timely delivery of plans/tickets to travelers
• Process invoices and T&E expense claims for team members timely. Ensure all policies are followed and items are processed within provided guidelines. Act as a subject matter expert for policies and procedures
• Open to take on increased and/or new responsibilities at any time
• Assist with overflow, special projects, assistant back-up coverage and day-to-day tasks
• Assist with staff on-boarding and off-boarding, which includes requesting equipment setup and system access

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:
• Secretarial / administrative professional certification
• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in an Executive Assistant role in financial institutions, ideally supporting a team of all levels
• Tact and good judgment in confidential situations and proven experience interacting with senior management
• Strong interpersonal and partnership skills, i.e. develop relationships with peers, clients etc.
• Open to take on increased and/or new responsibilities at any time
• Good problem-solving ability
• Adaptable team player
• Experience in calendar management
• Excellent telephone etiquette
• Strong working experience with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
• Knowledge of general office procedures (e.g., scheduling, expenses, calendar)
• Superior oral and written communication skills

To apply for this position, please use the following URL:
https://ars2.equest.com/?response_id=88d07046950a9c531f367b0446f64311

company: SABANA REAL ESTATE INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT PTE. LTD.
company_info: Listed on Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited since 26 November 2010, Sabana REIT has a diversified property portfolio valued at S$1.0 billion as at 31 December 2017, comprising 19 properties strategically located across Singapore. Sabana REIT has four main industrial property segments: High-tech Industrial, Chemical Warehouse and Logistics, Warehouse and Logistics and General Industrial. As at 31 December 2017, Sabana REIT continued to be one of the largest listed Shari'ah compliant industrial real estate investment trusts ("REIT") in the world in terms of total asset size. The Trust is managed by an external manager, Sabana Real Estate Investment Management Pte. Ltd. (the "Manager"). Sabana Real Estate Investment Management Pte. Ltd. was incorporated in Singapore on 15 March 2010 and is wholly owned by Sabana Investment Partners Pte. Ltd. ("SIP") of which the shareholders are Freight Links Express Holdings Limited (the "Sponsor"), Blackwood Investment Pte. Ltd. and Atrium Asia Capital Partners Pte. Ltd., formerly known as Tarian Capital Partners Pte. Ltd.. Armed with deep knowledge and expertise on the Singapore industrial property market, the Manager sets the strategic direction for Sabana REIT, manages its assets, and makes recommendations to the Trustee on issues related to acquisitions, divestment and asset enhancements. In addition, the Manager adheres to guidelines set out by the Independent Shari'ah Committee to ensure that Sabana REIT has adopted a standard of Shari'ah compliance that is generally accepted in the Gulf Cooperation Council ("GCC") region in all aspects of its operation. Sabana Property Management Pte. Ltd. ("SPM") is the Property Manager of Sabana REIT. The Property Manager has a team of dedicated professionals actively in contact with tenants of Sabana REIT's properties to ensure the smooth operation of all of the buildings. SPM also manages the leasing function of Sabana REIT's portfolio of properties.

about the company

about the job

title: Guest Relations Executive / Assistant Manager
company_info: Revolver Revolver is a bold, refined grill that laces Indian cooking sensibilities with international flair and ingredients. Fire is an essential element in the creation of Chef Saurabh's revolving menu. Custom built woodfire and bincho grills, tandoor and smokers create charred flavours, and form a central part of the dynamic, open kitchen. With its unadulterated, industrial-chic design and rocking atmosphere, Revolver brings upbeat energy to its shophouse setting on Tras Steet. Considered one of India's youngest and most promising culinary talents, Saurabh is the Executive Chef at Revolver, whose love for experimenting with the grills and home spices led to the creation of bold and refined charred flavours in his progressive menu. Using fresh, seasonal ingredients and spices from India and around the world, diners can look forward to a true avant-garde dining experience.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities

· Handling and managing reservations process through various communication platforms.
· Confirm and process reservation requests.
· Handle enquiries and ensure all reservation related information are accurately entered into the system.
· Provide fast, efficient, courteous service at all times to guests.
· Acquire full knowledge about the restaurant, promotions and special offers.
· Following up on guest feedbacks, emailing thank you notes and handle guest complaints by following the procedures and ensuring guest satisfaction.
· To keep track of all third-party online bookings and updating menus.
· Sending daily, weekly and monthly reports required by the management office
· Perform any other duties as assigned by the General Manager.

Requirements:
· Candidate must possess at least a Professional Certificate/NiTEC, Diploma, Food & Beverage Services Management, Hospitality/Tourism/Hotel Management or equivalent.
· Possess at least 2 years relevant experience.
· Experience in fine dining restaurant is a plus.
· Experience with SevenRooms, POS systems for Raptor, GoGmGo.
· Highly organised.
· Good communication and interpersonal skills.

title: Executive Assistant (Medical Records Office)
company_info: Woodlands Health Campus (WHC) broke ground on 18 April 2017. The 1,800-bedded facility will comprise a fully-integrated Acute and Community Hospital, Specialist Outpatient Clinics and an Intermediate & Long-Term Care facility. Our vision for the single-build Campus will have both acute and community hospitals sharing the same building and medical teams. This will allow patients to move seamlessly from acute to rehabilitative care, with a unified care team. Our 'future-ready' Campus will employ practical technology to augment manpower needs to deliver care that is safe and more effective. Data analytics, telehealth, automation of manual processes or logistics robots are just some of the potential solutions WHC will use. We are already serving patients in our pre-operations wards located at the Yishun Health campus. Be part of a team providing person-centric, quality care to improve the lives of our patients, community and healthcare family. Similarly, our work in the community has already begun. Since 2015, we have been working with community care providers to create an ecosystem of support for some 600,000 residents in the North of Singapore. We work closely with stakeholders including schools, Voluntary Welfare Organisations, and social and primary care providers to develop initiatives on health promotion, education and engagement.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
While the campus is under construction, you may be deployed to Khoo Teck Puat Hospital (KTPH) and Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH). However, you will be working in the new Woodlands Health Campus once it is operational (estimated 2023).

Duties & Responsibilities

Handle public phone enquires on medical reports requests and disseminate requests to medical reports processing team for processing
Process medical report requests and follow up on medical report requests status
Process duplication of medical records for patients (e.g. discharge summary, lab results)
Inter-loan of medical records to other institutions
Perform records management such as engage porter to deliver documents to patient care areas, archiving of document in e-MRO storage and tracing, filing of physical notes and disposal of physical copies of medical records (post scanning)
Sorting and scanning of documents into the electronic medical record system
Perform indexing and Quality Control check (100%) on the scanned images and indexing
Participate in continuous quality improvement initiatives and projects in the department.

Requirements
At least a GCE ‘N’ or ‘O’ levels, Professionals Certificate/NITEC.
Experience in healthcare preferred
Proficient in Microsoft Office
IT literacy and numeracy including conversational, writing making electronic entries e.g. Record information on forms, charts and checklists
Able to adapt quickly to changes and work in a fast-paced environment

Please be informed that only application submitted through NHG Career Webpage (corp.nhg.com.sg/Careers), WHC Career Webpage (whc.sg/joinus), Jobstreet Singapore (jobstreet.com.sg), Singapore Medical Association (sma.org.sg), MyCareersFuture.sg, LinkedIn and WHC appointed recruitment agencies will be considered. If you are accessing this job posting from another recruitment channel, please visit the official channels mentioned above.

title: Senior Executive / Assistant Manager (Business Development)
company_info: ALLEN & GLEDHILL LLP
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
An award-winning full service law firm, Allen & Gledhill LLP has been providing legal services to premier clients since 1902. One of the largest law firms in Singapore, Allen & Gledhill counts among its clients some of the most well-known local and multinational companies and financial institutions. We have positions for highly motivated and committed individuals to join our Firm:
Job Responsibilities:
As a Senior Business Development Executive, your mandate will be to support the Firm and its Partners in building strong client relationships and in the acquisition of work. You will work closely with the Firm’s Partners and a team of professionals responsible for the Firm’s business development activities, and will report into the Business Development Manager and the Regional Head of Business Development and Marketing.
Your primary responsibilities will include:
Preparing compelling proposals, capability statements, reports, presentations and other client-facing collaterals
Implementing various aspects of our client care programme, including communications and events
Conducting research on clients, industries and market trends
Developing and preparing management reports
Supporting strategic positioning and messaging for the Firm’s business development initiatives
Promoting best-practice business development processes and policies within the Firm
Job Requirements:
5 years of relevant business development / sales / marketing experience, ideally in professional services
A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university
Experience in client relationship management, preferably in a professional services environment
Strong command of English, enjoys writing reports and other forms of communications
A genuine enthusiasm to be a part of a busy team
An ability to prioritise and manage competing priorities and deliver on deadlines with high levels of accuracy and strong attention to detail
Willingness and ability to take ownership of tasks
Effective interpersonal skills and a team player
A proactive, positive and ‘can do’ mind-set
Proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
For more information on our Firm, please visit our website at www.allenandgledhill.com.
Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Senior Executive Assistant, Healthcare Redesign(5356) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
• Conduct initial consultation with participants using data gathered from a digital health platform
• Create and implement personalized health plans that are aligned with lifestyle goal(s) set by General Practitioner (GP) utilizing digital tools and resources
• Use data and analytics to track participant progress and adjust plans as needed
• Monitor patients adherence to the program and encourage continued participation
• Provide ongoing support and guidance to participants through virtual coaching sessions and personalized nudges
• Communicate effectively with patients via phone and nudges
• Support administrative task, such as maintain accurate and confidential client records, scheduling appointments
• Consolidate and routinely update the list of existing activities available within Queenstown community and amongst partners
• Stay up-to-date with the latest digital health technologies and trends
To perform any ad-hoc tasks
Related Performance Indicators
• Successful contact with patients
• Ensuring patients well-being through monitoring of the dashboard and telephonic review
• Provide information on programs available in the community for lifestyle modification
• Successful appropriate connections made to benefit participant in linking up healthier lifestyle
• Clear and complete documentation and reporting of processes and interventions done
• Maintenance of existing activities with partners in the community
• Positive patients’ experience
Required Competencies and Capabilities (Skills, Experiences and Professional Licences)
• Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g. Nursing, Healthcare Administration, Pharmaceutical Sciences)
• Strong team-player, with natural ability to interact with patients/ residents, healthcare team and community partners of all levels.
• Self-motivated and able to work independently and manage a high volume of patients
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to use local languages and dialects will be an added advantage
• Passion for health and wellness and desire to help others improve their well-being
• Strong understanding of health and wellness principles and ability to apply them in a virtual setting
• Willingness to learn and adapt to new technology
• Proficiency in MS office, including Word, Excel, Powerpoint and Outlook
• Motivation interviewing and/or Health Coaching certification is a plus
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

title: Assistant Executive Housekeeper
company_info: Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel Now as iconic inside as it is outside, the grand Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel on Orchard Road has undergone a transformation. The Singapore 5 star hotel’s lobby is at its resplendent best. Every guest room has been redesigned and smartly decorated with thoughtful state-of-the-art finishing, such as 46-inch Full-HD Smart TV and two signature 1956 Eames Desk Chairs. The bathroom features a large walk-in rain shower area with resting bench and extended vanity area. Culinary delights abound at our award-winning restaurants, including the refurbished Crossroads Cafe and Marriott Cafe, Wan Hao, Pool Grill, and the latest addition, Java+. Unwind in our Singapore hotel’s 5-star spa and outdoor swimming pool. A perfect place for someone just like you. What makes a workplace feel like home? It’s a place that brings out your best, every day. Because it makes you want to be better, every day. It’s a place where your strengths are appreciated. Where people welcome you as you are. And applaud you for where you’re going. We invite you to search and apply for jobs at Marriott—and discover opportunities to explore whatever inspires you.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB SUMMARY
Supports the Executive Housekeeper in all aspects of her responsibility for the cleanliness and orderliness of the hotel.

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Assumes responsibility for Housekeeping Department in the absence of the Executive Housekeeper.
Quality control of the rooms/public areas/uniform & linen/laundry by carrying out training, control of P & L and inspections.
Supervise and manage daily staff assignments and ensure adequate housekeeping coverage.
Conducts new hire interviews and recruitment.
Plans manpower scheduling to maximize productivity.
Decision making and problem solving in housekeeping associates’ and operational conflicts.
Purchasing and inventory controls.
Quality checks on equipment and supplies, consistent monitoring of standards and defects, analyze/review new products and vendors.
Manages housekeeping expenses, operating budget, forecasting.
Overall knowledge of hotel operations and maximize guests’ satisfaction index.
Develop and train potential supervisors and managers.
Any other duties may be assigned from time to time.

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Minimum Diploma in Hotel Management.
At least 3 years of hotel's Housekeeping Managerial experience.
Great interpersonal skills; communication skills; multi-tasking skills.
A strong team player.

title: Retail Executive (Management Trainee)
company: WATSON'S PERSONAL CARE STORES PTE LTD
company_info: Watsons Singapore is part of A.S. Watson Group, the world’s largest international health and beauty retailer operating over 16,000 stores under 12 retail brands in 28 markets, with over 130,000 employees worldwide. For the fiscal year 2022, A.S. Watson Group recorded revenue of US$22 billion. Every year, we are serving over 5.5 billion shoppers via our O+O (Offline plus Online) technology-enabled platforms. Watsons is the leading O+O (Offline plus Online) health and beauty retailer in Asia, currently operating 8,000 stores and more than 1,500 pharmacies in 15 markets across Asia, Europe and the Middle East. In Singapore, Watsons operates close to 100 stores located islandwide. Aligned with its philosophy of bringing ‘more’ to customers’ lives, Watsons strives to bring the best in beauty and health products to consumers at affordable prices. Watsons continually sets the standards in the health, wellness and beauty market, providing personalised advice and counselling in health, beauty and personal care on top of its market-leading product range, making customers LOOK GOOD, DO GOOD, FEEL GREAT every day.
job_category: Customer Service, Personal Care / Beauty, Sales / Retail
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will be on our “Fast-track Programme”. Typically, you will spend 6 to 12 months learning the basics of store operations.
Upon successful completion of the one-year Management Trainee Programme, you will progress to the next level as Retail Executive and be tasked with increased management responsibilities. If you perform exceptionally well, you will be given the opportunity to explore different job roles through deployment into various departments so you can find the best fit for your skills and interests.

Retail Executives assist the Store Manager/Asst Store Manager in the supervision of the supervisory staff and Sales Assistants, outside consultants and cleaners in the store.
Under the Watsons Retail Executive (Management Trainee) Programme, you can look forward to high-impact development experiences designed to groom graduates and young professionals.

We are excited if you have:
Degree holder in any discipline
High energy and strong passion in the retail industry
Able to work in a fast-paced environment
Strong management skills with the ability to lead and motivate a team
Able to work rotating shifts, weekends and public holidays
Digitally inclined
For more information, please visit and follow our LinkedIn Page https://www.linkedin.com/company/watsons-personal-care-stores-pte-ltd/ for exciting updates

• Good Bonus - AWS + 3 month Variable Bonus / Permanent Role

Manage the Supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system and distribution management systems applications;
Involved in enhancement of the software functionality and troubleshooting to maintain system reliability and performance;
Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, enhancements and fixes;

Knowledge in programming languages such as C, C++ and Java;

Knowledge in oracle database, relational database management system (RDMS) and SQL commands;

title: Assistant Technical Executive
company: JONES LANG LASALLE PROPERTY CONSULTANTS PTE LTD
company_info: JONES LANG LASALLE PROPERTY CONSULTANTS PTE LTD About Jones Lang LaSalle Jones Lang LaSalle (NYSE:JLL) is a professional services and investment management firm offering specialized real estate services to clients seeking increased value by owning, occupying and investing in real estate. With annual revenue of US$4.0 billion, Jones Lang LaSalle operates in 70 countries from more than 1,000 locations worldwide. On behalf of its clients, the firm provides management and real estate outsourcing services to a property portfolio of 3.0 billion square feet. Its investment management business, LaSalle Investment Management, has US$47.6 billion of real estate assets under management. Jones Lang LaSalle has over 50 years of experience in Asia Pacific, with over 27,500 employees operating in 80 offices in 15 countries across the region. The firm was named ‘Best Property Consultancy’ in three Asia Pacific countries at the International Property Awards Asia Pacific 2013, and won nine Asia Pacific awards in the Euromoney Real Estate Awards 2013. www.ap.joneslanglasalle.com
job_category: Real Estate / Property Management, Repair and Maintenance
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Overview
Our client, a financial services company, has two offices in Singapore. Our contract calls for the successful delivery of a comfortable work environment which covers normal office systems such as office HVAC, lighting, electrical, pantry equipment etc, as well as ensuring zero downtime in their critical equipment such as HVAC, generator, fire system and UPS supporting IT related and communications equipment.

The Assistant Technical Executive will report to the facility engineer and will be supporting operations and maintenance of these equipment/systems in the client offices in Singapore. Mainly based in Anson, the assistant technical executive may also be requested to cover Asia Square office from time to time.

Job requirements
Execute and manage preventive maintenance programs for the facility equipment including HVAC, UPS, electrical and fire systems in the office.
Adhere to Standard Operating Procedures.
Maintain service reports, checklists, PPM schedules and any other relevant documentation for all installations.
Coordinating with vendors and ensure proper deliverables according to expectations.
Understand the engineering design and operational aspects of facility systems.
Must be able to recognize system shortcomings and take appropriate remedial actions.
To ensure 100% Power availability at site and no impact for any power outage.
Close monitoring of HVAC system and temperature in site maintained as per the SOPs.
Manage critical spares for all installations and plan for inventory.
Manage any breakdowns promptly in accordance to incident management process including escalation.
To participate in any critical Engineering activities like Annual shutdown, plan activity etc.
Should have ability to troubleshoot issues related to Critical Engineering.
Supervise minor Projects at site.
Adopt energy conversation practices as much as possible including energy conservation initiatives & implementation.
Support to cross functional team like IT, AV & Soft Team for daily operation activities.
Support the general handyman service.
Ensure compliance with statutory regulations on fire, health, and safety standards.
Ensure safe work practices and all safety procedures are complied. This includes vendor activities as well as any emergencies or incidents management.
Qualifications
3 years experience in operations and maintenance in an office environment
Experience in managing critical systems requiring zero downtime
Diploma in an engineering field

title: Executive / Senior Executive, People & Culture (Generalist)
company_info: Nexus International School, Singapore (NISS) provides well-balanced international curricula for 3-18 year old students that are based on the best standards and practices used around the world. NISS is an authorized International Baccalaureate (IB) World School – for the Primary Years Programme (PYP) and Diploma Programme (DP). We offer IGCSE examinations in the Secondary School. Nexus is an authorised International Baccalaureate (IB) World School for Primary Years Programme (PYP) and Diploma Programme (DP). It is a member of the Council of International Schools (CIS), and an approved Cambridge International Examinations (CIE) Centre, and is EduTrust certified. Our new campus is now located along Aljunied Walk. Due to the rapid growth of our increasingly popular school, we are looking to recruit a suitably qualified individual to join our vibrant team.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB TITLE: People & Culture (P&C) Senior Executive / Executive (Generalist)
Links to: People & Culture Manager
WHO ARE WE?
Nexus is an empowering, learning-focused community. We strive to create an honest, open and innovative community with our learners, parents and peers. We believe that we have something unique and special here, we are proud to be different in the way we work; and how we teach and learn.
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
At Nexus, we do things differently. Each member of staff is valued and recognised as a unique individual collaborating as part of a supportive community, to elevate one another with innovative ideas. Our strategies emerge from the collective positive mindsets of our colleagues. You will experience high levels of ownership and empowerment in your role.
JOB DESCRIPTION
People & Culture Senior Executive/Executive is responsible for assisting in the administration of the day-to-day operations of the People & Culture (HR) functions and duties. The main responsibilities are in some or all of the following functional areas: departmental development, Human Resources Information System (HRIS), executive administration and employment, employee relations, training and development, benefits, compensations, payroll and organisation development as well as doing a major part of data analytics.
ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Handle monthly payroll processing, reports and claims with in house HRIS system
End-to-end coordination of recruitment assignments, including administering and administration of all in and outsourced services of the employee and activities throughout the life-cycle of a recruitment, onboarding and relocation (immigration, flights, accommodations, payroll coordination, incl. assisting in tax and labour law, children’s education, family support and insurances)
Assist the senior leadership in coordinating all training and development related activities
Proactively come up with new ideas and innovative approaches for continuous improvement in the School’s organisational plan
Prepare employment contracts and corresponding compensation packages
Handle employee claims, grievances, welfare, benefits and salary compensation review and process
Review, update and maintain proper filing, recording and data entry for employee’s personal data and documentations
Review, update and maintain proper insurance and medical policy, handbooks, compensation & benefits, appraisal and employee related documentations
Supervise and support the executives / assistants on any HR related matters
Handles all work passes related matters such as application, renewal and issuance
Prepares reports of data results, presenting and explaining findings to senior leadership
Involvement in whole school events and activities as required.
To perform any other duties as assigned by the management, stakeholders and line manager
A TYPICAL DAY
I am usually in the office by 7.30am. As an individual who is detail oriented while dealing with figures and people this is key so that everything is processed by 8.00am, so I am able to pick up any potential issues before all employees arrive at work. My team and I work from a shared inbox where work is categorised to individuals or teams, so this is the first point of call. We could have over 50 emails to clear per day as our shared inbox consists of staff absence which needs recording on our HR system. I work closely with the academic deputies and heads to coordinate on training and development courses for our people.
During my lunch break at 12.00pm, I often head to the school’s gym for a quick workout. After my lunch break, I receive an email about the resignation of a member of staff and it happens to be an overseas recruited employee. With this in mind, I need to quickly process the tax clearance and off boarding process for the employee as the timeline is tight. Towards the end of the business day, I process the salary reimbursement for our Cover Supervisor who comes in on an ad-hoc basis. Being a senior executive, I also support members of my team on HR related matters. By the end of the day, I would have completed most of my daily operational tasks and ready for new challenges each brand new day.
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
A relevant degree in Business Management, Finance Management or Human Resource Management
At least 3 years of relevant HR experience
Knowledge of Singapore employment act and HR-related government regulatory act
Possess good IT skills and knowledge (E.g. Google doc, slides, sheet, Microsoft MS office applications - v-lookup, mail merge, powerpoint and etc)
Proficient in HRIS system - Engage, G-Suite, SAP SuccessFactors and Power BI are a must
Analyses data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to payroll, recruitment, hiring practices, motivation, turnover, and compliance with employment laws and regulations
Nexus International School (Singapore) is committed to the safety and wellbeing of our children and families. Nexus endorses the Convention on the Rights of the Child, which Singapore ratified on 11 December 2008, and establishes a clear policy and guidelines to protect our learners from maltreatment by any person or persons who come in contact with them in any environment.
Nexus International School (Singapore) is an equal opportunity employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and value the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our school.
Whilst every effort has been made to explain the main duties and responsibilities, the role may be revised from time to time.

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply via: https://careers.taylors.edu.my/job-invite/2801/

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
about the company
Join a global pioneer in express transportation, the leader in the industry with a presence spanning over 220 countries and territories. As one of the world's most admired brands and consistently recognized as one of the best places to work, our client is at the forefront of innovation and growth. They recognize that their people are the cornerstone of their success, and they are committed to nurturing talent and fostering development. If you're looking for an opportunity to be part of this esteemed organization, now is the time to apply. Our client is currently seeking an Executive Project Advisor, a pivotal role that reports directly to the AMEA Regional President.

about the job
As the Executive Project Advisor, you will play a crucial role in leading and managing teams and projects/programs for executives within the organization. Your responsibilities will encompass designing, developing, and implementing innovative and complex solutions, methodologies, modeling techniques, database tools, products/materials, and programs. You'll be adept at sourcing data and information from internal and external subject matter experts as needed and will regularly interact with senior executives. Representing executive management at meetings or functions and making presentations on behalf of the executive team will be part of your routine. Additionally, you will drive goal setting and planning activities, coordinate cross-functionally, and ensure compliance with defined internal processes and procedures, relevant legislation, external regulations, and predefined agreements. Your role will require executive-level business etiquette and knowledge, and you will act independently on behalf of your department or region.

You will also partner closely with the Executive Assistant in the President’s office, managing administration matters for the Regional President's office, as well as matters related to the President's direct reports and rollups. This role will be dynamic, with additional tasks and responsibilities assigned by the Regional President to meet the evolving needs of the organization.

skills and experience required
To excel in this role, you should possess a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of seven (7) years of work experience in supporting senior executives in writing, designing, developing, and/or implementing regional projects/programs. Experience in managing complex reports and data sets will be considered an advantage.

If you are a seasoned professional ready to take on an exciting and dynamic role, apply now to seize this opportunity. Your contributions will be integral to the continued success and growth of this prestigious organization.


To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may contact Carmen.
