title: Raffles Hotel Singapore - Assistant Executive Steward
company_info: Raffles Hotel Singapore welcomed guests in August 2019 after a careful and sensitive restoration breathing new life into its beautiful building. One of the few remaining great 19th century hotels in the world, the hotel is perfectly preserved both inside and out, giving it an intoxicating blend of luxury, history and classic colonial design. Its distinctive architecture, legendary heritage and iconic service continue to enthrall visitors while restored suites, new social spaces, restaurants and bars have been enhanced for discerning travellers.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The position assists the Executive Steward to manage the team, to be responsible for maintaining the cleanliness and quality of all F&B and Kitchen equipment and all pantry and kitchen area, so that all guests will have a safe and wonderful dining experience, ensures that kitchen hygiene and safety standards are meet, through active supervision of the Steward Supervisor, Steward Attendant and Night Kitchen Cleaner. The Assistant Executive Steward must have the perseverance to lead the team to achieve high standards within the work area and to work closely with the Executive Steward so as to lead the team towards the same direction.

Primary Responsibilities

Manages the Daily Stewarding Operation: Cleanliness and Quality of F&B and Kitchen Operation Equipment
Conducts briefing and makes deployment to Stewarding colleague daily.
Makes daily round to check for cleanliness and quality of all operation equipment and kitchen equipment.
Takes ownership of all operation equipment, kitchen equipment and hotel property.
Operation checks, to ensure work flow and system are in order and hygiene standards meet expectation.
Always communicates with F&B and Culinary team and fellow colleagues to find out about the work flow system and makes improvement with the collaboration system if required.
Manages team with efficiency of work in the washing of dishes and kitchen equipment.
Works closely with both the F&B and Culinary teams so as to build a strong collaboration between various team.
Oversees that timeliness of dish cleaning, returning dish for reuse during high business turnover.
Oversees that all washed equipment are clean and sanitised.
Oversees proper handling of all operation equipment so as to avoid or minimise breakage.
Ensures adequate supply of operating equipment in F&B outlet through coordination with all F&B outlet managers, through order, delivery, and by monitoring lost through breakage or missing.
Manages the Cleanliness and Safety of all Pantry and Kitchen
Checks all kitchen equipment for cleanliness, manages the Night Cleaning Contactor to follow up on any unclean area and equipment, and conducts kitchen inspection twice a week.
Manages the team to check on functional operation of each Dish Wash Machine, co-ordinate and follows up with Engineering and chemical technician for any faulty issues.
Manages the garbage collection schedule and also ensures that the recycle program is conducted as per established.
Oversees that the kitchen floor is clean and dry at all times, looks out for any potential safety hazard issue and tries to eliminate it immediately.
Oversees the sanitation of all operation equipment are done as per kitchen’s hygiene standards requirement.
Oversees that the work procedure in the kitchen are carry out as per HACCP’s requirement and the safety aspect is in line with WSH.
Oversees that all HACCP check-list and documentation are updated on a daily basis.
Leads all the kitchen walk through (WSH / Hygiene / Pest-Control) and rectifies all findings immediately.
Management and Leadership of the Stewarding Team
Makes routine rounds within the kitchen area during meal periods.
Supports the Stewarding team to be consistent in service, uses a collaborative, enabling leadership style and to have regular team meetings.
Drives constant service and system improvement and to be entrepreneurial.
Strong leadership and interpersonal skill.
Must be able to lead the team confidently at all times and always practice to lead by example.
Manages the provision of operation supplies, cleaning equipment, and chemical, monitor and control the amount of usage.
Induction and training of Steward Attendant and Supervisor in technical skill and process as outlined in the Keys to Success manuals.
Must oversees the team member grooming and personal hygiene practice to meet with hotel requirements.
Assists the Executive Steward to control all expenditure and cost within the budget (OT / CL / Supply).
Manages the team to adhere with the Hotel recycle program.
Competency in the yearly internal and external hygiene audit.
Manages and oversees the operation equipment storeroom / chemical storeroom / cleaning supply storeroom.
Creates a Friendly and Heartist® working environment within the team.
Involvement in Wider Job Function Relationships
To be active in learning so as to enhance personal skill and industry knowledge.
Follows Hotel and Departmental guideline to lead the team and constantly getting feedback from team member and other colleague.
Understands emergency procedure, health and safety requirement.
Maintains collaborative working relationship with colleague and supervisor/manager
Participates in departmental leadership activity as a member of the team and continually conducts training for the team member.
Develops own knowledge and skill as a contributing member of the Stewarding team.
Ensures that safe work practice is followed including emergency procedure.
Must be certified with Occupational First Aid Course.
Must be able to accomplish within the timeline with any assignment given by the Executive Steward and Management.
Oversees the pest-management in the pantry and kitchen area.
Attends the weekly Catering Meeting, gathers surficial information, co-ordinates and leads the Stewarding team to accomplish the event with high professionalism in supporting the Banquet Service Team and Banquet Culinary Team for the success of all events.
Candidate Profile
Knowledge and Experience
Minimum Secondary and above education with some computer knowledge.
Minimum 1 to 3 years of relevant experience in the hotel industry or a similar establishment.
Certificate for Basic Hygiene Course or related field.
Certified Trainer or on Job Trainer.
Occupational First Aid Course.
Competencies
Good interpersonal skills with ability to communicate with all level of employee.
Service oriented with an eye for detail, able to anticipate for problem to arise, so as to rectify the problem immediately.
Ability to work effectively and bring the team to the next level of excellence.
Flexible and able to embrace and respond to change effectively.
Ability to work independently and has good initiative under dynamic environment.
Self-motivated and energetic.
Technical skills for Stewarding.
Supervisory and leadership skills – collaborative, enabling, tolerance, integrity and entrepreneurial.
Interpersonal skills well developed with guests, employees and management.
Able to solve problems / make decision within scope.
Attention to detail especially cleanliness of all kitchen areas.
Able to work independently, reliable, self-directed, result orientated.
Benefits of Joining Raffles Hotel Singapore
Duty Meals are provided.
Colleagues’ Discount and/or Preferential Room Rates at worldwide Accor Hotels.
Flexible Benefit – Dental/Optical/Vacation Expenses/Children’s Education.
Medical and Wellness Benefit.
Comprehensive Insurance Coverage.
Local/Overseas Career Development & Growth Opportunities.
Holistic Learning and Development Opportunities.

Roles & Responsibilities
Why Explore
An opportunity to work in a world-class organization
Work in a collaborative and fast-paced environment
Based in Singapore, a global commercial hub for Rio Tinto
About the role
We are looking for a self-motivated and organized Executive Assistant to support the Commercial team. This role is based in Singapore. This is an opportunity where you will be provided autonomy and be relied upon to play a key support role.
This role is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic and dynamic self-starter to seek new challenges in not just handling secretarial and administrative support, but also having a keen interest in continuous learning and developing oneself toward research and drafting support work. Reporting to a member of the Senior Leadership Team in Commercial, you will be:
Providing a full range of secretarial/administrative support to the team exercising confidentiality, tact, and diplomacy.
Communicating directives and information from your leader to executives, managers, and others in the organization and following up on the status of tasks.
Receiving, screening, and directing visitors, mail, and e-mail.
Maintaining files, records, calendars, and diaries; arranging business travel, coordinating meeting arrangements, and tracking expenses.
Participating in the development and implementation of relevant standards, policies, and practices for the organization.
Coordinating secretarial support across the Singapore office for leadership events, developing and maintaining a collaborative relationship with other administrative support resources across the organization
Manages end-to-end service requests for stakeholders.
Perform general research work as necessary including preparation of background documents (e.g., preparation of presentation slides, drafts of simple correspondences, and background information for appointments; consolidate relevant data; generate reports, etc.)
Schedule departmental meetings; assist in the preparation and distribution of meeting agendas and materials.
Assist with budget planning, usage, reporting, and related matters.
Complete various special projects including creating PowerPoint presentations, financial spreadsheets, special reports, and agenda material.
Manage onboarding activities to support new team members and off-boarding for leavers.
Facilitate occasional large events and liaise with corporate event planners hotels etc.
Other additional and/or alternative duties as assigned from time to time.
About you
To be successfully considered for this role, you will have:
Tertiary education preferred, with relevant secretarial qualification and at least 5 years of Executive Assistant experience.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Self-starter with the ability to manage and prioritize a range of concurrent topics with minimal supervision.
Ability to manage sensitive, time-critical, complex tasks.
Availability to work global or ad-hoc hours from time to time.
Excellent working knowledge of Ariba, SAP, Microsoft, and its interfaces.
A positive attitude and willingness to learn new tools and skills as necessary to function effectively in the role.
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to build strong internal and external relationships, customer service, team player, able to work globally across cultures.
High standard of personal integrity with regard to business confidential and sensitive information.

title: Sales Executive / Assistant Manager
company_info: Established in 1972, Morrison Express is a privately-held company operated by a professional management team. We have successfully transformed from a Taiwan-based freight forwarder focusing on Taiwan-US route to a global player with over 1,800 employees operating out of 70+ owned-offices in America, Asia, Europe and South America, plus more than 100 agents in 5 continents, and are still expanding rapidly in terms of revenue and corporate size. We serve an expanding list of multinational businesses, managing their air, ocean and ground freight forwarding and logistics needs on a global basis. Via our regional logistics centers—strategically located in key gateway cities across different regions— We provide highly customized, cost-effective freight consolidation, warehousing, distribution and delivery solutions that caters to our client’s most challenging business needs. We continue to invest and operate one of industry’s most sophisticated information systems, designed for today’s increasingly complex supply chain logistics. Our flexible IT solutions provide clients with the capability to integrate our shipping, warehousing and door-to-door delivery solutions with their own information systems, enabling the clients to have end-to-end supply chain visibility. Our success as a global service provider is and will continue to be driven by our team of highly dedicated and hard working individuals. Their commitment and passion to their jobs are the backbone on which we have built our organization, and this will continue to be a source of passion with which we serve our clients.

title: Programme Executive, Assistant Manager, Programme Manager, Assistant Director
company_info: A less-than-common ground-up non-profit, Humanity Matters is a Singaporean humanitarian interfaith organisation. It is established as a collaborative and collective vehicle which runs on common values for common good. HM strives to catalyse and realise regional cooperation for humanitarian relief and sustainable civic development, to serve disaster-prone, disadvantaged and vulnerable communities across Asia. HM consciously engages the community and faith sectors to put collective compassion in motion. To date, HM has responded to typhoons, floods, earthquakes, tsunami and volcanic eruption in Indonesia, India, Laos, Myanmar, Pakistan, Philippines and Turkey. Since February 2020, it provided relief support for the COVID-19 emergency management across Singapore, China, Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Myanmar, Cambodia, Sri Lanka, India and Palestine. HM consciously and constructively engages the faith sector, along with the public, private and people sectors, to uplift lives and enhance dignity of disaster-stricken and disadvantaged communities regardless of country, culture or creed. Additionally, HM implements programmes via a social dimension approach which explores and emphasises on social needs, nexus and nuances, to help identify and alleviate risks that threaten social cohesion, confidence and resilience, particularly in multicultural societies. Through multi-sector partnerships, HM strives to address prevailing and pressing issues including cultural, racial and religious misconception, polarisation, discrimination, extremism, exclusivism, radicalism and terrorism.

title: Executive Assistant
company: SI PARTNERS SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE. LTD.
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About us
We are a global M&A advisor to creative and digital technology businesses, operating in London, Hong Kong, New York, Singapore and Australia. Our continued growth has created an opportunity for a dedicated role in Singapore, working directly with Partners and the team.

The Role
The Executive Assistant’s role is split into two main roles:
1. Ensure the day-to-day operation of the Singapore office is maintained in a professional and effective manner.
2. Working closely with the Partners and the Singapore team handling any ad-hoc tasks.

Office Administration
· Front of house – organise meeting room, tea & coffee, greet visitors
· Managing the day-to-day operations of the office
· Management of mail and internal documents
· Housekeeping – monitoring cleaning provider, ordering stationery, office supplies and refreshments
· Maintaining client and supplier database
· Organising office repairs and liaising with the landlord
· Office relocation

Partner Support
There is an emphasis for the person in this role to take on personal tasks for the Partners. The role requires provision of personal support and may include occasional out of hours support in emergency situations. You are expected to support the Partners in the following ways:
· Planning and scheduling meetings and appointments for Partners and the overall team
· Making travel and guest arrangements (booking flights, hotels and airport pick ups)
· Application for Visas, Work Permit, etc.
· Extension of support to Partners’ family (travel arrangements and other making appointments e.g. doctors, dentist, visas)
· Tend to ‘personal’ matters (act as gatekeeper for the Partners, attend to Partners’ residence and liaise directly with landlord/agent for any issues, paying bills, taxes)
· You should be able to communicate fluently in English and be culturally adaptable when dealing with the Partners (UK background).

HR and Finance (Supervised)
· Posting and paying supplier invoices to Xero
· Processing staff expenses and claims
· Preparing monthly payroll and CPF submission
· Submitting GST report quarterly
· Track and manage staff leave entitlements
· Liaising with auditors, accountants and corporate secretaries

General
· Must display a positive and helpful attitude
· Smart appearance
· Well organised and detailed in their approach
· Working in a professional environment

Requirements
· Minimum Degree education in any discipline
· Experience (3 years minimum) in supporting senior management
· Excellent skills in Word, PowerPoint and Excel
· Excellent communication skills in English
· Prior experience in serving Expat is a must
· Mature and able to work under pressure
· Starting immediately is a plus
· Having some basic HR, Finance and corporate secretarial knowledge

Only Singaporean or PR may apply. If you are interested, please send your resume/CV to adminsg@sipartnersglobal.com

title: Senior Executive / Assistant Manager, Corporate Secretarial (Compliance)
company_info: Halcyon Agri is a global leader in natural rubber, supporting the world’s growing mobility needs through the origination, production and distribution of natural rubber. Our products are essential to keep the world moving. The tyres on cars, trucks, agricultural vehicles, aeroplanes and bicycles, as well as many industrial and commercial products, all need the natural rubber that we produce. We are headquartered in Singapore and listed on the Singapore Exchange. Our key operating assets are located in Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, China and Africa and are supported by a network of logistics assets and sales offices in Southeast Asia, China, South Africa, Europe and the United States. Halcyon Agri’s businesses have a rich history, tracing their roots back to the 1930’s with the founding of PT Hok Tong and PT Rubber Hock Lie in Indonesia, pioneer natural rubber producers in South East Asia. Today, Halcyon Agri’s workforce comprises 13,000 dedicated individuals. For further information, please refer to our website at: www.halcyonagri.com

title: Senior Executive / Assistant Manager, Undergraduate Academic Office
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Academic matters
Oversee and manage all undergraduate course curriculum matters (Curriculum, eLearning Week, Course registration, curriculum timetable, Examination & Invigilation matters.)
Manage timetable for ICC courses
Plan and administer interview sessions for Admissions exercise and liaise with Admissions office for all admissions related matter
Plan and handle all logistic matters for all outreach and school events including NTU Open House, CoS Day, Orientation etc
Manage student applications for Professional Internships and Professional Attachment
Manage student feedback on teaching (SFT)
Manage student exchange requests (Inbound and Outbound)
Manage leave of absence requests
Prepare curriculum proposals for submission
To work closely with faculty members on exam-related matters ie grade sheets, Board of Examiners meeting
Manage the Mark Entry System and liaise with Exam department for submission of grades
Assist with the printing of CA papers
Involved in the planning and logistic arrangements for Annual Convocation for undergraduates
Manage and track all statistics relating to undergraduates’ studies for reporting purposes to other offices and ASE management
Provide first level of counselling to undergraduates as Pastoral Care staff
Manage the Work Study Scheme system and assist in faculty requests for student assistants and payments for students
An ad hoc duties assigned by supervisor
Finance matters
Verification and processing of reimbursement claims (for undergraduates)
Initiate and process scholarship payment/claims
Other matters
Liaise with ASE club for activities for school and students
Liaise with ASE Alumni Association for activities for school and alumni and current students
Requirements
Bachelors Degree or Diploma with 4 years' experience in administration
Previous administrative experience a plus, especially in a team setting
Familiarity with office software such as Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Suite is important. Additionally, experience with database management and relevant software is a plus. Comfortable using search engines, MS Teams, Zoom etc.
Highly organized and capable of managing multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently
Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential. (Appoint will be interacting with students, faculty, staff, and parents so the ability to communicate professionally and effectively is crucial)
The ability to identify and resolve issues independently or by collaborating with others, showing initiative to come up with solutions
Undergraduate offices can be dynamic environments, so you should be able to adapt to changing needs and handle unforeseen situations with ease.
Confidentiality and Integrity - You may have access to sensitive information, so trustworthiness and the ability to handle confidential matters with discretion are critical.
Experience in organizing and coordinating events, workshops, or seminars is advantageous.
Maintaining accurate records, filing documents, and organizing administrative paperwork efficiently
Approachable and able to work collaboratively with colleagues in a team-oriented environment.
Helping with complicated timetabling, organisation, student inquiries requires detail oriented mindset

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:

Media and Public Relations:
· Collaborate with the Manager to develop and execute the annual media advocacy plan.
· Identify and research media outlets, producers, editors, and reporters for media outreach.
· Draft press releases and organize media events to secure media coverage.
· Facilitate media interviews and attend to media and public inquiries promptly.
· Support marketing and publicity efforts for fundraising projects.

Autism Advocacy and Public Education
· Working with colleagues in SAAC and caregivers, to strategize and execute SAAC’s advocacy efforts for persons with moderate-to-severe autism, including working with other agencies in the Autism Network Singapore to further the interests of persons with autism

Content Creation and Distribution:
· Develop, write, edit, and produce engaging content for various channels (website, social media, marketing collaterals).
· Participate in the production of corporate collaterals, including service brochures, newsletters, and videos.

Digital Marketing and Communications:
· Work collaboratively to manage website development and maintenance, including performance analysis.
· Handle social media platforms, responding to inquiries to engage stakeholders and increase awareness.

Brand Management:
· Ensure consistent and relevant communication of the organization's brand across all internal and external channels.
· Oversee publicity campaigns to maintain brand identity and guidelines.

Administration:
· Contribute to the establishment and management of a media library and archives.
· Assist in daily news monitoring, event reporting, and content compilation.
· Assist in managing events and campaigns, including email invitations and responses.

Other Duties
· Undertake other ad-hoc duties as required


Requirements:
Meticulous, highly motivated, and resourceful team player with a positive attitude in problem solving and analytical skills
Good organisational skills, careful attention to details and result-oriented
Team player with strong inter-personal skills who can rally and mobilise people around a central mission.
A passion to serve in special needs sector, and being resilient with a start-up mentality

Education and Experience:

· 2 to 5 years of corporate communications and/or marketing experience.
· Strong written and verbal communication skills in English and preferably a second language.
· Proficiency in storytelling, photography, videography, and video editing.
· Active presence on social media platforms and updated on ongoing trends.
· Proficiency with relevant communication tools, software, and platforms, such as Adobe Illustrator, Final Cut Pro, content management systems, and social media management tools is an added advantage.
· Ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment with tight timelines.


Apart from a competitive pay package (relative to the social sector), the successful candidate can look forward to working closely with a team of mission-minded, passionate and forward-looking colleagues in the Development team to constantly advance SAAC’s mission.

ob Description
The incumbent will act as the Programme Manager for a new Master of Science programme at the Department of Statistics and Data Science. title: Assistant Executive Housekeeper
company_info: voco Orchard Singapore is the newest IHG hotel to open in Singapore, and the first voco hotel to open in Southeast Asia. The name 'voco' derives from the Latin word for ‘to invite’ or ‘to come together’, and the very first thing you’ll notice at voco Orchard Singapore is the warmth of the welcome. Both informal and indulgent at the same time, our hotels each have their own character inspired by their location, and all feature playful, personal touches that guests remember long after check-out. Our guests are the kind of people who know exactly what they want whether they’re travelling for work or pleasure and appreciate the time and space to really indulge and enjoy. Located at the start of Orchard Road in Singapore, the hotel provides a stay in the heart of the city with exciting dining, shopping and entertainment options right on its doorstep. Comfortable guest rooms and suites offer city views and ample space to work or relax, and award-winning restaurants and MICE facilities enhance the experience. Our warm intuitive voco hosts are ready to tailor-make incredible and memorable cosmopolitan experiences in the heart of Singapore, bringing to guests the best of dining and entertainment experiences.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
IHG Hotels & Resorts' first voco™ hotel in South East Asia is now open on Singapore’s world-famous Orchard Road!
voco® Orchard Singapore provides guests with the world-renowned voco™ experience from the moment they walk through its doors. Famed to be hotels to count on, yet different enough to be fun, voco hotels are unstuffy hotels where people feel comfortable to relax, and just get on with life. Hotels that stand out from the crowd, voco combines familiar comforts with the indulgences of a hotel, to create somewhere that’s dependable, but not vanilla. Somewhere premium, but with a laidback spirit. Somewhere reliable, but different.
Your day to day
voco Orchard Singapore is seeking a dynamic and detailed oriented Assistant Executive Housekeeper to be part of our team. As the Assistant Executive Housekeeper, you will assist in managing the housekeeping and laundry operation to ensure product quality standards are met and that optimum service is provided to hotel guests according to hotel and company business objectives. Serve as Executive Housekeeper in his/her absence.
FINANCIAL RETURNS
Assist Executive Housekeeper in the preparation of the annual departmental operating budget and financial plans which support the overall objectives of the hotel.
Monitor and control the departmental expenses on an ongoing basis to ensure performance against budget.
Analyse departmental expenses and identify areas of improvement to drive departmental and hotel profitability
PEOPLE
Trains, manages and motivates the Housekeeping department in order to provide high standard of service for customers and meet departmental and hotel targets
Provide direction and support to the team on a daily basis
Assist the Executive Housekeeper to supervise and manage the performance of the department.
Work closely with the Human Resources department in the recruitment of colleagues to ensure staffing are met
Identify any training gaps and work with the Learning & Development colleagues to ensure training gaps are close.
Assist in managing the day-to-day activities of the Housekeeping staff. Schedule employees to ensure proper coverage.
Ensure all staff is properly trained on systems, security and cash handling procedures, and service standards and have the tools and equipment needed to effectively carry out their job functions.
Promote teamwork and quality service through daily communication and coordination with other departments, including Finance, Revenue, Sales and Marketing, Food and Beverage, Housekeeping, and Maintenance.
GUEST EXPERIENCE
Ensure that the rooms are prepared in accordance to IHG Way of Clean operating procedures.
Coordinate any special request with Guest Services to ensure a memorable stay for our guests
Ensure that all Housekeeping duties are carried out to the highest standard in order to provide guests with maximum efficiency of service and comfort.
Respond to guest complaints, special requests and ensure corrective action is taken to achieve complete guest satisfaction.
Inspect all guest rooms and public areas on a regular basis to ensure that the furnishing, facilities and equipment are clean and in good repair, well maintained and replaced or refurbished as required.
To check vacant, clean rooms on the report and report any discrepancies both to housekeeping for assignment and to the hotel duty manager for investigation.
Analyse all Guest Heartbeat surveys and any social media reviews to identify any gaps or trends, put in place corrective preventive action to prevent negative issues from recurring.
RESPONSIBLE BUSINESS
Conduct pre-shift meeting and review all information pertinent to the day’s activities.
Assist in maintaining par levels for supplies and equipment. Replenish shortages and other business supplies for daily business.
May be responsible for the security of lost and found items or coordinate the lost and found function with other departments.
Assist with deep cleaning projects and/or assist housekeeping staff during unanticipated rush periods.
Schedule and regularly conduct routine inspections of the front office and public areas to ensure the appearance of such areas reflects highly on the hotel, brand, and Company. Assist in creating and implementing action plans to correct deficiencies.
Ensure the cleanliness and tidy of the department and ensure all equipment is in good working order
Perform other duties as assigned including assisting staff with their job functions during peak periods.
What we need from you
Degree or Diploma in Hospitality Management or other relevant qualification
Minimum 2 years’ related experience as similar position in a full service hotel
Oral and written fluency in English. Fluency in another language is an advantage
Commitment to work rotating shifts, weekends and public holidays.
Great communication skills, ability to interact with guests, employees and third parties that reflect highly on the hotel, the brand and the company.
What we offer
We’ll reward all your hard work with a great salary and benefits – great room discount and superb training.
Join us and you’ll become part of the global IHG family – and like all families, all our individual team members share some winning characteristics. As a team, we work better together – we trust and support each other, we do the right thing and we welcome different perspectives. You need to show us you care: that you notice the little things that make a difference to guests as well as always looking for ways to improve - visit www.http://careers.ihg.com to find out more about us.
IHG is an equal opportunity employer: Minorities / Females / Disabled / Veterans.

Job Summary:The Marketing & Admin Assistant plays a pivotal role in supporting the marketing and administrative functions of the food catering company. This role involves assisting with marketing campaigns, managing administrative tasks, and contributing to the overall efficiency of the company's operations.

title: HR Executive
company_info: HYSSES is a leading Singapore-based brand specializing in natural and organic products. With a deep understanding and appreciation for nature, HYSSES has built a reputation for crafting high-quality products that promote holistic wellness and a healthier lifestyle. Our wide range of products includes essential oils, skincare, haircare, and body care. Our commitment to sustainable and eco-friendly practices is evident in every aspect of our business, from sourcing raw materials to packaging and shipping. At HYSSES, we believe that nature provides the best solutions for our well-being, and we are passionate about sharing this belief with our customers. Join us on our journey towards a healthier, more sustainable future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a highly motivated and organized individual to join our HR team as a Senior HR Executive / Assistant Manager. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the full spectrum of HR functions, including recruitment and selection, processing of employment letters, work pass applications, payroll, employee benefits and compensation, training, and performance management.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Assist in the management of the full spectrum of HR functions
Assist in the recruitment and selection process
Process employment letters, work pass applications, renewals, and cancellations
Update and maintain job descriptions and requirements
Manage attendance records, monthly payroll, and payroll reports
Ensure timely submission of CPF and income tax to relevant government entities
Manage employee welfare activities and benefits
Maintain and update the company's HR handbook, policies, and procedures
Prepare disciplinary letters and staff memos/announcements
Arrange employee relations, bonding, and communication activities (e.g. birthdays, D&D, meet-up sessions)
Prepare training materials and conduct organization-wide training based on retail and business needs
Evaluate and audit the quality of training programs and plan improvements
Implement training and development tools and concepts
Conduct new employee induction program
Assist in the management of performance management exercises for confirmation, renewal, and annual performance review
Support senior management in annual budgeting exercises
Collaborate with government agencies for grants and other HR-related projects
Manage organization chart and contact list changes
Respond to employee inquiries
Perform other duties as assigned

Job Requirements:
Diploma / Degree in Human Resources or related discipline
1 year of experience in the related field (fresh graduates are welcome to apply)
Bilingual in English and Mandarin
Meticulous attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Work Location: 37 Kaki Bukit View
Candidates with more experience will be considered for the Assistant HR Manager position. If you meet the requirements and are interested in this opportunity, please send your updated resume in MS Word format. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Assistant Engineering Executive (Tuas South Incineration Plant)
company_info: The National Environment Agency (NEA) is the leading public organisation responsible for ensuring a clean and sustainable environment for Singapore. Its key roles are to improve and sustain a clean environment, promote sustainability and resource efficiency, maintain high public health standards, provide timely and reliable meteorological information, and encourage a vibrant hawker culture. NEA works closely with its partners and the community to develop and spearhead environmental and public health initiatives and programmes. It is committed to motivating every individual to care for the environment as a way of life, in order to build a liveable and sustainable Singapore for present and future generations. For more information, visit www.nea.gov.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What the role is
You will work in Tuas South Incineration Plant as Assistant Engineering Executive (equivalent to technician level) to ensure safe and effective operation and maintenance of the electrical equipment and systems in the incineration plant.
What you will be working on
You will be responsible for the following:
Attend to daily preventive maintenance of assigned plant electrical, instrumentation and control equipment.
Attend to daily job cards assignments of unscheduled outages of plant electrical, instrumentation and control equipment.
Attend to overhauling of equipment/system as assigned by the Supervisors.
Supervise the work of contractors.
Assist the Executive Engineering Manager/Engineering Executive in carrying out preventive and remedial maintenance of plant electrical, instrumentation and control equipment.
Carry out any works that will help to ensure and maintain the high availability of the plant electrical, instrumentation and control equipment.
What we are looking for
NITEC in Electrical Engineering/Electrical Technology (Power & Control)/Mechatronics Engineering
Working experience (1 to 3 years) in operation and maintenance is preferable. Candidates with no working experience are welcome to apply
Must be computer literate
Able to work independently
A good team player with strong interpersonal skills
Able to perform occasional night duties
Able and willing to work on weekend and after office hours
As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.
To apply, please proceed to https://sggovterp.wd102.myworkdayjobs.com/PublicServiceCareers/job/NEA-TUAS-SOUTH-INCINERATION-PLANT-TSIP/Assistant-Engineering-Executive--Tuas-South-Incineration-Plant-_JR-10000020570

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As an Executive Assistant to the CEO, you will play a critical role in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of the CEO's office, while also contributing to business development efforts. You will provide comprehensive administrative and executive support to the CEO, enabling them to focus on strategic priorities, business growth, and effectively manage their responsibilities. This role requires a high level of professionalism, discretion, organizational skills, and the ability to handle a wide range of tasks with precision and efficiency.

Job Responsibilities:
Calendar Management
· Efficiently manage the CEO's calendar, scheduling and coordinating appointments, meetings, and events.
· Prepare necessary materials and information for meetings, including business development discussions.
Communication
· Act as a gatekeeper for the CEO's communication, screening and responding to emails, calls, and messages.
· Draft, review, and edit correspondence, presentations, and documents on behalf of the CEO, including those related to business development initiatives.
Meeting Support
· Prepare agendas, take accurate meeting minutes, and distribute follow-up action items, especially for meetings related to business development discussions.
· Coordinate logistics for business development meetings, including room reservations, technology setup, and catering if needed.
Confidentiality
· Handle sensitive information with the utmost discretion and maintain a high level of confidentiality, especially in business development matters.
· Organize and maintain confidential files, records, and documents related to business development activities.
Business Development Support
· Assist in identifying and researching potential business development opportunities, partnerships, and clients.
· Coordinate and support the CEO in networking events, conferences, and meetings to promote business growth.

Job Requirements:
· Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field.
· Proven experience as an executive assistant, personal assistant, or in a similar role, with exposure to business development activities.
· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
· Strong written and verbal communication skills.
· Proficiency in office software, including Microsoft Office Suite and calendar management tools.
· Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
· Professional demeanor and ability to interact with stakeholders at all levels.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary:
The position of Executive Assistant reports to the Officers to provide full administrative and executive business support to the Officers in a responsive, timely, accurate and effective manner. Assignment involves work of a confidential nature, exposure to sensitive information and contacts requiring considerable discretion, judgment, tactful and diplomacy.

ACCOUNTABILITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide full spectrum of logistical, administrative and personal support to the Officers.
Manage Officers’ calendars and schedules, ensuring accuracy and timely input. Provide agenda and meeting materials as needed.
Manage the travel and logistics arrangements, and process claims/expenses.
Interact professionally with all levels of management, staff and external parties across the region and internationally. Work with the Officers’ direct reports and stakeholders locally and regionally on day-to-day operational issues, meetings and other matters, maintaining a high level of communication and ensure timely and accurate sharing of information.
Schedule and setting up various local/regional meetings, arrange meeting venue and refreshment, and help facilitate at these meetings where necessary. Manage/assist in the logistic arrangements such as flights, hotel, transportation, visa application etc.
Coordinate government official’s visits by collaborating with respective departments for necessary preparations to ensure smooth proceedings. This includes but is not limited to arrangements for meeting venues, logistics, meals etc.
Support the Officer in following up on the status of projects / cross-functional tasks and assignments when required. Collaborate with other teams to ensure policies, procedures and timelines are met.
Assist in the preparation of business reports, presentations, materials, collating of data and consolidating of reports from the region.
Communicate on behalf of the Officers when delegated.
Support the Officers in the management of his/her IT equipment (e.g., laptop, printers and office phone), mobile devices as well as personal and corporate software applications.
Be responsive to emails/ text messages/ phone calls, with contact outside normal business hours where needed.
Manage proper archival and management of documents.
Any other job/task assigned by Officers.
CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS
Ability to maintain in strict confidentiality all work and information assigned.
Demonstrate professionalism at all times by demonstrating personal accountability, effective work habits, empathy and teamwork.
Highly organized individual with the ability to exercise good judgement in diverse situations and balance multiple priorities.
Communicate with clarity and maintain good relationships with other business units and entities.
Proven experience in large organizations with complex structure. Comfortable with coordinating meetings/work tasks across multiple time zones.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Possess at least a secondary education or equivalent with up to 4 years working experience in corporate / executive office, preferably with administrative/executive experience in a fast-pace MNC setting.
Proven track record in providing Executive Assistant support to C-Suite Level Executives with a high degree of discretion, confidentiality, professionalism, and attention to detail without missing the big picture.
Demonstrated strong planning, organisational and time management skills and ability to proactively determine priorities and appropriate sequencing to accomplish daily expectations and handle multiple demands.
Excellence business writing and proofreading skills.
Requires a high level of interpersonal, social and customer service skills for daily interactions, both in person and digitally and work cooperatively as a team member.
Ability to informally lead and influence others.
Confident in exercising appropriate judgement while keeping stakeholders informed in a fast-paced work environment.
Must be flexible and detail oriented to meet strict deadlines and be capable of multi-tasking.
High proficiency in Microsoft Office 365, especially Excel and Power Point with the ability to produce graphs and charts.
Must be technologically savvy to IT equipment (e.g. video conferencing system).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Fluency in English required, other language skills are a plus.
EA License No. 01C4394 • RCB No. 200007268E • Lim Jia Jie EA Registration No. R22108969

title: Executive Assistant
company_info: Presbyterian Community Services (PCS) is a social service agency registered with the Commissioner of Charities and a member of the National Council of Social Service. We have 27 centres spanning across the island. PCS is one of the foremost providers of pre-school education and has a wide range of services such as infant care, childcare, special needs, special needs school, residential home for teenage girls, youth-at-risk programme, eldercare services, emergency relief scheme and other services to meet the multi-generational needs of the population. PCS is an appointed partner operator for children services and centre of specialisation in integrated childcare for children with special needs. PCS is also a foundation member of St. Luke’s Hospital. In 2017, PCS, together with Grace Orchard School (GOS), embarked on a pilot project to train girls from GOS to be Teacher Childcare Aides. This project won the MOE-NCSS Innovation Award in 2018. With the positive outcome and good feedback received from this pilot project, PCS went further to plan for a scale up of this training to reach out to the Post-18 group of girls who have left special schools and are employable, to offer them a new training / vocational pathway - Educarer Aide Training (ECAT). PCS believes that with the structured training, the girls will be well-equipped for the early childhood care tasks, enabling them to work and contribute meaningfully at the childcare centres. In July 2019, PCS was awarded the 5th Enabling Employers Award (Innovative Project category) by SG Enable, in view of the potential employment possibilities for girls with mild intellectual disability after the ECAT.

company_info: CONCORDE SECURITY PTE. LTD. Concorde Security is an award winning SMART Security Solutions Provider. We have over 20 years of experience in the security industry. We have helped property and business owners secure their assets so that they can sleep in peace at night. We listen to their security needs, understand their concerns, solve their challenges and lead them to a SMART Security Solution that offers enhanced security outcomes, manpower-lite and cost savings. As the needs of every client are different, we tailor our services and strategies to meet the needs of every client. Our clients draw on our experience, knowledge and technological expertise to serve them efficiently. We believe that a SMART Security Solution should not cost you an arm and a leg. Concorde's award-winning IFS Solution leverages the latest technology in video analytics based on video images captured by CCTV cameras fitted at strategic locations in your assets. These images are beamed directly to a mobile command centre that patrols a cluster of buildings. Once an intrusion is detected, our highly trained iMan Specialists would be able to intervene within 15 minutes. Concorde Security is now in an expansion mode. We are now recruiting new and highly motivated staff to work with us. You will be trained on how to transform the security industry in Singapore and the rest of the world.

company_info: Dulwich College (Singapore) is the newest addition to the Dulwich College International family of schools in Asia. The College opened its doors to its first students in August 2014. The College caters for a diverse range of international students reflective of Singapore’s cosmopolitan nature as one of Asia’s most vibrant centres. The College will eventually have the capacity for 2,500 students who will enjoy facilities and resources the envy of any school in the world. The College draws upon 400 years of experience and innovation in education from our Founder School, Dulwich College in London. Dulwich College provides expertise, resources and a rigorous set of academic standards to which all the international Colleges adhere. Our close ties with our sister schools in Beijing, Shanghai, Suzhou, Seoul and Zhuhai provide us with further access to resources and experience here in East Asia as well as further opportunities for professional development and movement between the Colleges. The College aims to inspire its students enhancing their education and cultural understanding. We want to prepare them for the opportunities available in a highly connected world. title: Finance Executive / Assistant (Accounts Receivable)
company_info: Corporate Profile PERTAPIS was registered under the Societies Act in 1970. It is an approved organisation under the Charities Act, Cap 37 and has also been conferred the status of an Institution of PublicCharacter (IPC), IPC No: IPC000455 and can issue tax exempt receipt for donations. The principal activity of PERTAPIS is the running of welfare projects which are designed to address some of the social problems faced by the community. These projects include the running of welfare homes, providing social support for the needy families and educational services. Our Journey PERTAPIS was formed in 1969 by a group of young aspiring Muslims who believed in the importance of moral and religious education in order to build a strong resilient self in youth. In the days of kampung living, the community would come together to help ease the burden of families in need. For most, this did not change even after modernisation and families moved into flats. They carried on that kampung spirit by forming ‘block committees’ and organising activities involving social interaction, community bonding and welfare support. From its humble beginnings, PERTAPIS, as a ‘self-help organisation’ is today an approved charitable organisation under the Charities Act with Institution of Public Character (IPC) status and has helped more than 3000 families in need.
address: Joo Chiat Complex, 1 Joo Chiat Road 420001

title: SENIOR EXECUTIVE / ASSISTANT MANAGER, REGULATORY AFFAIRS
company_info: Cocoba Pte Ltd is an organization that manages a rapidly growing group of food and beverage brands including IRVINS Salted Egg Snacks and Saiko Butter Brew. Our company was built from zero and it's still growing rapidly. Our failures and successes become our most valuable experience and lessons. Our mission is to create food products that are fun, creative, innovative and most importantly, Dangerously Addictive. We bend our backs to make our customers happy and our motto is to "stand out and be different'. We work hard, play hard, take risks, fall sometimes and we move on. Afterall, life is an Adventure. Sounds like you? Join our family of high energy team players
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Company
IRVINS is a high-growth homegrown consumer food brand expanding quickly on the global stage, with 5 offices and 12 markets worldwide, and a product lineup that redefines the food industry.

Founded in 2008, over the years we have pivoted and evolved from an F&B restaurant into a modern food CPG startup. With IRVINS’ global reach, category and market leadership, and startup mentality, we welcome people with a builder attitude keen on building things from scratch and help turn a homegrown brand into Singapore’s iconic global consumer brand.

Key Responsibilities
Create and sustain an effective system for managing regulatory-related documentation
Create and ensure product labels meet the regulatory requirements of the target markets, including ingredient lists, nutritional information, allergen declarations and language requirements
Review and approve product labels for regulatory compliance
Collaborate with internal departments e.g., R&D, quality assurance, business development managers, design to ensure compliance with all applicable local and export regulations, including documentation, labelling, and certification requirements specific to the target markets
Oversee the preparation and accuracy of export documentation and declaration letters for business purposes
Coordinate the acquisition of necessary certifications, such as Halal, Keto or country-specific certifications
Develop and implement effective strategies to overcome regulatory barriers and facilitate market access for food products in the target export markets
Act as primary point of contact with local regulatory authorities and in the exporting countries, establishing strong relationships, and effectively communicating to address any regulatory issues

Key Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Food Science & Technology or similar discipline
Minimum 5 to 8 years of experience in similar field or job function
Proactive, self-motivated and well organized
Able to work independently as well as in a small collaborative team
Multitasking and problem solving attitudes with strong attention to details
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Competency in one or more Asian language(s) would be desirable
Able to prioritize and organize effectively in a dynamic environment

title: Personal Assistant
company_info: STRIPS is a leading decentralised finance start up with the goal of creating an open marketplace to trade interest rates.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our mission:
Our mission is to accelerate the development of a global, open and transparent financial system by providing robust, open access to markets. The financial system we've been handed is broken, and it's time to change that. That starts by using technology to build the most robust, secure and transparent derivatives exchange in the world.
Our company builds high performance trading systems for decentralized finance applications. Our team is truly global in scale, with team members from almost every continent in the world, and building a platform for anyone, anywhere. Our technology enables people to trade and invest in cryptocurrencies with transparency of assets.
Who are we looking for
We are looking for a highly motivated Personal Assistant to join our growing team. You will provide executive assistance to our CEO.
Here's how you'll be contributing:
Provide administrative and executive support to the CEO, including managing schedules, coordinating meetings, and handling correspondences.
Coordinate travel arrangements, including booking flights, hotels, other travel arrangements, prepare detailed itineraries, travel visas/documents etc..
Handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion and maintain the confidentiality of all company matters.
Liaise with external vendors and service providers on invoices, timely payments and follow up etc.
Schedule and coordinate internal and external meetings with the CEO’s business partners, key stakeholders etc.
Other duties as assigned by the CEO
Requirements:
Degree/Diploma in a general business discipline or similar.
Proven experience with at least 3 years of experience supporting C-Level Executives, in a start-up environment within the financial services industry.
Strong organizational skills that reflect ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with excellent attention to details.
Highly resourceful and proven ability to handle confidential information with discretion, be adaptable to various competing demands.
Strong proficiency in the whole suite of MS Office
Ability to show the flexibility to support in different time zones when called upon, e.g. when the CEO is travelling etc.
About you:
Smart and fast-learning: you might not know everything, but you have a desire to learn and improve constantly. You're not afraid of asking "stupid" questions and have the ability to induce results from few datapoints.
Execution focused: you are focused on delivering results, you move fast and get things done in a timely manner
Communication: You understand that being an executive assistant to the CEO requires a high degree of trust and communication. You are proactive in communicating with the CEO what you are working on, and can communicate effectively with external parties to complete tasks.
Leave your comfort zone: you're an explorer, traveler, who likes to try better ways of doing things
Doesn't matter who you are: we don't care what you studied, where you come from, or how you got here. We welcome all people without judgement or prejudice.
Here's what you'll get:
Unparalleled first look into a fast growing bleeding edge industry
Competitive salary and bonuses
Freedom to do things without all the red tape
Working with some of the smartest and hardest working people in the industry
Startup atmosphere which gives people freedom and responsibility to own what you build

We provide sales and trade-in of Brand New and Used Commercial Vehicles, Leasing and Rental for Vans, Lorries, Minibuses & Prime Movers. Skylink Group also provides Motoring Insurance, Vehicle Hire Purchase, Financing, and In-house Motoring Workshop with Customized Engineering Solutions. With more than 7 years in the automotive industry, Skylink has supplied to over 4,000 corporate customers and maintains a young fleet of mixed commercial vehicles for your logistical needs. At Skylink, we provide a one-stop solution to business partners looking to expand their transportation capabilities. Join us today and be part of an elite team that will revolutionize the automotive industry.
job_category: Advertising / Media, Design, Events / Promotions, Marketing / Public Relations, Sales / Retail
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
In line with our current expansion, Skylink Group Holdings are looking for the incumbent to join us to contribute to our holistic expansion development and strengthening our new business units.

Marketing Assistant / Executive

The Job
Collaborate with team and internal stakeholders for updates on materials.
Assist the marketing manager in the development of marketing campaigns.
Responsible for activities on digital channels such as updating and advertisement on social media and EDMs
Responsible for dissemination of leads and opportunities
Assist with company events and roadshows
Assist the marketing department with administration, logistics and bookkeeping
Other assigned duties from time to time
Skills & Qualifications
Diploma / Degree with related discipline
Software skills such as Microsoft office suite, Adobe Photoshop, illustrator skills
Ability to work independently and as a team
Good command of spoken English
Candidates with experience or relevant education will be considered for executive positions.

title: Project Executive
company_info: Lumina Live Pte Ltd (www.lumina.com.sg) is an established experiential event agency with offices in Singapore and China that specialises in the luxury, lifestyle, corporate and FMCG sectors. We are passionate about crafting experiences that strengthen brands, not only creating events. We are dedicated to the creation and implementation of sophisticated and quality experiential events for global brands and corporations, with the purpose of building better customer engagement. Innovation is in our DNA. Incorporated in 2000, Lumina Live has produced outstanding results across the Asian region, offering solutions in different areas: • Production & management of large-scale events • High-end luxury and fashion events • Product launches • Branded exhibitions • Corporate conferences and seminars • Public events
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We want talented Project Executives to join our team to produce events that will make an impact. You will be part of a dynamic team to ensure events are successful, focusing on project management, quality, team work, and client servicing.

If you are passionate about the experiential event industry, and want to work on projects in the world of luxury, fashion and premium lifestyle, this is your chance!

We would like enthusiastic candidates with fresh ideas and good organisational skills, with the drive to succeed in a highly competitive industry, you will enjoy working in Lumina.

BENEFITS
Good remuneration package, including project-based incentives
Great team environment
Annual Dental, Optical & Medical Entitlements
Hospital & Surgical Insurance Entitlements
2-days flexible Work from Home arrangements per month (bi-weekly)
Off-in-lieu provided for work on weekends and public holidays
Good opportunities to work on overseas projects for wider exposure
SCOPE OF WORK
Work closely with event projects teams on luxury, corporate and premium lifestyle events from pre-event planning, sourcing, proposal assistance, to on-site event management and execution.
Assist in day-to-day co-ordination and management of event operations and administration needs.
Brainstorming ideas, sourcing and contacting suppliers.
Assisting with the crafting of effective and creative proposals.
Research the market for innovative trends within the luxury, corporate, premium lifestyle industry.
Assist in other tasks to support the work of research and proposals as required.
Help to manage overall project timelines and quality.
Cost negotiation and managing suppliers’ relationships.
Opportunities to travel for overseas projects.
CRITERIA
Minimum 3 years’ experience in event, production and management.
Academic qualifications in Event Management, Fashion Design, Art, or related qualification preferred.
Possess keen interest in high-end luxury and fashion industry and pays great attention to detail.
Software skills in Microsoft suites especially PowerPoint or Keynote. Knowledge of Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, and video editing will be a plus.
Up to 2 years’ experience with successfully managing and handling of premium lifestyle events
Highly motivated and efficient, with a drive for excellence in work standards
Very resourceful, especially with venues and vendors sourcing
Able to use technology effectively to be more productive
Good writing and communication skills, with outgoing personality &
A good sense of humour will make a difference!

title: Senior Executive, Centre for Sustainable Medicine (2-year renewable contract)
company_info: The National University of Singapore aspires to be a vital community of academics, researchers, staff, students and alumni working together in a spirit of innovation and enterprise for a better world. Our singular focus on talent will be the cornerstone of a truly great university that is dedicated to quality education, influential research and visionary enterprise, in service of country and society.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at the NUS Career Portal.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description
Climate change is the defining challenge of our time, shaping the health of populations for generations to come. The Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine is tackling this crisis through its Centre for Sustainable Medicine (CoSM), working to accelerate the transition to low-carbon, climate-resilient health systems.

The incumbent will be part of a dynamic, high-performing team full of passionate healthcare and sustainability professionals, and responsible for a number of key responsibilities:

Executive Assistant to the Director
• Work as the Executive Assistant to the Centre Director, providing secretariat support including scheduling, travel coordination and expense reporting, meeting preparation, and broader administrative support

Team Support
• Work collaboratively with other team members especially fellow members in the Centre operations team, and the implementation/communications team
• Where appropriate, provide support to the CoSM leadership with administrative and logistical matters (coordination of large meetings; procurement; recruitment support)
• Work to develop the Centre’s administrative, HR, and financial processes and take active steps to foster an inclusive, fast-paced, and empowering team culture
• Maintain CoSM project documents and prepare regular strategic presentations and reports for the senior management and funders

Project Management & Research Administration
• Contribute to the Centre’s administrative and executive team as it provides support to a wide and growing variety of research activities
• Support the planning and coordination of the Centre’s projects, including its events (for example, the launch of the Centre or large academic workshops), educational activities, and its research projects
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree
Preferably with at least 2 years of experience in providing strong administrative and organizational support
Excellent writing and verbal communication skills
Excellent project management and organizational skills
Good interpersonal skills with the ability to develop collaborative relationships with team members and relevant stakeholders
A strong interest in sustainability, with a track-record working in the field a significant advantage

title: Indoor Sales Assistant / Executive
company_info: DIMERCO EXPRESS SINGAPORE PTE LTD Dimerco Express Group holds global view and foresees market trend from time to time, and has developed a global network to operate over 160 business locations in 17 countries in Asia, Australia, North America and Europe, along with more than 200 strategic partner agents in rest of the world. We provide comprehensive logistics services to our customers through strategic alliance with air and ocean carriers, etc., based on our capability to integrate and streamline Supply Chain Management process to help customers enjoy feasible logistics solution to optimize their cost and to ensure timely delivery.
job_category: Logistics / Supply Chain, Marketing / Public Relations, Sales / Retail
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The role includes but not limited to:
Attend to and follow up on customers’ enquiries through phone, email etc.
Prepare quotation and ensure rates to customers are updated
Handle the processing of all quotations with accuracy and timeliness
Establish and develop new business opportunities with potential customers
Engage existing and potential customers to solicit sales and maintain a good business relationship
Negotiate with the customers regarding product pricing
Prepare monthly sales forecasts and reports
Expand existing business and contribute to meet sales KPI. Customer visits when necessary
Ensure that client information is maintained accurately in the system
Performs any other duties assigned by the Management
We would like you to have:
Minimum Diploma in Marketing or equivalent
At least 2-year related working experience
Proficient with Microsoft Office (e.g., Words, Excel, PowerPoint etc.)
Preferably with experience Freight Forwarding – understanding of incoterms and shipping procedure will be an advantage
Good negotiation skills
Good interpersonal and communication skills, achievement oriented and able to build and foster a positive team environment
Strong organizational and detail-oriented skills with the ability to manage and complete multiple tasks accurately and on time

title: Customer Services Assistant / Executive
company_info: DIMERCO EXPRESS SINGAPORE PTE LTD Dimerco Express Group holds global view and foresees market trend from time to time, and has developed a global network to operate over 160 business locations in 17 countries in Asia, Australia, North America and Europe, along with more than 200 strategic partner agents in rest of the world. We provide comprehensive logistics services to our customers through strategic alliance with air and ocean carriers, etc., based on our capability to integrate and streamline Supply Chain Management process to help customers enjoy feasible logistics solution to optimize their cost and to ensure timely delivery.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Fully utilize in-house system to perform cost in and cost approval for air freight shipments
Provide delivery details to customers
Co-ordinate with internal/external stakeholders on shipment readiness and delivery schedules
Ensure all documents (invoices, report, permit, Airway bill) are prepared on time
Ensure on time cost approval as well as GST billing and collection
Handle all customers' enquiries timely and effectively
Document filing
Other assignment as and when assign by the management
Requirements
Possess Diploma in Logistics/Supply Chain Management or equivalent
Preferably with at least 1 year of experience in Freight Forwarding with the understanding of incoterms will be an advantage
Proficient with Microsoft Excel
A team player with good interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively
Exceptional customer service and follow up skills

title: Executive Assistant (Rehab Department)
company_info: Company Overview Ren Ci Hospital is an established Voluntary Welfare Organization (VWO) in rehabilitative and geriatric care, primarily serving the elderly community in Singapore. Ren Ci (??) means loving kindness and compassion which became the guiding principles in our delivery of affordable medical, nursing and rehabilitative care services, serving all regardless of background, race and religion. Our spectrum of care includes a community hospital, a chronic sick unit, two nursing homes and three day centres offering day rehab, day care and centre-based nursing services. Over the years, Ren Ci has evolved and expanded its services to meet the needs of a rapidly ageing population in Singapore, leverage on partnerships and engagement with the community to give dignity back to the elderly. As a dynamic healthcare organisation, we are looking for suitable professionals who have a passion for serving the elderly and who wish to build a career in the community care sector.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
BROAD FUNCTION
Provide administrative support for the operation of Ren Ci Integrated Home and Day Care (IHDC) and Senior Care Centre (SCC).
To liaise with clients and clients’ next of kin on matters pertaining to Ren Ci IHDC and SCC.
ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES
To receive referrals from referral source(s) and prepare them for screening by the Case Manager/ Centre Manager.
To schedule appointments for initial assessment, financial counselling, and regular therapy sessions.
To perform counselling explaining to clients and/ or their next of kin regarding the contract of service.
To conduct means testing for patients if required.
To prepare and maintain order of case notes for new admissions and for scheduled therapy sessions.
To enter client’s attendance into the Centre Based System (CBS) daily, and update the system as necessary.
To liaise with Operations & Facilities Management (OFM) personnel for transport arrangement for clients if required.
To liaise with the Business Office or Finance personnel for billing matters.
To update the Agency for Integrated Care (AIC) website; CBS and Transport Call Centre (TCC) system as and when necessary.
To respond to phone calls and attend to general enquiries.
To provide administrative support in the implementation of organization and departmental programs or services.
Carry out other tasks/ projects assigned by the Centre Manager/ Head of Rehabilitation Department.
PROFESSIONAL
To communicate to clients/ next of kin and staff in a professional manner. Communication should reflect consideration of socio-cultural values of the patient, family, and significant others.
To maintain absolute confidentiality in matters pertaining to the organization/ departmental/ clients. Confidentiality of the clients’ records is to be always maintained in order to maintain privacy of the clients.
To take responsibility for own learning.
To participate in staff meetings and hospital initiatives.
Set service standards.
To liaise with external services, statutory bodies and other VWOs as appropriate.
To be actively involved in organization and department initiatives e.g., quality services and projects, mass casualty, department assistant fire warden.
HEALTH AND SAFETY
To know and implement the Health and Safety regulations in Ren Ci Hospital. To always work safely, and to actively participate in health and safety programs.
To attend course on Fire Safety as required by the organization.
Be able to take initiative and identify, report and resolve issues that may cause harm to people in the organization. To report all accidents or potential hazards to the reporting officer.
REQUIREMENTS
Certificate in Healthcare Support (Administration) or equivalent is desirable.
Working in a private clinic, restructured hospital or an intermediate or long term care facility (ILTC) will be an advantage but not necessary.
Mature and is a good team player.
Able to maintain the honour, interest and dignity of the institution or organisation.
Able to serve those clients in need, regardless of race, nationality, religious or social status.
Compassionate and able to relate well with the sick patients of the hospital.
Caring, understanding, patient and is empathetic.
Cooperate with all colleagues towards the total health care of the community.
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint, and other computer skills.
Able to multi task and work in a stressful environment.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This is a 5-month contract role to cover maternity period from mid October 2023 to mid March 2024.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
To perform day to day operations of Business Office.
To attend to the daily queries promptly and efficiently from next-of-kin (NOKs) in the Business Office.
Ensure that all documents are properly filed and organised.
Collection of daily payments and preparing of bank in slip for banking.
To perform pre-admission phone counselling and financial counselling with patient/ NOKs upon confirmation of patient admission.

To create and update all patient information into system.

Input, posting and closing in accounting systems.

Daily settlement of Nets and Credit Card machine.
To liaise with external and internal to ensure a smooth admission of patient.

To follow up and process on medical report when request received.
To update entire month charges and generate invoice for monthly billing.

Preferably with at least 3 years of customer service experience.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Self-motivated and independent.
Proficient in Microsoft Office
Preferably with basic accounting knowledge.

title: Executive Assistant to Principal of School
company: ONE WORLD INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL PTE. LTD.
company_info: One World International School, Singapore is a private, co-educational day school catering for students from Early Childhood 1 - Grade 12 (aged 3-18), following the IB PYP programme and the Cambridge International Examinations prgoramme.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity among our teachers, staff and students.
We are an IB Primary Years Programme (PYP) World School, a Cambridge International School and an IBDP School. All teaching positions require a high proficiency in spoken and written English, a degree, teaching qualifications and ICT literacy.
One World International School is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of the children. We are committed to recruiting candidates who share this commitment to safeguarding.

Job Description
The Executive Assistant to the Head of School plays a pivotal role in the organisation of the School and assists the Head of School in the day-to-day work to ensure the smooth running of the office. This person is responsible for providing high-level confidential administrative, organisational and secretarial support and is expected to work autonomously to represent the Head of School and the School to internal and external stakeholders.
Overall Responsibilities
Managing day-to-day operations of the Principal of School.
Scheduling meetings, calendar and other appointments of the Principal of School.
Handle sensitive information in a confidential manner.
Organizing & maintaining files & records.
Co-ordination of staff events.
Maintain daily electronic documents on google shared drive.
Preparing & formatting information for internal & external distribution.
Record minutes of meetingsAct as the primary contact between Principal of School and parents.
Collate and check staff claims/reimbursements for Principal of School's approval.
Organise Head of School claims for reimbursement.
Supervise the front office staff activities.
Qualifications
Diploma or Degree in related field.
Minimum 2 years of relevant experience.
Good command of English, Usage of emails, Google Forms and MS Office.
Able to work independently with minimum supervision.
