description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Plan and conduct structured operational and financial internal control reviews targeted at control design, operating effectiveness of controls, and operational inefficiencies and work with stakeholders to develop mitigating measures.
Work with internal stakeholders to plan and implement Control Self-Assessment (CSA) exercises to assess the effectiveness of risk management and control processes.
Develop, plan and conduct controls self-assessment validation to identify control deficiencies and opportunities for improvement.
Assist in operational implementation of new system and conducting system training to stakeholders involved in exercises.
Track and follow up on all audit issues to ensure that actions required are completed.
Carry out reviews for assurance that actions taken to address audit issues are appropriate and effective to address issues raised.
Conduct ad-hoc assurance review works.
Present and report key findings, highlight risks or control issues and recommend practical solutions to management.
Provide advisory on risk and controls matters to internal stakeholders.
Provide secretarial support for Risk Management Committee meetings.
Develop and facilitate initiatives to promote a positive risk management and internal control culture.
Share audit learnings to eradicate recurrence of similar risks.
Support any Enterprise Risk Management initiatives within the department.
Any other duties assigned by Reporting Officer
Requirements
Degree in Business Administration, Accountancy, or relevant qualifications.
At least 3 to 4 years of relevant working experience in internal audit, internal control review or compliance role preferably in hospital and healthcare industry.
Knowledge of internal auditing techniques & standards, data analytics audit tools (eg. IDEA) and SAP software preferred.

company_info: Following the merger of two successful listed transport companies - Comfort Group and DelGro Corporation in 2003, Comfort Transportation and CityCab became members of the ComfortDelGro Group. Comfort DelGro Taxi, as it is known today, is a leading taxi company in Singapore. With a 13,500 strong environmentally friendly taxi fleet, we operate point-to-point taxi services 24/7.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
This is a leadership position, a key leader who will lead a team of Customer Service Agents in delivering responsive services to our customers. You will report to Head Operations Control Centre and be responsible to the ops matters within your watch. Ample opportunities for career growth and training will be provided. It is 12 hours rotating shift team-based setup with adequate rest. You will be working in a family-oriented environment with good company benefits.

Job Responsibilities
Oversee the development and management of the Operations Control Centre.
Involve in resource planning and staff management to ensure resources are properly allocated.
Handle escalation matters including staff grievances.
Manage and ensure KPIs are met so as to align with the company’s goal and objective.
Hiring, training, coaching and leading Executives and Operations Control Agents as they provide support for customers.
Liaise with the authorities and other key organizations on Taxi / Bus Operations and emergency incidents.
Proactively identify opportunities and process improvements
Perform other duties such as preparation and submission of operation reports, incident reporting etc.
Responsible for Operation matters including the relevant KPIs within the watch.
Job Requirements
Proficient in MS Office e.g., Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Power BI
Project Management skills
Report writing skills.
Ability to diagnose and resolve basic technical issues.
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills
Intensive customer service skills
Conflict resolution
Good command of English (written and spoken)
Open to work 12 hours shift with rotating Day and Night patterns including weekends and public holiday.
Experience in managing overseas operations locally.
Candidate with taxi and bus operations domain knowledge is an added advantage.

Under the revised Employment Agencies Licence Condition 5(b), employment agencies (EAs) are required to collect the personal data (e.g. NRIC, FIN) of applicants referred to employers for permanent or contract job positions of at least 6 months with a fixed monthly salary of $3,300 and above. PDPA requirements on collection, use and disclosure of personal data are not applicable to EAs that are collecting such information, as it is a regulatory requirement.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
F&B Management Executive, F&B

Calling all talented Individuals who have passion for F&B industry!

We are looking for a reliable and innovative Management Executives who will work closely with the Operations Managers/Director, and is responsible with the daily operations, delivering ultimate guest experience and maintaining customer satisfactions. To achieve breakthroughs, the incumbent should innovate and implement measures to improve profitability and minimise costs, able to take clear directions, proactive in sharing feedback, willingness to share ideas and have a huge thirst for learning and self-improvement. A rich career path awaits those who are willing to devote their time and energy towards creating a rewarding environment for all.

The role requires a candidate with the ability to thrive in a versatile environment that ranges from P&L management, supply-vendor management, inventory accountability to floor operations. We take pride in our brand and recent growth, and so, this candidate will start with our on-the-ground operations team and will be able to move up to managerial type roles (pending performance and capability). The role will touch on customer experience through the use of digital and physical user journey.

Trainee to be involved in:
1. Management of operations of a restaurant
2. Writing and implementing Standard Operating Procedure for restaurant operations
3. Uphold cleanliness, hygiene and food safety regulations from licensing agencies

Competencies to be learned:
1. Restaurant operations and management skills
2. Policy, operation audit and cost control ability
3. Analytical, problem solving and crisis management skill in f&b business setting
4. Compliance and regulatory monitoring and adherence in f&b business setting
5. Learn about people development, management and leadership skills in f&b business setting
Administrative skills in f&b businesses


Job Responsibilities
-Achieves optimal business performance of the restaurant through identifying business opportunities, analysing, planning restaurant sales and profitability.
-Assists in staff management: recruitment, training, evaluation and promotion.
-Maintains an accurate and up-to-date plan of restaurant staffing needs, approving schedule labour hours, and ensures that the restaurant is staffed for all shifts.
-Prepares reports at the end of the week, including staff control, inventory, staff weekly performance report.
-Ensures the strict compliance by all service and kitchen staff to company’s standard operating procedures.
-Maintains a safe working and customer environment is in place to reduce the risk of injuries/accidents and completes incident reports and safety audits promptly.
-Communicate with the Service Crew to ensure efficient seating and table utilisation.
-Prompt food service to be performed during peak periods.
-Undertake any operation related duties as assigned by the Manager.

Job Requirements
-Proficient in spoken and written English.
-Possess at least a Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Food & -Beverage Services Management, Hospitality/Tourism/Hotel Management or equivalent.
-Minimum one year similar working experience in F&B industry.
-Good analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills.
-Manages work pressure well and loves the prospect of a challenging job that enables personal growth.
-Able to lead, manage and motivate the team.
-Possess enthusiasm in learning and keen to get feedback for improvement; able to learn fast and adapt fast.
-Presentable, outgoing personality, possess exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to maintain good relationship with diverse guests and team members.
-May be required to work on weekends and public holidays, if need be.
-Self-motivated team player who is able to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.

Join our Growing Team of Experienced and Enthusiastic Talents
-Competitive Salary
-Performance Incentives
-Career Progression
-Leave, Medical and Dental Benefits
-Staff Discounts
-Annual Leaves

title: Senior Executive / Assistant Manager (Business Development), Energy-as-a-Service
company_info: Keppel Infrastructure (KI) drives the Group's strategy to invest in, own and operate competitive energy and infrastructure solutions and services. Keppel Infrastructure, while tapping the expertise of its environmental engineering and technology, will continue growing its integrated power and gas business as well as its environmental and energy efficiency businesses. In Gas to Power, KI has a track record of developing, owning and operating power plants in Brazil, China, the Philippines and Nicaragua. In Singapore, it operates a 1,300 MW gas fired combined cycle power plant on Jurong Island. Through its subsidiary, Keppel Seghers, its advanced technology solutions addresses a wide spectrum of environmental issues such as solid waste, wastewater, drinking and process water, biosolids and sludge. Keppel Seghers’ in-house Research & Development capabilities, as well as strategic alliances with global research institutes enable it to continuously improve its technology. Keppel DHCS, a KI subsidiary, is the largest district cooling service provider in Singapore, providing cooling services though the development and operation of such systems at major business parks. Keppel DHCS currently services three plants in Singapore, with a capacity exceeding 60,000 RT, namely Changi Business Park, Biopolis@one-north and Woodlands Wafer Fab Park. In 2010, Keppel DHCS made its first foray into China to provide DHCS services in the Eco-Business Park of the Sino-Singapore Tianjin Eco-City. The plant incorporates geothermal technology to support its heating and cooling requirements and commenced commercial operations in August 2013. Keppel Infrastructure Trust (KIT) is the largest Singapore infrastructure-focused business trust listed on the Singapore Exchange with total assets in excess of S$4 billion. As its diversified portfolio of core infrastructure businesses generate cash flows either through long-term contracts with creditworthy counterparties or from a large and diversified customer base, the trust is able to offer investors long-term, predictable and sustainable returns. The Trustee-Manager of KIT is Keppel Infrastructure Fund Management Pte Ltd, a wholly-owned subsidiary of KI.

title: Junior HR Executive / HR Assistant
company_info: UES HOLDINGS PTE. LTD. Delivering Sustainable Solutions for a Better Environment UES Holdings Pte. Ltd. (“UESH”) is an established company with rich engineering heritage. Its roots can be traced back to the 1930s when it was the contractor to many regional governments for the construction of waterworks and other large infrastructure. Headquartered in Singapore, UESH has market presence in China, Cambodia, Indonesia, Myanmar and Vietnam. Drawing upon more than 80 years of proven track records and extensive expertise, UESH has emerged from a contractor to currently a prominent system integrator and process engineering services provider for the environmental sector. In addition, UESH is also an investor and operator of environment-related assets in Singapore. The Group’s most iconic projects are the second NEWater plant at Changi Water Reclamation Plant (“CNP2”), which is awarded Water Deal of the Year at the 2016 Global Water Awards; and Stamford Detention Tank (“SDT”), one of the most complex flood protection infrastructural project constructed below the heart of Singapore’s shopping belt. Leveraging on its solid track records and competencies, UESH will continue to strengthen its market position and progressively explore new markets in the environmental industry value chain.

Job Description
Managing day-to-day operations for e-commerce: process daily sales order, order fulfillment, inventory update, dispatching of goods, invoicing, attend customer enquiries etc.

Monitor closely competitors’ activities and understand current market trends.

title: Senior Executive / Assistant Manager, Student Administration
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
NTU’s School of Computer Science and Engineering (SCSE) is a leading school for higher learning that is known for its excellent curriculum, outstanding impactful research, and talented faculty. Today, we are ranked Top 10 for Computer Science in the latest US News and World Report Best Global Universities listing and NTU has been recognized as the top university for AI research and citation impact. SCSE serves a critical role in the university and society as we harness the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to not only enhance the learning and research experience of our students and staff, but also to create innovative solutions for some of the grand challenges facing our world.
We invite suitable candidates to apply for the Student Administration, Senior Executive / Assistant Manager role with our Academics Office to provide support to the Academic team on all undergraduate matters.
Responsibilities:
Course Administration, Timetabling and Registration
Oversee course registration and ensure that the process has been conducted in accordance to the university’s and school’s policies, guidelines and deadlines
Check and ensure that all students have successfully registered for their required course after the course registration exercise.
Manage the coordination of class timetable, modules allocation to students to ensure optimal learning.
Oversee, facilitate and ensure timely and relevant placement of students for the internship and the exchange programmes.
Provide academic and administrative advisory support services to students including responding to and management of student emergencies locally and in overseas.
Perform completeness checks on proposals submitted for new programmes and for request for change of curriculum by Faculty.
Administer and ensure fair distribution of teaching assignments for academic faculty, teaching assistants and postgraduates for undergraduate courses offered in the semester.
Examination
Liaise with faculty members, undergraduate coordinators of other schools and Central Administration in the planning of examination schedules and ensuring no clashes.
Ensure all examination matters are administered in line with the university’s policies.
Manage pre-exam preparation and post-exam processing which includes exam scheduling, post exam processing (marks checking and processing, checking of reports, exam result appeals, special consideration, academic awards and graduation matters).
Coordinate and facilitate the examination results appeal and review process and update student(s) timely on the decision.
Others
Work with academic studies unit in other school for second major student course registrations
Timely reporting of deviations to current policy requirements and guidelines and propose/initiate rectification actions.
Review and recommend opportunities for process alignment or enhancement for the school’s Undergraduate Department using university wide policies and guidelines as a reference.
Prepare, provide, submit and maintain various types of reports and statistical information as required.
Study the enrolment trends and patterns of withdrawal across the school and provide recommendation(s) to the Associate Chair (Academic) for his/her strategic planning discussion with the School Board.
Coordinate and administer the CET program (i.e. Part time diploma to eventually take part time degree in SCSE).
Secretariat for PMC and BoE.
Requirements:
Min. a Degree with 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in an educational institution.
IT savvy, proficient in MS Office applications and database management systems
Meticulous and organized, with the ability to multi-task
Proactive, analytical and resourceful
Ability to work in a team
Excellent interpersonal and communication (oral and written) skills
Good sense of initiative and responsibility and positive working attitude
Ability to manage stressful situations

title: Executive – Assistant Manager
company_info: About the NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL The National University Hospital is a tertiary hospital and major referral centre with over 50 medical, surgical and dental specialties, offering a comprehensive suite of specialist care for adults, women and children. It is the only public hospital in Singapore to offer a paediatric kidney and liver transplant programme, in addition to kidney, liver and pancreas transplantation for adults. The Hospital was opened on 24 June 1985 as Singapore’s first restructured hospital. Each year, the Hospital attends to more than one million patients. As an academic health institution, patient safety and good clinical outcomes are the focus of the Hospital. It plays a key role in the training of doctors, nurses, allied health and other healthcare professionals. Translational research is pivotal in the Hospital’s three-pronged focus, and paves the way for new cures and treatment. A member of the National University Health System, it is the principal teaching hospital of the NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine and the NUS Faculty of Dentistry. For more information, visit www.nuh.com.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:

(A) SPECIFIC (90%)
1. Assume a lead or coordinating role in managing the data transfer between the main platform and the other data sources/repositories contributing/receiving data from the platform by liaising with other public healthcare institutions data leads, IHIS and MOH for timely and high-quality data delivery to ensure integrity, accuracy, completeness, duplication, currency and consistency. This includes quality assurance of imported data by performing data validation on the imported data.
2. Involve in commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.
3. Support efforts for the design, modifications and overall support for data warehouse requirements, data definitions, data structure, data extraction and administrative approval efforts to enable smooth and seamless data transfer.
4. Support initiatives for data integrity, normalization and standardization
5. Develop reports and analysis for research, audit and adhoc purposes, including and not limited to feasibility studies.
6. Provide training and technical support to the platform users. Responsibilities included but not limited to raising request for extraction of aggregated reports, installing and maintenance of software and required libraries for users, training end-users on platform access, management of user access, user on-boarding, troubleshooting for user access issue and escalation of issues to platform administrator.
7. Provide technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, data cleansing, data profiling, quality assurance, archiving data workflow and codebook.

(B) GENERAL (10%)
1. To work with Bioinformatics Officer, Research Officer/ Associate/ Fellow, where applicable and clinicians
2. To work with IT administrators to optimise the data transfer and bring the system up to near-real time data transfer.
3. To maintain data accuracy and currency at all times.
4. Any other duties as assigned by the Project Lead/ Principal Investigator.

Requirements:

1. Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Science, Mathematics or preferably in Bioinformatics, preferably with more than 3 years of relevant experience
2. Proficiency in Microsoft word, Excel, Power Point and data management
3. Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical layman terms.
4. Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Oracle, R, Matlab and Python is preferred
5. Proficiency with Hadoop, Spark, MapReduce, HDFS, Pig, Hive or Impala is preferred
6. Domain knowledge in healthcare data is preferred.
7. Excellent Interpersonal, written and oral communications skills
8. Meticulous with demonstrated organizational skill, able to work independently, multi-tasking is required
9. Experience with relational database, coding and web development is a plus
10. Highly motivated, team player and willing-to-learn attitude
11. Self-starter, excellent critical thinking, problem solving and strong analytical skills.
12. Good interpersonal and customer care skills

title: Executive / Senior Executive / Assistant Manager / Manager (Exams & Timetabling - Science Dean's Office)
company_info: The National University of Singapore aspires to be a vital community of academics, researchers, staff, students and alumni working together in a spirit of innovation and enterprise for a better world. Our singular focus on talent will be the cornerstone of a truly great university that is dedicated to quality education, influential research and visionary enterprise, in service of country and society.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
The incumbent will provide administrative support to the Undergraduate Studies Section, Dean's Office, Faculty of Science. Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following -
1) Faculty Co-ordinator for timetabling
Keep abreast of Science Faculty Curriculum Committee (SFCC)/Board of Undergraduate Studies (BUS)/University Committee on Educational Policy (UCEP)/Senate approved proposals to facilitate planning and scheduling of classes and examinations.
Coordinate with departments for planning of following academic year's timetable in the Class and Examination Timetabling System (CMIS).
Update class and examinations timetable changes as and when required.
Work with departments to verify accuracy of data and resolve any issues for the purpose of Student Feedback Exercise.
2) Pre-examination preparation and during examination support
Plan and coordinate examination activities for each Academic Year according to the timelines and deadlines stipulated by Registrar's Office.
Coordinate system updates for examinations related information and ensure data is appropriately entered.
Act as liaison between Registrar's Office and departments to ensure that all necessary information are disseminated and shared with all parties involved.
See to the examinations logistical requirements as well as arrangements for students with special needs.
3) Post-examination activities
Coordinate and work closely with departments to complete the necessary checks and comply with the examinations processing schedule stipulated by Registrar's Office.
Perform the duties of Faculty's Board of Examiners Secretariat and ensure that decisions made are updated accurately and quickly in Edurec and followed through.
Plan, conduct and prepare report for examinations audit.
4) Undergraduate Studies Section duties
To be rostered for section duties such as taking notes of regular section meetings, replying to email enquiries from students, and counter duties.
5) Others
Provide assistance at University/Faculty level events such as Open House, Freshmen Orientation Briefing, and Commencement.
Any other duties as assigned by the Vice Dean.
Qualifications/Requirements/Other Info
Degree holder with positive learning attitude.
Experience in timetabling and scheduling will be advantageous.
Proficient in Microsoft applications.
Ability to work under pressure and multi-task in a fast-paced environment with multiple timelines and demands.
Ability to exercise tact and discretion in handling sensitive and confidential information.
Possess effective oral and written communication skills.
Mature, independent, adaptive and meticulous.
A team player with the ability to interact well with all levels of stakeholders.
- Remuneration is based on a 12-month salary structure, with annual variable bonus which is subject to incumbent’s performance and the University/School’s prevailing remuneration policies.
- The incumbent will be emplaced at an appropriate appointment grade based on his/her individual merits.
- To expedite application processing, a copy of academic certificates and transcripts from GCE O-level onwards should be uploaded via the online application portal.

Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at our NUS Career Portal.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Formal application:
Please submit your application, indicating your current/expected salary, supported by a CV and full contacts of 3 referees.

title: Personal Assistant to Director
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A Tech company is seeking a highly competent and proactive Personal Assistant to provide comprehensive administrative support to their Director.

Personal Assistant to Director

Job Description:
The successful candidate must be bilingual in English and Chinese as this role requires to liaise with Chinese speaking stakeholders.

As a Personal Assistant, you will handle a broad range of administrative tasks, both business-related and personal, ensuring the smooth running of the Director's daily affairs.

Responsibilities:
- Handle a broad range of administrative tasks, both business-related and personal, ensuring
the smooth running of the Director's daily affairs.
- Manage and coordinate the Director's schedule, including arranging appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements.
- Act as the first point of contact, screening and prioritizing incoming communications such as phone calls, emails, and mail.
- Provide high-quality and efficient administrative support, including preparing and editing documents, reports, presentations, and correspondence.
- Attend meetings along with the Director, take minutes, and provide follow-up actions.
- Coordinate and negotiate with external vendors and suppliers.
- Assist with personal matters, such as managing personal appointments, reservations, events, and assist in running personal errands.
- Perform any other duties as and when assigned by the Director.
- Maintain confidentiality on all business and personal matters.

Requirements:
- Bachelor's degree or above in a relevant field.
- With a need to effectively communicate with Chinese-speaking stakeholders, possessing bilingual proficiency in both written and spoken English and Chinese is a MUST.
- Proven experience in providing comprehensive administrative support to high-level executives.
- Excellent organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact professionally at all levels.
- Discretion and confidentiality in handling sensitive information.
- Flexibility and adaptability to evolving priorities and changing work demands.

Preferred Qualifications:
- Previous experience in working as a Personal Assistant or Executive Assistant.
- Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to anticipate needs and proactively address issues.

Please send in your updated CV to recruit@future-ehr.com, stating:

· Your expected salary

· Reason for leaving

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Quant Matter is a quantitative-based trading firm that specializes in crypto market-making and multi-asset trading, such as futures, stocks, commodities, forex and cryptocurrency. Our team focuses on developing and deploying high-quality quantitative-based strategies and predictive signals (alpha) and trading on global financial markets with the goal of achieving a sustainable long-term investment objective.

We are seeking a proac.ve and highly organized Executive Assistant to provide comprehensive support to our Founder. This is a unique opportunity for a motivated individual who is willing to go above and beyond, including traveling overseas as needed, to assist the Founder in managing various aspects of the business.

The ideal candidate should have a strong desire to learn and grow within the company, as there is potential for this role to evolve into a more substantial leadership position.

What You Will Do:
Executive Support: Provide high-level administrative and daily tasks support to Founder during clients interactions.
Create briefing materials, develop agendas, and craft presentations to ensure the Founder is thoroughly prepared and informed.
Travel: Be willing to travel both domestically and internationally as required.
Documentation: Assist in drafting and editing documents, reports, and emails.
Project Assistance: Collaborate with the Founder on various projects to ensure deadlines are met.
Learning and Development: Be open to training and mentorship from the Founder.
Business Management: As the role progresses, be prepared to take on increasing responsibilities in the management of certain aspects of the business.

Our Ideal Candidates Would Have:
Proven experience as an executive assistant or in a similar administrative role.
Class 3A driving license - might require to drive if the driver is unavailable.
Exceptional organizational and time-management skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
Willingness to travel both domestically and internationally.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion.
A positive and proactive attitude with a strong desire to learn and grow.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Morgan McKinley is seeking a Senior Executive Administrative Assistant for a 12-month contract highly renewable.

As a Senior Executive Assistant, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the seamless operation of the executive team. You will be responsible for managing complex calendars, coordinating travel arrangements, and overseeing expense reports. Your ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and prioritize tasks efficiently will be key to your success in this role.

Key Responsibilities:
Calendar Management: Efficiently schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments, and events for executives, utilizing time management skills to optimize their daily schedules.
Travel Coordination: Arrange domestic and international travel, including flights, accommodations, and ground transportation, ensuring a smooth and stress-free travel experience.
Expense Management: Process and reconcile expense reports, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies.
Communication: Act as a primary point of contact for executives, screen and prioritize emails and calls, and handle correspondence with professionalism.
Documentation: Prepare and maintain important documents, reports, and presentations.
Meeting Support: Provide logistical support for meetings, including preparing agendas, taking minutes, and ensuring follow-up on action items.
Team Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments and team members to facilitate cross-functional projects and initiatives.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience preferred.
Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or similar role supporting senior executives.
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in calendar management, travel coordination, and expense reporting.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software.
Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively.
Interested candidates may apply through the application system or send it to sg-techcontracting@morganmckinley.com. Shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Executive Assistant (Shipping/Perm/Up to $5300)

Your Opportunity

The position of Executive Assistant reports to the Officers to provide full administrative and executive business support to the Officers in a responsive, timely, accurate and effective manner. Assignment involves work of a confidential nature, exposure to sensitive information and contacts requiring considerable discretion, judgment, tactful and diplomacy.

Accountabilities/Responsibilities

· Provide full spectrum of logistical, administrative and personal support to the Officers.
· Manage Officers’ calendars and schedules, ensuring accuracy and timely input. Provide agenda and meeting materials as needed.
· Manage the travel and logistics arrangements, and process claims/expenses.
· Interact professionally with all levels of management, staff and external parties across the region and internationally. Work with the Officers’ direct reports and stakeholders locally and regionally on day-to-day operational issues, meetings and other matters, maintaining a high level of communication and ensure timely and accurate sharing of information.
· Schedule and setting up various local/regional meetings, arrange meeting venue and refreshment, and help facilitate at these meetings where necessary. Manage/assist in the logistic arrangements such as flights, hotel, transportation, visa application etc.
· Coordinate government official’s visits by collaborating with respective departments for necessary preparations to ensure smooth proceedings. This includes but is not limited to arrangements for meeting venues, logistics, meals etc.
· Support the Officer in following up on the status of projects / cross-functional tasks and assignments when required. Collaborate with other teams to ensure policies, procedures and timelines are met.
· Assist in the preparation of business reports, presentations, materials, collating of data and consolidating of reports from the region.
· Communicate on behalf of the Officers when delegated.
· Support the Officers in the management of his/her IT equipment (e.g., laptop, printers and office phone), mobile devices as well as personal and corporate software applications.
· Be responsive to emails/ text messages/ phone calls, with contact outside normal business hours where needed.
· Manage proper archival and management of documents.
· Any other job/task assigned by Officers.

Critical Requirements

· Ability to maintain in strict confidentiality all work and information assigned.
· Demonstrate professionalism at all times by demonstrating personal accountability, effective work habits, empathy and teamwork.
· Highly organized individual with the ability to exercise good judgement in diverse situations and balance multiple priorities.
· Communicate with clarity and maintain good relationships with other business units and entities.
· Proven experience in large organizations with complex structure. Comfortable with coordinating meetings/work tasks across multiple time zones.

Job Requirements

· Possess at least a secondary education or equivalent with up to 4 years working experience in corporate / executive office, preferably with administrative/executive experience in a fast-pace MNC setting.
· Proven track record in providing Executive Assistant support to C-Suite Level Executives with a high degree of discretion, confidentiality, professionalism, and attention to detail without missing the big picture.
· Demonstrated strong planning, organisational and time management skills and ability to proactively determine priorities and appropriate sequencing to accomplish daily expectations and handle multiple demands.
· Excellence business writing and proofreading skills.
· Requires a high level of interpersonal, social and customer service skills for daily interactions, both in person and digitally and work cooperatively as a team member.
· Ability to informally lead and influence others.
· Confident in exercising appropriate judgement while keeping stakeholders informed in a fast-paced work environment.
· Must be flexible and detail oriented to meet strict deadlines and be capable of multi-tasking.
· High proficiency in Microsoft Office 365, especially Excel and Power Point with the ability to produce graphs and charts.
· Must be technologically savvy to IT equipment (e.g. video conferencing system).
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
· Fluency in English required, other language skills are a plus.

Work Location
On-Site: Singapore. Office Location will be discussed at a later stage.


EA License No. 01C4394 • RCB No. 200007268E •EA Registration No. R22109454 Malcolm Lee Jun Hao

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A. Overall Purpose Of The Job

The position provides administrative and secretarial support to the senior stakeholders of Singapore Site and other team members as and when required.


B. Key Responsibilities

1. Administrative & Secretarial Support

To provide secretarial support and organize travel arrangements based on Travel Policy guidelines and input expenses claims for senior stakeholders.
To provide administrative support for related documentation (on-line & physical) completion and submission, including scanning for tenders and tender submissions
To organize and follow-up on the scheduled fortnightly/monthly calls/webinars/reviews.
To organize Kick-Off and Annual meetings for the relevant teams.
Taking and Circulation of minutes as required
Assist in budgeting for Singapore Site relating to travel, entertainment, and other expenses.
Prepare power-point presentations according to the agenda


2. Others

To provide support, on a case-by-case basis, initiatives in the region/group when requested by the senior management.
Handles complex, confidential, and sensitive information.
Fully involved in routine aspects of the senior stakeholders.
Plans, organizes, and prioritizes the schedules assigned.
Requires specialized skills and experience and ability to perform a variety of important, confidential, and complex tasks with constantly changing priorities.
Act as a personal assistant, handling a portion of the administrative work in the senior stakeholders’ absence.
Handles and compiles data for special projects.


C. Job Profile

Required Skills and Knowledge
Experience in multi-tasking and supporting several managers in past organizations.
Excellent administration and secretarial skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Knowledge and experience of internal company organization and network to solve ad-hoc enquiries and/or problems as and when they arise.

Required Competencies

You will have access to confidential information, requiring absolute discretion at all times.
You will have demonstrable experience of working at a similar level and proven administrative, secretarial and office skills.
You will need to be able to pro-actively plan, coordinate, organize, and anticipate requirements well in advance to support the smooth running of the business.
You will have excellent written and verbal communication skills and be experienced at dealing with a range of external stakeholders including client groups at local, regional, and Global levels.
Ability to multi-task and work in a fast paced environment and effectively manage stakeholders.
Good "people" skills
Demonstrates clear initiative and ability to lead and manage core responsibilities but have a well-developed sense of when to escalate and flag issues to Managers. Is dynamic and forthcoming in suggesting innovative ways of doing tasks / increasing efficiency
Required Work Experience

7 to 10 years of prior experience in a similar capacity in MNCs and preferably in the service industry
Those with lesser years of experience but possess great attitude and service mindset will also be considered.
Must have experience working for a group of senior executives
Working experience in a diverse cultural environment

Required Qualifications
Minimum Diploma

Required Languages
Highly Proficient with oral and written English Language

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Care Corner Singapore Ltd was founded in 1981, in a climate of changes in the early 1980s, as economic competition in the region intensified and the rift between the wealthy and the lower-income in particular the Chinese blue-collar workers, widened. Rev Tan Tien Ser and a group of passionate individuals believed that these marginalised people with lower income and little opportunities for a formal education could be helped to realise their potential and become more competent and fulfilled persons. Through a series of early outreach initiatives, Care Corner has evolved into an organisation offering a wide range of programmes and services delivered through various social service centres located island-wide. In a bid to stay relevant to the needs of the community, Care Corner has continuously strived to offer new and innovative programmes to support those in need and the less privileged.
RESPONSIBILITIES
You will be part of the team to provide programme support for transnational couples, couples in early marrige or preparing for marriage. This include events planning and coordinating workshops that cater to the unique needs of transnational families and young couples aged between 18 to 24. Responsibilities include: 
Events planning and implementation based on client needs
Provide administrative support for events and workshops
Plan manpower roster for programme
Guide volunteers in executing programme activities
Develop informative materials for clients and volunteers
Coordinate with external agencies for execution of programme
Conduct outreach activities to target client group
Provide feedback and programme updates.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor Degree in any field
Requirements:
At least 1-2 years of programme/project administration or other relevant experience
MS Office proficiency.
OTHER INFORMATION
Thank you for your application. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified for interviews.
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Care Corner Singapore Ltd

title: Executive Assistant (Regional leaders)
company_info: Headquartered in the Netherlands, Randstad is a Fortune Global 500 Company and the second largest recruitment & HR services provider globally. Operating in over 40 countries, Randstad employs over 567,700 people in meaningful employment everyday. With global reach and local expertise, Randstad Singapore has over 20 years experience in the Singapore market and are dedicated to delivering high quality, consistent service to our clients and candidates. Our passionate, consultants will provide you with career advice and opportunities that meet your career goals and aspirations. With the widest range of industry specialists across: Accounting Banking & Financial Services Business Support Engineering Information Technology Life Sciences Supply Chain & Procurement Sales, Marketing & Communications Let us help you shape your work of work. Search for your next career opportunity at www.randstad.com.sg/jobs or contact us on +65 6510 1350.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
about the company
My client is a global industry leader in the transportation and logistics industry, which provides rapid and reliable services to more than 220 countries. If you are seeking to be part of a forward looking organisation who has built a great and close knit culture among their employees, apply now!
about the job
In this role, you will be focused on extending great secretarial support to 2 regional leaders in the management team, including complex calendar management, scheduling meetings, intensive travel arrangements, processing and submitting expense reports, and preparing meeting agendas/materials as and when required. You will be expected to interact and communicate with stakeholders locally and across the region on a daily basis, and help to prepare all logistics for virtual/physical meetings for your leaders. The preparation of business reports, powerpoint presentations, consolidation of data and generation of reports for the regional offices will also fall under the care of this incumbent.
about the team
You will report directly to the senior leaders who you will be supporting, and will work closely with other EAs to provide coverage whenever necessary.
skills and experience required
You should be tertiary educated and come with at least 2 years of experience in providing secretarial support to multiple stakeholders who take charge of regional functions. Being highly organised and the ability to prioritise numerous tasks and requests, will help you to succeed in this role. You will need to have great communication skills to liaise with internal and external stakeholders efficiently, as well as flexibility to collaborate with regional counterparts in different time zones. You will be required to use Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint, to generate reports with charts/graphs and prepare slides for meetings.
To apply online please use the 'apply' function. Consultant in-charge: Rebecca Koh
(EA: 94C3609/ R2198637 )

title: Marketing Executive
company_info: Hustle & Bustle is the next generation activation and engagement company that specializes in creating unique stories and curating groundbreaking experiences. Our dynamic team have spearheaded inaugural firsts such as the Fullerton Concours d’Elegance, a vintage car exhibition, Dale Chihuly’s first major garden exhibition in Asia, Dale Chihuly: Glass in Bloom, at Gardens by the Bay, and most recently the debut of Van Gogh: The Immersive Experience Singapore, a first in Southeast Asia. We are hiring! Hustlers wanted. As Hustlers, first and foremost, we ENJOY what we are doing! We work hard, work smart and double down for what we believe in. We see challenges as part of the creative-solving process and as a team are constantly striving to be better, together, each and every single day. So that even when the going gets tough, the Hustlers get going!
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Hustlers wanted!

We are looking for an enthusiastic Marketing Executive to join our team of Hustlers. You will be working with some of the movers and shakers of the industry to curate some of the most memorable experiences, and you can be the one to tell that story!

The Role:

The ideal candidate is a self-motivated team player with strong work ethics and great communication skills - one who is able to work well and hustle alongside the team in a dynamic environment. This position calls for someone who has a hunger to learn and a passion for making events happen.

Key Responsibilities:
Provide support to the Marketing team in the development to execution of marketing and activation projects
Assist in the management of H&B social accounts (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn)
Develop campaign communications calendar and ensure timely execution
Assist in content development and copywriting for social media, EDMs, collaterals and campaigns
Coordinate marketing efforts with Creative and Projects Team
Coordinate with external partners (PR, Partners, Vendors) as required
Research and identify the latest trends and technologies affecting the industry
Maintain brand integrity across all company marketing initiatives and communications
Participate in event activations as required
Preferred Attributes:
At least 1 year of demonstrated experience in the marketing field
Keen eye for detail
Confident in verbal and written communications, especially in English
Willingness to learn and develop skill sets
Creative and bold in design
Works well in a team and/or ability to work independently

Founded since 1995, we are a registered Specialist Builder (Structual Steel) with BCA and have built up a strong presence in the local structural steel fabrication market, serving clients from a diverse range of industries including oil & gas, marine and pharmaceutical. In particular, we now specialise in the manufacturing of Passenger Boarding Bridges for airports, connecting aircrafts to airport terminals. title: Accounts Assistant
company_info: RecruiterPal is a cloud-based recruitment platform that helps you to recruit staff faster and easier, giving you full control and overview of your entire recruitment process.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Headquartered in Singapore, The EtonHouse International Education Group has 120 schools across 11 countries. We run pre-schools as well as K-12 international schools. Together, these schools provide internationally recognized programmes and high-quality education to over 20,000 students globally. The group also runs enrichment programmes and cutting-edge ed-tech programmes to scale the provision of high-quality education in pre-schools.
Over the last 27 years, EtonHouse has been at the forefront of international education in the Asia Pacific region and has won numerous awards. In 2019, our founder, Mrs. Ng Gim Choo won the EY Entrepreneur Of The Year Award in the Education category.  In addition, EtonHouse was recently selected to be in the inaugural cohort of the Scale-Up SG programme, which is an Enterprise Singapore programme selecting high-growth potential local companies which can be groomed into future global champions.
With children at the heart of what we do and the vision to make good quality education accessible to every child in Singapore, EtonHouse launched the EtonHouse Community Fund (ECF) in 2015. As an independent IPC charity, ECF continuously runs initiatives to make a difference in the lives of vulnerable children.
  EtonHouse Vision
Shaping the future through education
  EtonHouse Mission
Developing confident and capable global citizens
  Be a part of the EtonHouse family
We welcome passionate and dedicated professionals who share our belief in the power of education. Together, we can make a meaningful difference to children and society through education.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Issue of invoice and receipt for school fee and billings to parents and attend to their queries on the billings
Record billings and receipts in accounting system
Follow up on outstanding invoices with parents and other debtors
Co-ordinate the verification and approval of purchase invoices and staff reimbursements
Record purchase invoices and staff reimbursement in accounting system
Record all supplier invoices in accounting system
Follow up on outstanding issues with suppliers
Coordinate inventory count of uniforms as per company’s policy
Compile all the financial information to prepare for weekly and monthly reports to Senior Accounts Executive
Assist Senior Accounts Executive in month end closing and preparation of monthly management reports
Assist Senior Accounts Executive in year end audit
Maintain proper records of student movements and financial files
All other ad hoc duties assigned
QUALIFICATIONS
LCCI Certification or Diploma in Finance or Accounting
Good communication skills and well organized
Must be able to work under tight deadline
Strong Microsoft Excel skills preferred
At least 1 year of working experience in accounting field
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - EIH - HQ

WHY JOIN US
Vibrant working environment
Attractive benefits (Dependents Benefit, Flu Vaccination, AWS + PB, etc)

Responsibilities:
Improve and assist Project manager in tracking of records and archive all files in shared drive
Plan the request task by operations to maintenance executive
Check claims for the department
Engage vendors/contractors on behalf of maintenance executive on urgent request
Recommend and justify the costing of repairs cost quoted by vendors/contractors
Plan the daily task and routing for maintenance executive

Ensure prompt applications for approvals and clearances to the relevant authorities

Meticulous and able to work under pressure

title: Senior Executive Assistant, Allied Health Admin (5312) - Alexandra Hospital
company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
company_info: The National University Health System (NUHS) plays a key, contributing role in Singapore’s healthcare. Our versatile and experienced team of healthcare professionals has only one aim - to help people get better, and live healthier and longer lives. We do this by improving medical care, lowering disease recurrence, producing better healthcare professionals, and turning research findings into better medical treatments for diseases that affect Singaporeans. And the reason we’re able to do these things is because we have the best and most dedicated people. Come join us and help shape medicine for our future.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose

The Executive Assistant/ Senior Executive Assistant is to provide the main administrative support for assigned Allied Health departments.

Duties and Responsibilities
2.1 Primary Responsibilities and Duties (80%)
Manages department roster (on an assigned frequency)
Co-ordinate meetings, book venues, collate agenda and arrange for catering requirements when necessary.
Facilitate on-boarding of new staff; raising system and tap card accesses, coordinate on-board process, follow up issues with HR (if any)
Collate and update relevant data required by the department for purposes of cost management and improvement.
Handle purchase and work requisition processes, from calling suppliers for quotation to submitting invoices to Finance for payment.
Reconcile dropped charge reports for assigned department.
Assist in audit reviews by providing requested documents to relevant auditors
Handles procurement-related documentations (i.e. Purchase Requests, Sourcing Requests, Approval To Procure papers etc.)
2.2 Secondary Responsibilities and Duties (20%)
Collect and despatch documents from/to areas within hospital premises.
Requisite, control and maintain good utilisation of office supplies in the department.
Record and produce meeting minutes
Manage gift packs for storage and distribution.
Perform any other duties assigned by supervisor.
Job Specification
Diploma in healthcare-related/management courses (preferred)
Minimum 2 years of experience in clerical and administrative duties.
A good understanding of accounting and figures.
Good computer skills in Word, Excel and Power Point and SAP system
Critical thinking and problem-solving ability
Adaptable and able to work independently
If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading.

company_info: RecruiterPal is a cloud-based recruitment platform that helps you to recruit staff faster and easier, giving you full control and overview of your entire recruitment process.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
NTUC Health Co-operative Limited (NTUC Health) is an NTUC social enterprise that provides a comprehensive and integrated suite of quality and affordable health and eldercare services to meet the growing needs of families and their dependents. Building on more than four decades of experience and expertise, NTUC Health is among the largest senior day care, nursing home and home personal care providers in Singapore. It also offers other services for seniors such as an active ageing hub, senior activity centres, community support for vulnerable seniors, and a sheltered / senior group home. In addition, it runs a chain of dental clinics, and a family medicine clinic.
RESPONSIBILITIES
The Executive will assist the Operations Manager in managing daily operations and planning manpower to drive operational excellence in the Nursing Home.  This includes ensuring that the Nursing Home is in compliance with all regulatory, licensing, safety, and environmental requirements.
In addition, they will also have the opportunity to lead, train, supervise, and mentor staff in areas such as Facilities, Laundry, Housekeeping, Fire Command Centre, and Transportation sections of the Operations department. 
Identify and perform necessary maintenance on buildings and facilities
Conduct inspections periodically to evaluate the maintenance condition to identify necessary corrective actions
Report any deficiencies as they occur and request emergency or routine service
Oversee and manage the appointed contractors to ensure that they conform to the required standards
Manage the process of contracts and activate the renewal when due
Supervise the proper inventory management of medical and non-medical supplies and ensure that adequate stocks are available to meet operational needs
Responsible for administrative duties, including developing and maintaining operating procedures, verifying invoices, monitoring expenses, and assisting in budget exercise
Oversee fire safety measures in the nursing home
Participate and support work process improvement and technology enhancement projects
Manage and supervise a team of operations assistants inclusive of recruitment, discipline and performance appraisal
Ensure that the facilities team is in compliance with workplace safety standards
Other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS
Min Diploma/Degree in Business/Building/Facilities Management/Engineering or equivalent with 3 years relevant experience, of which 1 year in a supervisory role
Good in report writing
Possess experience in project management and budgeting
Independent with a high level of organizational skill
Able to work well under pressure and deliver within a tight timeline
Team player with excellent interpersonal and negotiating skills
Proficient in MS Office & Google Workspace
OTHER INFORMATION
Location: Tampines Nursing Home
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - NTUC Health

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This role offers an excellent opportunity for a highly organised, reliable and effective individual to take on the role of Personal Assistant (PA)/Executive Assistant (EA) in our firm and to work with a team of professionals. The role requires you to take responsibility for the full spectrum of functions performed by a PA to Partners and to support all other stakeholders in the team. You are expected to be proactive, forward-thinking and organized while assisting partners and teams with their work activities. You will be involved in many operational and strategical matters which will require you to thrive under pressure, maintain confidentiality and be good at multi-tasking.

Key Roles & Responsibilities
Provide full secretarial and administrative support to the Partners and other stakeholders. Be familiar with each partners' agenda, requests and working styles.
Booking and arranging travel, transport, accommodation and managing schedules of the partners and other stakeholders, taking accountability to plan and schedule arrangements in an appropriate and efficient manner.
Managing diaries, organising internal and external meetings, appointments, events, and/or taking minutes of meetings, etc. To be responsible for all necessary coordination, communication and exercise discretion of the time needed for such arrangements.
Handles and file expense claims for the reporting partners and keeps track and collate all expenses claims for required reporting purposes.
Performs administrative duties such as preparation of engagement letters, reports, invoices, audit files, etc and is responsible for effective and timely execution of each task.
Assist in the preparation/collation of email circulars, PowerPoint presentations, etc as and when needed.
Develop, maintain and support a good relationship with all other PAs and to render assistance in time of need. Develop teamwork and team spirit among all PAs.
Assist and take on ad hoc tasks, projects and engagements as and when designated and required by the partners.
Requirements
Diploma/degree holder in any field
Minimum 2-5 years of experience in secretarial/PA role
Microsoft Office and good knowledge of PowerPoint presentations or related presentation tools will be highly advantageous.
Excellent oral and written communication skills, with tact and diplomacy.
Great team player who works well with all levels of colleagues.
Discretion and trustworthiness to handle confidential information.
Flexible, adaptable, and highly independent.
Meticulous with good organisational skills and the ability to multitask.
High level of initiative and proactivity.
Cheerful and friendly disposition.

company_info: 1-Group Founded in 2005, 1-Group (formerly known as 1-Rochester Group) is now one of Singapore’s most successful lifestyle F&B groups. Leveraging on its successful award winning portfolio of restaurants, bars and clubs such as 1-Altitude, Stellar, UNA and Altimate, the group will be launching another 4 beautiful iconic venues, with 12 different exciting world-class concepts and covering over 100,000 sqft throughout Singapore. Each venue operates a portfolio of businesses. Their kitchens are helmed by talented executive chefs trained in multiple Michelin Starred restaurants that are internationally renowned. Their vibrant bars and clubs will host some of the best mixologists, bands and DJs in town. These new venues will also host some of the most romantic weddings and best corporate parties in Singapore. Overall, these new venues will enhance 1-Group’s presence locally and internationally, establishing it as one of the region’s Lifestyle F&B leaders. Over a decade, the group has established a reputation for “Hosting Great Memories”. It continues to be dedicated in providing exceptional guest experience across the group, winning many international awards and accolades for its concept, food, service and ambience. The group even owns a unique and proprietary management system; c-LeadershipTM (“Collective-Leadership”) and r-ManagementSystemTM . Job description:
- Check and verify before issuing Sale Invoices and update the collection accordingly.

title: Executive Assistant
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This position is open for both full-time and part-time.

Job Description:
The Executive Assistant at the Young Heroes Cancer Care Centre plays a crucial role in ensuring the efficient operation of the center's programs and services. This position primarily focuses on providing essential administrative support to maintain the smooth functioning of various activities. The assistant's responsibilities encompass a range of tasks, including but not limited to finance-related administrative duties such as submitting payment requests and claims.

Key Responsibilities:
Financial Administration: Process payment requests and claims, ensuring accurate documentation and adherence to established financial procedures. Assist in tracking and managing expenses related to the center's programs. Maintain financial records and prepare reports as required.
Administrative Support: Assist in scheduling appointments, meetings, and events for the center. Maintain organized files and records to facilitate easy retrieval of information. Collaborate with the team to ensure effective communication and coordination.
Program Support: Assist in program coordination, including arranging logistics, materials, and resources as needed. Support the implementation of various activities, workshops, and events. Help maintain databases and records related to program participants.
Client Interaction: Provide courteous and helpful assistance to clients, families, and visitors. Assist in responding to inquiries and providing information about the center's services.
The Executive Assistant will contribute significantly to the Young Heroes Cancer Care Centre's mission by ensuring that administrative functions run smoothly, allowing the center to focus on providing essential services and support to children and families facing cancer.

title: Executive Assistant
company_info: FTI Consulting, Inc. is a global business advisory firm dedicated to helping organisations protect and enhance enterprise value in an increasingly complex legal, regulatory and economic environment. With over 4,200 employees located in 26 countries, FTI Consulting professionals work closely with clients to anticipate, illuminate and overcome complex business challenges in areas such as investigations, litigation, mergers and acquisitions, regulatory issues, reputation management, strategic communications and restructuring. At FTI Consulting, you will be a part of a team that encourages collaboration, values excellence and above all, is committed to delivering the utmost service to our clients. More information can be found at www.fticonsulting.com.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the Role:

As an Executive Assistant, you will provide secretarial and administrative support to the team. Duties include diary and travel management, correspondence, and other various ad hoc administration duties.

Calendar Management
Accountable for calendar management for Senior Managing Directors
Interact with both internal and external executives and assistants and coordinate a variety of complex executive meetings
Proactively spot opportunities to add internal and external meetings; interviews, staff meetings, follow-ups
Travel Arrangement
Coordinate travel arrangements including booking of flights, hotels and local transfer(s)
Develop understanding of Senior Managing Directors scheduling and travel preferences
Timesheet and Expense Reporting
Assist in managing timesheets for Senior Managing Directors
Prepare and submit of expense reimbursements
Prepare vendor invoice payments and billing
Daily administration
Perform various ad hoc administration duties to the team from time to time
Work with the logistic company for shipping arrangements
Manage documents and project deliverables when requested
Manage storage or disposal of confidential client information
Assist in producing presentations as required
Act as central point of contact for all assigned Senior Managing Directors administrative needs, liaise with other departments as necessary
Liaise with the operational functions (Admin, Finance, HR, Marketing, IT etc) on internal processes and procedures
Provide coverage for Executive Assistants when necessary
Other ad-hoc duties may be required

Basic Qualifications
Possess at least Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma in Business Administration / Secretarial Cert or equivalent
At least 5-6 years of experience in supporting multiple executives
Experience in management consultancy or other professional services environment highly preferred
Problem solver - able to work with other teams and staff members effectively to reach a viable solution and goal
Strong service focus - dedicated to meeting the expectations of all staff through securing effective relationships with clients and executing deliverables to the highest standards.
Excellent communicator and negotiator - able to deal effectively with people at all levels across a multicultural environment
Ability to maintain and respect confidentiality
Ability to manage a heavy work volume and meet deadlines in an extremely fast paced environment
Ability to juggle several tasks at once, to prioritize and manage own time - Not a clock watcher or someone who is unwilling to step outside their job description
Able to start work immediately or within short period of time

title: Executive Assistant
company_info: XCL World Academy is an international school in Singapore for students aged 2 to 18, fully committed to the academic, emotional and social development of its students. We are immensely proud to be the first and only international school in Singapore authorized to offer all four International Baccalaureate (IB) programmed. We aspire to recruit employees that share and understand our commitment towards creating our mission of empowering an international community of happy learners who aspire to positively impact others. We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. All appointments are subject to Safer Recruitment processes such as interviews, employment reference checks, identity and criminal record checks. A career with XCL World Academy offers all the opportunities associated with a dynamic, forward-thinking organisation, including international prospects, professional development, career progression and the chance to work with some of the foremost educational professionals from around the world. XCL World Academy is a part of XCL Education’s network of award-winning international schools serving thousands of students across South East Asia.We are a truly international school with a cohort representing over 60 nationalities. We provide an outstanding international education consisting of four International Baccalaureate® (IB) programmes united by the IB’s philosophy and approaches to teaching and learning. We are looking for committed, passionate and highly-qualified IB practitioners with an energising attitude, focused on delivering an engaging learning experience for all our students. We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. All appointments are subject to Safer Recruitment processes such as interviews, employment reference checks, identity, criminal record checks, and background checks done from the home country.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
XCL World Academy is looking to recruit an Executive Assistant who will work closely with the CEO, XCL Singapore School to organise all functions of the school's central office.
The successful incumbent should be comfortable and strong in taking minutes in management meetings. He/She is required to start immediately, in providing a range of office, clerical and personal/professional services to the CEO.
The work will require a variety of unspecified and sometimes unpredictable tasks that need a good understanding of the entire school organisation, including sub offices and departments.
Main Responsibilities
Organise CEO’s calendar (including providing alerts in relation to the School’s calendar events and other responsibilities and appointments), facilitate meeting needs and set up visitor logs in the visitor management system.
Provide, as requested, (but not limited to) confidential secretarial services to the CEO.
Deal with incoming and outgoing correspondences, telephone calls, emails, and communications.
Organise and maintain the filing system related to school issues, including school policies and procedures.
Maintain the Staff Portal in association with Human Resources and other Departments.
Responsible for the flow of accurate information as required to other school offices and for maintaining official school office records for the CEO for references as needed.
Compiles agendas with input from the Senior Leadership Team, Academic Leadership Team and Management Team meetings and assembles required materials for meetings and circulate them prior to meetings.
Arrange interviews with parents, staff and teachers and external visitors as applicable.
Arrange CEO’s travel itineraries and arrangements.
Organise special occasion projects and events with/for the CEO.
Organise workload and priorities on a daily basis in a systematic and organised manner and meet daily or periodically with the CEO to review needs and priorities.
Records meeting minutes or notes, maintain a digital record, and circulate the completed copy to meeting participants as required. Scrutinise all minutes taken and remind leadership team members on actions needed appropriately.
Become the main point of contact for governing agencies such as CPE and EDB. Disseminates communications from the agencies appropriately.
Manage the Conference Room bookings for specific meetings, prepare ad-hoc reports, and coordinate parent events to engage parents in school activities and celebrations.
Deal with inquiries - especially during any absence of the CEO and decide on how to deal with the query, whether to be referred or delegated to another member of staff.
Use discretion in providing both personal and professional information within and outside the school.
Maintain and upkeep the appearance of the CEO, conference rooms and meeting areas in a professional manner.
Person Specifications
Minimum Diploma or Degree in Business Administration/Management/Secretarial certifications.
Minimum 5-7 years experience in a similar role, preferably within a school environment.
Excellent proficiency in minutes taking.
Excellent stakeholder management skills, interpersonal skills, able to communicate and engage effectively and professionally to build a good relationship with internal and external members.
Ability to work as an individual as well as in a team with exceptional collaborative skills.
Able to manage situations and remain calm when under pressure.
Has a strong ability to be organised, keep a clear head, and keep track of everything from deadlines to essential files.
Portrays time-management skills while working on several projects, has the ability to manage time effectively, prioritises, meet deadlines and be the timekeeper for the CEO on certain projects.
Able to manage moving parts and project management on certain deliverables and projects.
Takes initiative, detail-oriented and produces quality work.
High level of EQ and ability to maintain confidentiality over information shared within the team.
Application
Interested applicants are welcome to apply by 10 October 2023.
About us
XCL World Academy offers a rigorous and balanced education for students aged 2 to 18, beginning with our Nursery programme and continuing through the full International Baccalaureate (IB) continuum of studies. We believe in future-proofing your child by providing relevant skills and exposure, equipping them with the skills required for the jobs of tomorrow. Through our world-class curriculum and with the guidance of highly experienced teachers, our students embark on a self-directed journey to become skilled and empathetic young individuals.
We aspire to recruit employees that share and understand our commitment towards creating our mission of empowering an international community of happy learners who aspire to positively impact others. We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. All appointments are subject to Safer Recruitment processes such as interviews, employment reference checks, identity and criminal record checks. Selected candidate[s] would be required to provide documentation of background checks done from the home country.

company_info: The Tsao Foundation strives to help older persons realise opportunities in longevity by being a catalyst for constructive systemic and mindset change. This mission is undertaken through four synergistic core initiatives: Community for Successful Ageing (ComSA) takes a community-wide approach to forge an integrated system of comprehensive programmes and services with the aim to promote health and wellbeing over the life course, and to enable ageing in place. Hua Mei Centre for Successful Ageing which enables ageing-in-place by pioneering replicable, community-based, integrated health and psychosocial age care service models grounded in person-centred principles Hua Mei Training Academy, dedicated to capacity building in professional community-based age care, informal and family caregiving, as well as personal development and community action in successful ageing through providing practitioner-driven training, education and consultancy services International Longevity Centre Singapore which supports policy, practice, advocacy and community development through initiating high impact research and collaborative platforms in population ageing issues and related action Established in 1993, the Tsao Foundation is a Singapore-registered charity with IPCs (Institutions of a Public Character) and engaged in the global response to longevity.
