title: Corporate Secretarial Executive / Assistant
company_info: MiRXES is a Singapore headquartered biotechnology startup with sales globally. MiRXES develops cutting-edge assay technologies and products for the detection of miRNA for research and clinical diagnostic use. MiRXES partners multinational pharmaceutical companies and world-renown clinical institutions to develop next-generation blood based cancer diagnostic and prognostic tests.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Mirxes is a Singapore-headquartered molecular diagnostic company with R&D, manufacturing, and clinical lab operations in Singapore, USA, Japan, and China. We specialize in microRNA technologies and the development, manufacturing, and provision of diagnostic test kits and clinical services. Our mission is to enable early disease detection and provide insights for better patient care by harnessing the power of microRNA to augment traditional testing. Our vision is to be the world’s leading developer and provider of accurate, actionable, and affordable microRNA-powered diagnostic tests.

Job Summary
To perform full spectrum of corporation secretarial duties including incorporation, preparation of Directors’ resolutions, minutes of board and shareholders’ meetings, AGM.

Roles and Responsibilities
Review/perform incorporation of new companies, on-going corporate secretarial matters, striking off, ensuring compliance with the requirements of the Singapore Companies Act and the relevant laws.
Update and maintain of statutory registers and records, ensure compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements.
Review/preparation of Directors’/Shareholders’ resolutions and manage timely filing of AGM, EGM and Annual Return documents, familiar with ACRA e-filing.
To provide support in preparation of the board & committee meetings including taking minute of the proceedings, prepare resolutions, preparation of agenda, etc.
Drafting ad hoc resolutions referencing agreements.
Review/prepare of XBRL reports would be an advantage.
Experience in administration of offshore companies would be an added advantage.
Other ad-hoc duties.

Desired Skills and Competencies
Minimum a Diploma or equivalent
Experience in audit firm, law firm or as in-house Corporate Secretarial department.
Corporate Secretarial qualification (ICSA) or other relevant qualification.
Independent, good coordination and communication skills.
Able to handle multiple projects simultaneously with exceptional organization and time-management skills.
Conscientious and meticulous and able to work under pressure.
Well versed in both spoken and written English and Mandarin.
Have initiative, responsible and be a team player.
Proficient in MS office.

We appreciate your interest in the above-mentioned position, however, due to overwhelming response, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Since October 2011, Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC) was incorporated as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large.
THKMC provides assistance to the various groups in our community through more than 60 programmes and services for the elderly and the sick, families, persons with disabilities, and children.  We help anyone in need with full respect to their race, colour, creed, language, culture and religion. We have more than 90 programmes and services, reaching out to more than 55,000 people in the community.
Together, as ONETHK – Empowering the Community.
RESPONSIBILITIES
The Early Intervention Programme for Infants & Children (EIPIC) division helps equip children with motor, communication, social, self-help and cognitive skills. THK Development Support and Learning Support Programme (THK DS-LS) is a community-based intervention programme for K1 and K2 children with mild learning needs. We provide short-term support to children in their preschools in order to optimise their learning as well as increase their participation and integration in daily classroom activities and routines.
Reports to the Senior Social Worker, and/or DS-LS Programme Manager.
Responsibilities:
Work onsite to perform administrative duties such as answering phone calls, mailing and filing of documents, collection of school fees and weekly bank-ins
Participate in Case Filter Meetings, take notes and maintain good record keeping
Assist with scheduling of cases for professionals who are working with child
Maintain accurate records, prepare reports for governing agencies, collate information and submit government means-test applications
Follow up with parents, hospitals and preschools on necessary documents for submission. This may include travelling to different preschools in the Central and Central-South region of Singapore
Assist with audit preparations such as checking of files
Ad-hoc duties as assigned by supervisor
QUALIFICATIONS
Minimally O levels, with extensive years of working experience / A Levels
1 to 3 years of experience working in SSAs preferred, fresh graduates may apply
Proficient in MS Office Applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)
Team player, meticulous and have good administrative skills
Able to work independently
Able to meet deadlines on a tight schedule
Have some understanding of the diverse cultures and races
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities

title: Senior Executive / Assistant Manager, Performance Marketing
company_info: The Institute of Singapore Chartered Accountants (ISCA) is the national accountancy body of Singapore. ISCA’s vision is to be a globally recognised professional accountancy body, bringing value to our members, the profession and wider community. There are over 32,000 ISCA members making their stride in businesses across industries in Singapore and around the world. Established in 1963, ISCA is an advocate of the interests of the profession. Possessing a Global Mindset, with Asian Insights, ISCA leverages its regional expertise, knowledge, and networks with diverse stakeholders to contribute towards Singapore’s transformation into a global accountancy hub. ISCA is the Administrator of the Singapore CA Qualification and the Designated Entity to confer the Chartered Accountant of Singapore - CA (Singapore) - designation. ISCA is a member of Chartered Accountants Worldwide (CAW). CAW brings together 12 chartered accountancy bodies connecting and representing the interests of over 1.7 million members and students globally. For more information, visit www.isca.org.sg.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
🚀 Are you a savvy marketer with a passion for driving results?
✨ Do you have a knack for impactful multi-channel digital marketing campaigns?
🔮 Are you ready to play a pivotal role in shaping the future of the accountancy profession?

If yes, we want YOU to be a part of our exciting journey!

Responsibilities:
Agency Management: Collaborate with external agencies to drive and optimise marketing campaigns, ensuring seamless and impactful execution of strategies.
Campaign Operations: Plan, implement, and monitor high-performing marketing campaigns (Search, Display, and Social), driving both awareness and conversions.
Marketing Analytics: Utilise tools like Google Analytics, HubSpot, and Power BI to derive actionable insights, track campaign performance, and continuously optimise marketing efforts.
Project Management: Demonstrate excellent organisational skills and manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring smooth coordination and timely delivery of marketing initiatives.
Requirements:
Knowledge in agency management - because you know how to get things done with the best in the business!
Experience in Search Engine Marketing Campaigns, Programmatic Display Campaigns, and Paid Social Campaigns - you're the go-to guru for all things performance marketing.
Hands-on experience with Analytics tools is a plus - you're a data wizard, turning numbers into actionable insights!
Good organisational skills and project management - you're the epitome of efficiency, ensuring nothing slips through the cracks.
2 to 4 years of relevant experience - you've already made waves in the performance marketing landscape and are hungry for more.
Why join us?
This is a golden opportunity to be a part of a forward-thinking organisation committed to embracing innovation, diversity, and career development. Working at ISCA, you'll be empowered to push boundaries, collaborate with industry leaders, and contribute to the transformation of the accountancy profession. We empower our team to make a real impact and grow both personally and professionally.

Join us on this exciting journey of growth and impact! Together, let's shape the future of finance and accounting.

👉 Apply now and be a catalyst for change! ✨🌟

E-commerce Executive/ Marketing Assistant

About the Role:
Join our dynamic team as an E-commerce Executive/Marketing Assistant! We're on the lookout for an enthusiastic and self-motivated individual to drive our online presence and sales.

Key Responsibilities:

E-commerce Order Management: Handle backend order fulfillment processes such as invoicing, printing shipping labels, parcel packing, and processing.

Sales & Branding: Strategically plan and implement campaigns to elevate sales and foster branding initiatives.

Inventory Management: Oversee stock arrangements - unpacking, sorting, repacking, updating in the system, and stock-taking. Ensure efficient stock replenishment and proper warehouse organization.

Delivery Coordination: Collaborate with the delivery team to guarantee timely and accurate order fulfillment.

Product Showcase: Manage product photography and list products on E-commerce platforms including Shopee, Lazada, Qoo10, and Magento.

Ad Hoc Tasks: Undertake any other duties as required.

To Apply:
Forward your resume to shirley@asleya.co. We appreciate every application, but only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Position Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship, Contract

Please include the following details in your application:

Notice period.
Last drawn/current salary.
Salary expectations.
Reason for leaving your previous role.
Experience with inter-departmental duties, such as logistics, inventory, customer service, and sales.
Nationality.
If not a Singaporean, please specify your current permit status.
Thank you for considering a career with us!

title: HR Assistant / Executive
company_info: Crawfurd Hospital is a boutique healthcare facility offering bespoke service to the discerning patient. We host a comprehensive set of health screening and diagnostic facilities, designed to assist clinicians in achieving the best outcomes for patients. Crawfurd Hospital has a major focus on day surgeries, to minimize unnecessary patient stays and to allow them to recuperate at home in the company of their families. For those needing admission, we have 10 designer curated suites and a team of dedicated staff to assist in recovery. Pre-admission, we work with our valuable partners to ensure that patients are accompanied every step of the way, and to ensure a smooth transition of care between providers. Post- admission, our care coordinators will carefully follow up to ensure that patients post-op care is optimised and for early detection and intervention where necessary. With our management team taking a direct hands on approach in collaboration with our clinical partners, we aim to ensure a pleasant experience for patients, doctors, nurses and support staff. And importantly, we are constantly engaged with stakeholders to ensure all clinical and service quality measures are maintained and improved upon over time. We welcome you to be part of our family, and together, let us forge a healthy life ahead!

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description

· Providing secretarial, administrative, and personal support to MD.
· Conduct weekly diary meeting with the MD to discuss upcoming engagements, invitations, and other requests (e.g. meeting appointments, travel schedule, and travel arrangements).
· Schedule and manage meetings on behalf of MD, between him and his direct reports and the committees and group to which he is a member.
· Assist MD to follow up on tasks assigned to subordinates and managing MD’s appointment.
· Filter general information, queries, phone calls, and invitations to the MD by redirecting and taking forward such contacts as appropriate.
· Prepare correspondence on behalf of the MD, including the drafting of general replies.
· Prepare meeting minutes and follow up action plans after meeting as and when required.
· Maintain proper filing system for both electronic and hard copies filing.
· Prepare letters, memos for an announcement to staff and related parties.
· Support and assist in the planning of company activities.
· Assist on administrative duties of HR process (e.g. claiming of the levy, purchase of air-tickets, pass application, renew work passes).
· Maintain records and monitor company fleet vehicles, road tax renewal, etc.
· Provide administrative support to the department head for establishing the department structure and system, establishment of policies and procedures. Assist in the creation of necessary forms, documentation process presentations & systems where necessary.
· Other ad-hoc assignments as assigned.

Requirements:

· Minimum Diploma qualification.
· At least 3 years of relevant experience.
· Proficient in MS Office (MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, MS Word).
· Strong interpersonal skills in a professional and responsive manner.
· Demonstrate ability to handle work professionally, independently, and efficiently.
· Possess effective organizational and follow-up skills, attention to detail.
· Experienced in office administration.
· Good inter-personality skills, grooming & communication.
· Ability to manage complex and highly confidential information with discretion and integrity.
· Immediate starters preferred.

title: Management Executive
company_info: At Advanced Dental, we are committed to providing our patients with dental care catered to each of their unique needs. Since the establishment of our first clinic in 1986, we have grown to over 19 clinics across Singapore. Today, we are one of the fasting growing practices in Singapore and are proud to be able to provide a full range of treatments to meet all our patients’ dental needs within our practice. This is made possible by a dynamic and diverse group of professionals working together, whether in our clinics or behind the scenes. We are passionate about helping our patients feel amazing about their oral health every time a bite is taken or a smiled is shared.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Management Executive to join our organization. As a Management Executive, you will play a critical role in overseeing various aspects of our business operations and ensuring that organizational goals and objectives are met efficiently and effectively. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional leadership skills, a strategic mindset, and a proven track record of successfully managing teams and driving business growth.
The Management Executive will be instrumental in shaping the future of our organization and driving it towards greater success. If you have a passion for leading teams, a strategic mindset, and a desire to make a significant impact, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Role Overview
The management executives assist the Management in specialised support and/or operations management functions required to keep our clinics operationally ready.
This role is suitable for you if you take pride in challenges and problem solving and allows you to gain experience in an array of tasks hence, allowing you to accumulate transferrable skills for development and progression.

Core Functions of the Management Executive team
1. Operations Management:
· Oversee day-to-day operations to ensure smooth and efficient functioning of various departments.
· Analyse operational processes and implement improvements to enhance productivity and reduce costs.
· Develop and implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) to streamline workflows and maintain consistency.
· Patient management
2. Financial Management:
· Monitor financial performance and take proactive measures to achieve financial targets.
· Identify cost-saving initiatives and optimize resource allocation across departments.
· Business office functions (dealing with insurances, third party payment methods, reconciliation etc)
3. Team Development and Performance Management:
· Recruit, train, and mentor talented professionals to build a high-performing team.
· Conduct performance evaluations and provide regular feedback to employees, fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
· Identify training and development needs and coordinate appropriate learning opportunities for staff members.
· Compliance assurance

Performance Indicators
· Good interpersonal relations with peers and counterparts,
· Demonstrates remarkable aptitude in comprehending and delivering clear instructions.
· Exhibits adeptness in independent problem-solving.
· Delivers work of exceptional quality and precision.
· Exhibits a swift turnaround time for urgent tasks assigned.
· Reflects a profound understanding of the company’s goals and targets through attitude and work quality.

Qualifications & Experience
· Experience in working in start-ups and fast paced environments.
· Excellent strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.
· Strong financial acumen and budget management skills
· Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
· Ability to adapt and learn new roles.
· Proficiency in using Airtable, Softr or other any SAAS skills will be an advantage.

title: Accounts Assistant / Executive (Accounts Receivable)
company_info: CARLTON HOTEL (SINGAPORE) PTE LTD We are a preferred Business Class Hotel in the Central Business District long recognised for its high quality personal services and products. We are looking for an innovative and creative personnel with a hospitable aptitude to join us.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities
1. Ensures that accounts receivable and billing policies and procedures are properly implemented and in compliance with Hotel’s standards.
2. Ensures that the daily opening and closing report on the balances tally with the Opera system.
3. Ensures that the F&B daily credit card and city ledger transactions are accurately charged to the various accounts and entered accurately into the system in a timely basis.
4. Performs checks to ensure that all city ledger bills from F&B outlets are posted into the system tally with postings in the city ledger accounts.
5. Ensures that posting of city ledger folios is supported with the necessary documents.
6. Check and update payment advice.
7. Reconcile daily credit card transactions and credit card payments.
8. Prepare Proforma Invoices according to contracts / booking confirmations.
9. Prepare and send Statement of account (debtors and staff city ledger) on a timely basis.
10. Raises Request for Debit/Credit Notes/Adjustments and prepares Debit/Credit Notes when required.
11. Responsible for reconciliation of balances with SAP system and related systems.
12. Completes and submits month-end report to Accountant/Asst Financial Controller by the stipulated deadline.
13. Works closely with other sections/departments to resolve discrepancy on a timely basis.
14. Responsible in ensuring that the pseudo rooms that is billed to company are checked out from the Front Office System (Opera) and routed to AR Accounts for billing.
15. Process all refunds, including chargebacks.
16. Respond to and resolve all accounts / guests’ queries including credit card disputes.
17. Assist Credit Manager to follow up on payment.
18. Maintains the filing system for Accounts Receivables records
19. To carry out any other duties and responsibilities as and when assigned.

Education & Work Experience
1. GCE ‘O’/‘A’ Level with Accounting or Diploma in Business Studies /Accountancy or similar qualifications
2. 2 years’ experience in Accounts Receivable, preferably in a hotel environment
3. Possesses good analytical skills
4. Knowledge in hotel’s systems such as Opera, Infrasys, SAP preferred
5. Proactive, meticulous and independent individual

company_info: Fei Yue Community Services is a non-profit voluntary welfare organization established in 1996, with a mission to effect life transformation through the provision of quality social services. We are committed to serving and reaching out to the needy in Singapore through our diverse services and programmes. We believe in promoting social development among all ages, seek to inculcate the spirit of volunteerism in the community, and advocate strong family ties in the society. Our services and programmes, which are varied and cater to the needs of different client populations, include counselling, adoption, family life education, early intervention programmes for infants and children, and services for youths, elderly, inmates and their families.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Provides administrative and operational support which includes data entry, minutes taking, assistance to caseworkers and conducting administrative checks on cases
Assists in the planning and preparation of youth team programmes when necessary
Assist in maintaining centre day-to-day operations and centre maintenance
Assist in preparing reports for management, stakeholders and funders
Liaise with partners and stakeholders on corporate services, finance, facilities
Other duties as assigned by supervisor
Requirements:
Possess a min. Diploma
Preferably with 2 years of administrative experience
Possess good communication and interpersonal skills
Possess good attitude and able to work in a team
Proficient in Microsoft Applications
Systematic, Meticulous and attentive to details
Able to work with tight timeline
Able to work independently with minimum supervision
This position is on a 1 year contract basis
Work Location: Bukit Batok

Interested applicants are to submit their resume to recruit@fycs.org. Please visit www.fycs.org for more details.

title: Executive Assistant ( Perm with Competitive Salary)
company_info: PERSOLKELLY is one of the largest recruitment companies in Asia Pacific providing comprehensive end-to-end workforce solutions to clients. Headquartered in Singapore, the company was established in 2016 and is a joint venture between Kelly Services, Inc. and affiliates of PERSOL HOLDINGS Co. Ltd. Today, PERSOLKELLY operates more than 45 offices across 13 markets including Australia, China, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam. For more information, please visit www.persolkelly.com PERSOLKELLY Singapore Pte Ltd | EA License No. 01C4394
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
YOUR OPPORTUNITY
The position of Executive Assistant reports to the Officers to provide full administrative and executive business support to the Officers in a responsive, timely, accurate and effective manner. Assignment involves work of a confidential nature, exposure to sensitive information and contacts requiring considerable discretion, judgment, tactful and diplomacy.

ACCOUNTABILITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide full spectrum of logistical, administrative and personal support to the Officers.
Manage Officers’ calendars and schedules, ensuring accuracy and timely input. Provide agenda and meeting materials as needed.
Manage the travel and logistics arrangements, and process claims/expenses.
Interact professionally with all levels of management, staff and external parties across the region and internationally.
Schedule and setting up various local/regional meetings, arrange meeting venue and refreshment, and help facilitate at these meetings where necessary. Manage/assist in the logistic arrangements such as flights, hotel, transportation, visa application etc.
Coordinate government official’s visits by collaborating with respective departments for necessary preparations to ensure smooth proceedings. This includes but is not limited to arrangements for meeting venues, logistics, meals etc.
Support the Officer in following up on the status of projects / cross-functional tasks and assignments when required. Collaborate with other teams to ensure policies, procedures and timelines are met.
Assist in the preparation of business reports, presentations, materials, collating of data and consolidating of reports from the region.
Communicate on behalf of the Officers when delegated.
Support the Officers in the management of his/her IT equipment (e.g., laptop, printers and office phone), mobile devices as well as personal and corporate software applications.
Be responsive to emails/ text messages/ phone calls, with contact outside normal business hours where needed.
Manage proper archival and management of documents.
·Any other job/task assigned by Officers.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Possess at least a secondary education or equivalent with up to 4 years working experience in corporate / executive office, preferably with administrative/executive experience in a fast-pace MNC setting.
Proven track record in providing Executive Assistant support to C-Suite Level Executives
Demonstrated strong planning, organisational and time management skills and ability to proactively determine priorities and appropriate sequencing to accomplish daily expectations and handle multiple demands.
Excellence business writing and proofreading skills.
Requires a high level of interpersonal, social and customer service skills for daily interactions, both in person and digitally and work cooperatively as a team member.
Confident in exercising appropriate judgement while keeping stakeholders informed in a fast-paced work environment.
Must be flexible and detail oriented to meet strict deadlines and be capable of multi-tasking.
High proficiency in Microsoft Office 365, especially Excel and Power Point with the ability to produce graphs and charts.
Must be technologically savvy to IT equipment (e.g. video conferencing system).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Fluency in English required, other language skills are a plus.
Interested applicants, please click "APPLY" to begin your job search journey.

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
By sending us your personal data and curriculum vitae (CV), you are deemed to consent to PERSOLKELLY Singapore Pte Ltd and its affiliates to collect, use and disclose your personal data for the purposes set out in the Privacy Policy available at https://www.persolkelly.com.sg/policies. You acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree with the Privacy Policy.

PERSOLKELLY Singapore Pte Ltd • RCB No. 200007268E • EA License No. 01C4394• Reg No : R21101254 ( Tay Khai Ven)

title: Assistant / Executive Operations
company_info: Singapore Anglican Community Services is the community service arm of the Diocese of Singapore. It is a major psychiatric rehabilitation service provider in Singapore. It also offers care services for families-in-crisis and seniors to age-in-place. SACS's goal is to minister to those who are under-served and disadvantaged and to help them restore dignity, health and well-being, so that they have the opportunity to live life to its fullest potential.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
Coordinate with other departments and external parties to service the needs of the nursing home residents and the organization.
Supervise a team of operations staff to meet the daily needs of the nursing home residents, e.g. laundry, kitchen, cleaning, etc
Supervise Operations staff and Facility Technician & Facility Assistant to ensure smooth day-to-day operations
Job Responsibilities
Purchasing
Responsible for sourcing and timely procurement of equipment, consumable, furniture & fittings, and services in support of the Nursing Home. Tracking and monitor the Procurement activity. Verify vendor invoices against respective purchase orders and delivery orders as well as liaise with Accounts Department for timely payment to vendors
Handle contracts management and all aspects of vendor management, including the evaluation, selection and performance tracking, to ensure service requirements are met.
Work closely with various departments to support and meet the stakeholders’ and business requirement and communicate any supply problems which may impact on business operations.
Maintain historical records for annual accounting and MOH audits
Other ad-hoc tasks as assigned by Manager, Operations from time to time
Vendor Management
Assist the Operations/Designate to manage external vendors for the provision of supplies and services (Security, Landscape, Pest Control, Waste management, Housekeeping, Meals, etc)
Supervise the works of vendors and contractors and ensure that the works meet the contractual requirements and comply with health and safety regulations.
Conduct regular inspections on facilities & building maintenance, cleanliness, security service and food service provider to ensure high standard of deliveries.
Safety, Security & Workplace Safety and Health
Assist the Manager, Operations / Designate to execute the facility’s plans for workplace safety and fire safety
To carry out all reporting and investigation of security incidents happen in TJNH.
To assist and facilitate the yearly Pandemic Exercise
Co-ordinate with Fire Safety Manager for the b-yearly conduct of Table Top exercise and fire drill
Coordinate with group WSHO for conduct of bi-yearly safety orientation for all staff and quarterly Safety Committee Meeting
Guide and ensure outsource security officers are adhering to security protocol including managing of Visitor Management System (VMS)
Operations Administration
Raise Purchase Requisition Form and seek appropriate signatories for purchase of goods and services for operations team.
Compile and collate operational data for report purposes
Responsible to maintain database, provide data analysis and trending.
Prepare statistical and operations reports.
Monitor maintenance request data from request date to completion
Ensure preventive maintenance and ad-hoc repairs are completed in a timely manner.
Maintain repair work documentation and maintenance schedules
Manage IT matters and liaise with HQ for IT support.
Custodian of all keys. Administer issuance of keys to new joiners. Maintain master key press summary.
Perform any other tasks as assigned by Manager Operations/Designate including as an alternate driver if needs arises.
Main liaison with term contractors.
General Duties
Any other duties as assigned by the Manager, Operations.

Others
Working experience in healthcare setting would be an advantage

company_info: Founded in Year 1986, Shingda is one of the few local construction companies that specialize in the development of utilities main. Our core services centered on the design, construction and modification of Portable Water, NEWater, Industrial Water, Raw Water, Sewer and Gas pipelines. Our clienteles include the Public Utilities Board of Singapore, Changi Airport Group and the Defence Science & Technology Agency. Shingda is accredited with ISO 9001:2000, ISO 14001:2004 and OHSAS 18001:1999 and is registered with Building Construction Authority (BCA) under the Workhead of Cable / Pipe Laying & Road Reinstatement (CR07) and Civil Engineering Works (CW02). Align with our entrenched belief in business excellence, Shingda had been actively involved in the business excellence movement and is one of the few construction firms that have been accredited the prestigious Singapore Quality Class Star and Singapore Innovation Class. Singapore is fast becoming a focal centre for the water industry, with activities spanning the entire value chain of construction, design, operation and R&D. This, coupled with the government initiatives and emphasis on water conservation, has translated to more business opportunities for Shingda. Moving forward, Shingda is determined to further develop and enhance its core competencies to improve its market position in the total market volume with its emphasis on quality and professionalism.

title: Executive Assistant (PERM / UP TO 5.7K)
company_info: PERSOLKELLY is one of the largest recruitment companies in Asia Pacific providing comprehensive end-to-end workforce solutions to clients. Headquartered in Singapore, the company was established in 2016 and is a joint venture between Kelly Services, Inc. and affiliates of PERSOL HOLDINGS Co. Ltd. Today, PERSOLKELLY operates more than 45 offices across 13 markets including Australia, China, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam. For more information, please visit www.persolkelly.com PERSOLKELLY Singapore Pte Ltd | EA License No. 01C4394
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
YOUR OPPORTUNITY
The position of Executive Assistant reports to the Officers to provide full administrative and executive business support to the Officers in a responsive, timely, accurate and effective manner. Assignment involves work of a confidential nature, exposure to sensitive information and contacts requiring considerable discretion, judgment, tactful and diplomacy.
ACCOUNTABILITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES
· Provide full spectrum of logistical, administrative and personal support to the Officers.
· Manage Officers’ calendars and schedules, ensuring accuracy and timely input. Provide agenda and meeting materials as needed.
· Manage the travel and logistics arrangements, and process claims/expenses.
· Interact professionally with all levels of management, staff and external parties across the region and internationally. Work with the Officers’ direct reports and stakeholders locally and regionally on day-to-day operational issues, meetings and other matters, maintaining a high level of communication and ensure timely and accurate sharing of information.
· Schedule and setting up various local/regional meetings, arrange meeting venue and refreshment, and help facilitate at these meetings where necessary. Manage/assist in the logistic arrangements such as flights, hotel, transportation, visa application etc.
· Coordinate government official’s visits by collaborating with respective departments for necessary preparations to ensure smooth proceedings. This includes but is not limited to arrangements for meeting venues, logistics, meals etc.
· Support the Officer in following up on the status of projects / cross-functional tasks and assignments when required. Collaborate with other teams to ensure policies, procedures and timelines are met.
· Assist in the preparation of business reports, presentations, materials, collating of data and consolidating of reports from the region.
· Communicate on behalf of the Officers when delegated.
· Support the Officers in the management of his/her IT equipment (e.g., laptop, printers and office phone), mobile devices as well as personal and corporate software applications.
· Be responsive to emails/ text messages/ phone calls, with contact outside normal business hours where needed.
· Manage proper archival and management of documents.
· Any other job/task assigned by Officers.
CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS
· Ability to maintain in strict confidentiality all work and information assigned.
· Demonstrate professionalism at all times by demonstrating personal accountability, effective work habits, empathy and teamwork.
· Highly organized individual with the ability to exercise good judgement in diverse situations and balance multiple priorities.
· Communicate with clarity and maintain good relationships with other business units and entities.
· Proven experience in large organizations with complex structure. Comfortable with coordinating meetings/work tasks across multiple time zones.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
· Possess at least a secondary education or equivalent with up to 4 years working experience in corporate / executive office, preferably with administrative/executive experience in a fast-pace MNC setting.
· Proven track record in providing Executive Assistant support to C-Suite Level Executives with a high degree of discretion, confidentiality, professionalism, and attention to detail without missing the big picture.
· Demonstrated strong planning, organisational and time management skills and ability to proactively determine priorities and appropriate sequencing to accomplish daily expectations and handle multiple demands.
· Excellence business writing and proofreading skills.
· Requires a high level of interpersonal, social and customer service skills for daily interactions, both in person and digitally and work cooperatively as a team member.
· Ability to informally lead and influence others.
· Confident in exercising appropriate judgement while keeping stakeholders informed in a fast-paced work environment.
· Must be flexible and detail oriented to meet strict deadlines and be capable of multi-tasking.
· High proficiency in Microsoft Office 365, especially Excel and Power Point with the ability to produce graphs and charts.
· Must be technologically savvy to IT equipment (e.g. video conferencing system).
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
· Fluency in English required, other language skills are a plus.

Interested candidates may apply through the application system. We regret to inform only Shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Executive / Senior Executive Assistant, HR (Learning Development & Employee Engagement)
company_info: Yayasan MENDAKI (Council for the Development of Singapore Malay/Muslim Community) is a pioneer Self-Help Group formed in 1982 dedicated to empower the community through excellence in education, in the context of a multi-racial and multi-religious Singapore. MENDAKI's programmes largely target the bottom 30% of the Malay/Muslim population and are therefore highly subsidized. They are mostly preventive and developmental programmes to provide early assistance to the beneficiaries. The programmes are designed to supplement or complement national initiatives. MENDAKI works extensively with partners that share and support its vision and mission. They consist of government agencies, schools, mosques, Malay/Muslim organisations, employers, community centres and MAECs, family & student service centres and many more. If you are the highly capable individual with the right attitude and aptitude we are looking for, we want you to be part of our team to navigate, empower and position the Malay/Muslim community at the forefront of excellence!
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
The job holder (2-year contract) reviews and implements Training and Development policy and initiatives in the MENDAKI to ensure a structured total learning plan with a view to developing and grooming the staff for the organisation to meet the current and emerging challenges. The job holder reviews and implements staff engagement activities to foster a close relationship between staff and assist the Executive Officer / Senior Executive Officer to ensure that MENDAKI has a clear focus in the pursuit of organisational excellence and a high level of engaged employees.

Key Responsibility Areas
Employee Engagement
Assist in conducting organisation/employee engagement surveys and follow-up actions to close the gaps from the survey findings to improve the overall organisational health.
Assist in conducting feedback sessions, surveys and engagement activities to measure the views and engagement level of staff, such that organisation shortfalls can be identified to implement improvements.
Assist to coordinate and conduct action plan workshops for senior management to close the organization’s performance gaps.
Assist in planning and implementing organisation-wide activities/events, i.e.,
Townhall sessions, lunchtime workshops, etc., to promote interaction and communication amongst staff.
Implement values internalization and sustenance framework for all staff
Assist in the alignment of values with MENDAKI’s Mission and Vision. To maintain the behavioural statement for organisation values to guide staff in their desired behaviour.
Assist in implementing the values internalization plan and implement values sustenance activities for all staff.
Partner with external vendors to source for new ideas in implementing organisation-wide values internalization activities.
Conduct feedback, survey and promote understanding of desired behavior based on the values as part of the communication plan to all staff.
Maintain and review key training and development policies, training roadmap and Total Learning Plan
To review the staff training needs and the various competencies and skill sets based on the changes/ expanded job scopes and the training needs.
To ensure that staff are aware of MENDAKI’s training and development policy frameworks and the updates to the policies.
To assist the EO/SEO in developing the functional competencies for the various job families.

Identify training programmes based on the training and development needs of staff
Plan and design publicity materials to encourage staff participation.
Facilitate in-house/ workshops, talks, courses and sharing sessions including logistics support.
Conduct feedback processes for various training programmes
Sufficient training is organised for different groups within MENDAKI to meet the KPI of 60 hours.
Ensure that the participation rate of each training activity is acceptable (ie. meets the target set during the planning phase).
Review and conduct orientation and induction programme
Assist in the conduct of the induction and orientation programme, ensuring all scheduled activities/ programmes are aligned with the orientation framework.
Conduct feedback and review programmes for improvements.
To ensure that new staff are orientated to MENDAKI within the framework.
Coordinate the award of the MENDAI scholarships for internal and external candidates
Assist in developing the publicity and marketing materials for scholarship runs.
Assist in the conduct selection of applicants and proposed for management considerations, through the selection interviews.
Monitor the payment schedule manage the budget allocated for the scholarship and ensure the timely payout to scholars.
Manage internship and other engagement activities of scholars. e. Regular engagement with scholars to develop a sense of pride and belonging to the organization.

Manage the application for Overseas Training and Work Trips
Review and update the overseas training processes, based on IRAS-Overseas policy.
Verify the submission, learning objectives, subsistence allowances and supporting documents, and process the procurement of air tickets, accommodations, insurance, etc.
Inform staff on the results of the request and request for emergency contact details for overseas training trips, monitor and track the trips’ progress.
Monitor and track the usage of the overseas training funds, submission of claims and training reports.
Maintain and supervise the training processes in the HRMS training portal
To ensure a smooth process for staff in the application of training and record capturing.
To ensure that the Training module system is up to date.
Any other tasks and/or projects assigned during the tour of service by the HOD

Requirements
A good diploma or degree in any field
At least 2 years of relevant experience in training and organisation development
Good communications skills
Strong interpersonal, analytical and strategic thinking skills
A good team player
Someone who is people-oriented and confident in engaging and building relationships with various stakeholders

Far East Organization is the largest private property developer in Singapore, having developed over 780 developments across all segments of real estate including 55,000 private homes in Singapore since its establishment in 1960. Far East Organization includes three listed entities: Far East Orchard Limited, Far East Hospitality Trust and Yeo Hiap Seng Limited. Far East Organization is the winner of 14 FIABCI World Prix d’Excellence awards, the highest honour in international real estate. In 2022, Far East Organization is listed as top 50 of The Straits Time’s Singapore Best Employers Study. We believe in taking care of the total well-being of our people as they grow with us. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
We are seeking a dedicated and highly organized Executive Secretary to the Director / Executive Director to provide comprehensive administrative support.

The ideal candidate will excel in multitasking, possess excellent communication skills, and have a strong attention to detail. This role requires discretion, professionalism, and the ability to handle sensitive information with utmost confidentiality.

Key Responsibilities
Calendar Management: Proactively manage and prioritize the Executive Directors’ meetings and appointments, ensuring efficient use of their time.
Written Communication: Draft, proofread, and edit a variety of documents, including correspondence, contracts, meeting minutes, reports, speeches, and presentations. Prepare official information releases for internal and external circulation, maintaining high-quality standards.
Meeting Coordination: Organize and attend meetings, take detailed minutes (when applicable), and ensure prompt and accurate dissemination of communications from Senior Management to internal and external parties.
Event Planning: Lead or actively participate in the planning and execution of business conferences, luncheons, and dinners involving internal and external stakeholders.
Project Management: Manage and maintain Senior Management's special and strategic projects, handling confidential information
Team Collaboration: Lead and collaborate with cross-divisional teams on special projects, ensuring effective communication and project completion.
Onboarding Support: Facilitate a smooth onboarding process for top executives and new joiners within the Division, including coordinating logistics and necessary resources.
Travel Planning: Manage travel arrangements for the Executive Directors, including itinerary planning, accommodation, transportation, and expense reporting.
Driver Liaison and Vehicle Management: Coordinate with drivers and oversee vehicle maintenance to ensure the Director / Executive Director transportation needs are met efficiently and safely

Bachelor's degree/Diploma in a relevant field preferred.
Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or Personal Assistant to senior executives.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and work under pressure.

title: Admin Executive (Finance & Logistics)
company_info: Compass Group is the world’s leading food service company, specialising in providing food, vending and related contract services on their clients’ premises. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Highlights:
Monday - Friday Workdays

Awesome office and amazing colleagues
Some of the great things we will provide:
Paid time off
Medical benefits
An awesome & collaborative working environment
Amazing work spaces
Delicious onsite food
+many more!

Snapshot of Your Role
The Administration Executive assists and supports the Finance Manager and Singapore food team on all administrative requirements, to facilitate the coordination of cross-functional collaboration and key team meetings, deliverables and reporting. The responsibilities of the role include maintaining records for all transactions, preparing monthly and quarterly financial reports and processing reimbursements. This role must be highly organized, proactive, strong-communicator and skilled at building relationships and seeing opportunities to connect both internally within Compass as well as with the client account. This role focuses on administrative support of the food service program leadership along with meeting coordination, key meeting action taking.

The great things you will be expected to do:
Finance Support
Create and update spreadsheets of daily transactions
Review and process reimbursements
Maintain reports on financial metrics, data collection
Keep records of invoices
Identify, address and resolve account discrepancies
Payment claim submission & verification
Support the department on weekly cost tracking, management and reporting
Logistics Support
Ensure proper record keeping and filing of shipping transactions for the Finance Department to process payment to suppliers
Track and verify accuracy of inbound and outbound shipping documents
Maintaining and updating of product models inclusive of product number, product specifications, and expected end of life of product
Coordination with transportation/freight forwarders of incoming/outgoing shipment
Preparation of related shipping/import/export documents (eg. Shipping invoice, packing lists, delivery order, certificate of origins etc.)
Ensure compliance of company procurement policies and procedures
Provide daily status updates of all procurement status and shipments
Ensure operations run smoothly and take care of outstanding orders pending for billing
Key skills & qualifications
EDUCATION & QUALIFICATION
Minimum Diploma in finance related studies from a recognized educational provider or equivalent
Preferably possesses ACCA certification
WORK EXPERIENCE
Minimum 2 to 4 years' relevant experience in admin executive support function, preferably in finance and/or logistics
Food and Services industry preferred but not essential
Preferably with background in F&B supply chain management
COMPETENCIES
Computer literacy with advance abilities in spreadsheets and presentation software tools (Microsoft excel and powerpoint; or Google Sheets and Slides)
Experience in SAP ERP
ATTRIBUTES
Possess critical thinking and problem solving skills
Excellent decision-making and stakeholder management capabilities
Resourceful, adaptable with an agile mindset to navigate uncertainties
Detailed and result oriented
Good communications skills, with client, team and all other stakeholders
Analytical and strong organizational skills, with excellent verbal and written ability
Self-motivated, decisive, with the ability to adapt to changes and competing demands
Proven ability to work creatively, analytically, systematically in a collaborative manner
Proven ability to work in an ambiguous environment and collaborate across multiple areas in order to achieve a common business objective

Calling all talented Individuals who have passion for F&B industry!
We are looking for reliable and innovative Management Executive to supervise the operations of our existing and upcoming new outlets. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Provide overall support to the CIO – full diary management and Travel & Expenses
Proactively and efficiently manage the CIO’s diary and meeting schedules both in Singapore and while travelling.
Ensure s/he is well prepared and supported for an extensive range of meetings with internal and external stakeholders; which include organizing meeting venues/video conferences, prepare agenda’s and presentations, pre-meeting briefings, record and distribute minutes of meetings, follow-up action plans accordingly.

Prepare, follow up on receipts and submit expense claims.
Ensure timely submission of the expense report within the amex card deadline
Comprehensive travel arrangements for local and international travel
Manage the overall process of visa application, flight bookings, hotel accommodation and transportation arrangements.
Plan and prepare travel itinerary and meeting agendas
Coordinate with the respective EAs/PAs to manage the travel itineraries and meeting agendas of visiting Senior Management from the Group or Region.
Act as a key contact point between internal and external stakeholders, arrange meetings as appropriate, and maintain good communication and relationships. Liaises with Senior Executives of the Company and with external Senior Executives from partners, vendors etc.
Monitor CIO’s work deadlines for both internal and external commitments, e.g. management meetings, presentations, reports, conferences/events, and projects.
Prepare and maintain the team organisation charts
Manage emails and telephone calls professionally, re-direct or take messages and proactively deal with issues in a timely and efficient manner.
Use discretion and judgment in the absence of the CIO and his leadership team to manage or refer urgent matters to the appropriate senior management staff.
Assist new joiners to the Technology team with their onboarding into the organisation
Manage internal visitor’s and external guests visits to the Singpaore regional office ensuring that all details of visits are professionally managed
Co-ordinates daily administrative functions for the team and performs other ad hoc duties as and when required eg. assistance with presentations, managing business contact database etc.
Organise conferences/events, social lunches/dinners, and regional/management meetings hosted by the CIO.

Proficient at an intermediate to advanced level with the Microsoft Office suite of tools, ability to use all tools daily for work and to learn new technology

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary

- Assists Executive Housekeeper to supervise and maintain the cleanliness of all guest rooms and public areas including the garden. Ensure that all guest laundry, uniforms and hotel linens are cleaned to the specifications of the hotel.

- Oversees the scheduling of staff and outsourced contractors.

- Assumes the responsibilities of the Executive Housekeeper in the absence of the Executive Housekeeper.

Job Responsibilities include, but are not limited to

1. Planning and Organising.

- Oversees the housekeeping activities on the guest floors, public areas, uniform, linen room and laundry.

- Delegates planned schedule to the Assistant Housekeeper.

- Conducts weekly meetings with supervisors and monthly meetings with room attendants.

- Conducts daily briefing with Assistant Housekeeper.

- Ensures the smooth operation of the department.

- Ensures safekeeping of all master keys, communication devices and lost & found items in the Housekeeping office.

- Handles guests’ complaints concerning the department, implementing systems and guidelines to prevent future complaints.

- Ensures that hotel grounds are properly maintained.

- Ensures that a proper pest control program is executed according to schedule.
Schedules repair jobs with external contractors and ensure that the jobs are completed satisfactorily.

- Liaises with Maintenance and Front Office on a preventive maintenance programme.

2. Staffing

- Interviews and selects suitable candidates for the department

- Ensures that new staff is properly trained before carrying out actual duties

- Evaluate staff work performance by constantly tracking and reviewing their progress and taking the necessary remedial measures where required.

- Encourages and recognize staff for a well-performed job.

- Responsible for the dismissal/disciplinary action of staff if their job performance is below expectation or in case of misconduct.

- Monitors and ensures staff compliance to hygiene and grooming standards of Housekeeping.

3. Daily Checks

- Monitors and checks all floral arrangements in public areas/outlets and rooms.

- Ensures that daily cleaning of public areas and garden are carried out effectively.

- Empower the housekeeping supervisors and the Assistant Housekeeper to supervise the staff, ensuring that all rooms are cleaned according to the expected standards of the hotel.

- Inspects the guest rooms daily before the arrivals of the VIPs/guest.

- Follow up on all Out of Order/ Service room blocking.

- Makes daily checks on the corridors, public areas and function rooms to ensure that the expected standard of the hotel is met.

- Monitors wear and tear and seek advice from the Management for necessary action.

- Reviews and reports any outstanding matters of the previous day with Assistant

- Executive Housekeeper and Executive Housekeeper

- Checks all operating equipment to ensure that they are in good working condition

- Ensures that all housekeeping personnel are using the correct work methods and equipment to carry out their duties so as to maintain the expected standards of the hotel.

- Conducts checks on all incoming VIPs and vacant/occupied and night turn down rooms.
Inspects corridor pantries, staircases, function rooms, public areas and staff lockers.

- Liaise with contractors on schedules for cleaning pest control and gardening etc.

4. Coordination with Front Office and Maintenance

- Works closely with Front Office and Maintenance in order to coordinate room and maintenance work/program.

5. Stock Control

- Controls stock requisitions for supplies to rooms and public areas.

- Ensures proper issuance/ usage of cleaning chemicals for effective results.

- Initiates, supervise and follow up on the purchase of cleaning agents, new equipment and products for the department.

6. Annual Budget Planning BUDGET PLANNING

- Assists Executive Housekeeper in preparing the annual budget for the department

7. Contracts

- Ensures that all contracts for the department are fulfilled according to the terms and conditions specified.

- Responsible for the renewal of contracts based on the hotel’s requirements.

- Ensures that the contractors are informed of the absenteeism of contract staff on the monthly basis.

8. Linen Room/ Laundry

- Oversees the daily operation of the linen room/ laundry.

- Ensures that all house linen is cleaned satisfactorily according to the hotel’s standard.

-Ensures that staff uniform and guest laundry/ dry cleaning are done professionally.

- Ensures that contract laundry services do the right billing and submit it to the Accounts department.

-Responsible for the overall inventory control of house linen/ uniform.

- Ensures that the Rooms and F & B linen inventory and operating equipment inventory were carried out smoothly on a quarterly basis.

9. Others

- In charge of all fire wardens at the guest room areas and conduct roll calls at the assembly area.

- Performs any other duties as may be assigned from time to time by the Management

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Purpose

The primary objective of this role is to input and consolidate data, conduct reconciliation, verify information, prepare monthly financial reports, manage quarterly budget follow-up reports, address inquiries, and provide assistance to the Team Lead, Accounts, and/or Technical Fleet Manager in handling any ad hoc Accounts-related tasks that may arise.

Responsibilities

- Review and validate the monthly/quarterly financial reports submitted by Technical Management and communicate any discrepancies or request clarifications as needed.

- Examine and prepare funding requests for vessel Managers, ensuring the monthly funds schedule is kept up to date.

- Perform monthly bank reconciliations for vessels.

- Verify payroll entries on a monthly basis.

- Validate the accuracy of opening balances for onboard cash accounts, provisions, and bond stores.

- Ensure that all cash purchases made onboard are substantiated with proper original receipts.

- Confirm that all expenses are appropriately documented.

- Ensure that expenses are categorized correctly and approved by the relevant Crewing Manager, Vessel Manager, and Fleet Manager when necessary.

- Validate the distribution of insurance-related expenses.

- Verify the balance sheet items for Managers' vessels on a monthly basis.

- Post journal entries, as required, including those related to Owner-Manager Disbursement and other accounting entries or adjustments pertaining to financial reports.

- Prepare and submit monthly reports to vessel owners and stakeholders within the established deadlines.

- Ensure the completeness and adequacy of all supporting documents.

Qualifications

- Hold a diploma in accounting and/or finance or possess an equivalent qualification from a professional accounting body.

- Have a minimum of 3 years of working experience in a related field.

- Display proficiency in MS Office applications, particularly MS Excel.

- Possess a strong command of the English language.

- Preferred: Previous work experience with a shipping company.

Our 27,000 square feet facility has 3 large freezer rooms with a total capacity of about 500 standard pallet space, chiller rooms and dry goods storage space. Starting off primarily with import and distribution activities, we have since started a sister company ( Quix Pte Ltd ) that does fresh Food Processing on site. With this new activity, we now service all the major convenience store chains and petrol stations, supplying them with an interesting basket of goods. We are able to service them by breaking bulk for fresh items and dealing with very specialized Freeze – Thaw logistics. As a result, we are an ideal distributor for product lines which have shorter shelf lives in a “fresh” condition and would require smaller but more frequent visits to the outlets.​

title: Executive Assistant
company: SCIENCE STUDIOS LEARNING CENTRE PTE. LTD.
company_info: Science Studios is a leading MOE-registered education centre that specialises in the teaching of primary school science. We have been featured in several media articles including: The Straits Times (Hands-on activities spark kids’ curiosity), The New Paper (Helping pupils connect science lessons with the real world), The Sunday Times (Gifted kids get tuition too), and Moneysmart.sg (Top 3 maths & science tuition centres in Singapore). We have also received hundreds of raving reviews from students and parents for our innovative approach to teaching science in a fun, yet effective, manner. We currently have 3 branches at the following locations: Bukit Timah, Marine Parade and Newton. Find out more about us @ www.ScienceStudios.com.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Executive Assistant
ㅤEmbark on a meaningful career to make a real difference in the lives of children!
ㅤScience Studios is a leading education centre specialising in the teaching of primary school science through engaging experiments and excellent printed materials. Learning at Science Studios is also supplemented by, and enhanced through, proprietary online resources.
ㅤWe believe children should enjoy learning in order to achieve better grades. We go the extra mile to carefully design, prepare, and deliver each lesson so that students are engaged and have fun learning. For many students, coming to Science Studios is one of the highlights of their week! If you want a positive work environment where you can make a real difference, this is the right place for you!
ㅤWe currently have 3 branches across Singapore: West (Bukit Timah Plaza), Central (Balmoral Plaza) and East (Eastgate at Katong). An EA should be able to work at the different locations as required.
Job Description
ㅤAs an Executive Assistant, you will work closely with the directors to provide administrative support and ensure the smooth running of the business.
ㅤThe role of an Executive Personal Assistant is wide ranging and leverages on her multi-tasking ability. From project management to scheduling appointments and travel itineraries, an Executive PA can expect to enjoy a busy but varied work schedule. You will liaise with staff, suppliers and clients; organise events; manage inventories and databases; conduct research for business-related procedures and preparing corresponding reports; collate company expenses; handle HR-related matters including annual/medical leave administration.
ㅤSome of the other responsibilities include:
• Communicate with customers regarding SS programmes, fees, replacement classes, etc.
• Prepare apparatus for experiments. This includes purchasing and maintaining inventory.
• Mark quizzes and monitor students’ progress to help them achieve better grades.
Requirements
+ Passionate about enriching children's lives through effective education.
+ Commendable work ethic. Willing to go the extra mile whenever necessary.
+ Maintain high standards with a strong attention to detail. Thorough and accurate when accomplishing assigned tasks.
+ Able to work on weekends (Sunday from 12 noon, and Saturday).
[2 weekdays, including Fridays, will be rest days. You'll be able to avoid weekend crowds on your rest days. Furthermore, there is no need to work on most weekends in June and December.]

title: Executive Assistant, Business Office | AR and Debt Collection
company_info: Khoo Teck Puat Hospital (KTPH), a 659-bed general and acute care hospital, opened in June 2010. Serving more than 700,000 people living in the northern sector of Singapore, KTPH combines medical expertise with high standards of personalised care, set within a healing environment, to provide care that is good enough for our own loved ones. From intuitive wayfinding to logical clustering of services, KTPH's design is focused on providing a hassle-free experience for patients. The hospital has been designed with patients’ comfort in mind. Since its opening, the building has garnered numerous awards for its green and energy efficient design. Patients can enjoy comfortable accommodation in different categories of wards with views of greenery and naturally cool air from improved ventilation. KTPH also provides a wide range of outpatient specialist services.
address: KHOO TECK PUAT HOSPITAL, 90 YISHUN CENTRAL 768828
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Executive Assistant ensures healthy patient receivable ratio through prompt collections and minimal bad debts.
MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
(A) SPECIFIC
Accounts Receivables (AR)
1. Generate AR Aging report (SAP AR module) and ensure monthly balance ties with General Ledger (SAP GL module). Follow up with system vendor for any discrepancies in report balances.
2. Check for irregular accounts (e.g. long outstanding or negative balances) and liaise with patients or Finance Shared Services (FSS) team for closure. Inform Executive/Senior Executive on follow-up actions taken.
3. Check with FSS on status of bills/accounts outsourced by latter to appointed collection agents (CAs), with attention to long outstanding accounts held by CAs.
4. Inform Executive/Senior Executive on FSS proposals for legal actions against recalcitrant patients.
5. Closely monitor and follow up with Operations department on dun-block requests (i.e. stopping the sending of reminder letters pending resolution of disputes between patient and hospital) to ensure release of block and bill closure (payments or waiver) on settlement of issues.
6. Create third party payer codes based on request forms submitted by Operations team. Check the form for proper approval before creation of code.
7. Check and housekeep third party payer codes to ensure only relevant ones are in use.
8. Work with Business Development team on contract schemes received from corporations and ensure that payment terms and conditions are indicated correctly in the contracts to protect institution interest.
9. Prompt update and notification of frontline operations on new/revised contract schemes.
10. Check bill waiver request forms submitted by Operations team and ensure proper approval is obtained from relevant department heads before processing bill waiver in SAP.
11. Receive application for instalment payments and liaise with patient on payment schedule approved by Executive or Manager.
12. Refer patients to Medical Social Services for financial assessment, on request.
13. Process write-off for small value accounts and submit bad debt write-off proposal from FSS for higher-level approval.
14. Process clearing of patient AR in SAP against approved funds or budgets, or based on waivers and write-offs approval.
15. Follow up and draft responses to patients’ requests for financial assistance, raised through their Member of Parliament (MP). Seek advice from Executive or Manager for more complex requests.
16. Manage and direct enquiries where necessary to relevant departments in relation to settlement of patient accounts.
Deposit Collection (Inflight)
1. Generate reports on outstanding deposits pending collection from inflight patients (i.e. patients warded in hospital) and financial counseling status on daily basis, and send them to the inpatient Financial Counselling team.
2. Monitor and ensure that timely collection and financial counselling (or re-counselling) are performed by the Financial Counselling Officers (FCOs).
3. Identify cases with potential collection issues/difficulties and highlight these cases to relevant departments (clinical and operations units) for necessary action.
4. Advise, guide and assist FCOs in ensuring all avenues of inflight collections are explored (for example, remind FCOs to request for Letter of Guarantees for corporate patients or advise patients to check for insurance cover, etc).
5. Work closely with FSS to activate CAs or issue Letter of Demand to delinquent payers where necessary.
6. Liaise and follow up with relevant Ministries on inflight cases requiring their attention, such as reporting delinquent employers (of foreign workers) to Ministry of Manpower or submitting requests to Ministry of Health for financial assistance under relevant government schemes.
(B) GENERAL
1. Manage audit queries.
2. Other duties as assigned by Executive and Manager.
